review_body: Had a wonderful time staying here. Wonderful staff and in a great location, close to many restaurants and just a block away from the beach. Rooms very clean and spacious. Highly recommend the Palm Suite, it easily has plenty of room for 3-4 people.

The Imperial's location is the best feature. Many newer resorts have more to offer. But as timeshare trades go, this place was fine. We could walk to all the Waikiki spots. March had plenty of tropical rain and thunderstorms. Staff was polite and helpful. (our stay coincided with the beginning of the pandemic) My only complaint would be the $20- a day parking. We skipped parking by doing daily car rentals (Hertz is on site) every other day. The Bus was convenient as long as weather cooperated.

The staff, lobby, house keeping, conciere (Diana), owners lounge and elevators were good. The best feature was the Island Deli in the back of the ABC store. Do check it out.The bad. Had a room on the 4th floor facing a parking garage and the roar of it's large ventilation fans. The bathroom was tiny and hasn't been updated in many years. Judging by the layout this 1 bdrom unit may have been 2 motel units at one time. The living (?) area had a murpfy bed, dresser, couch, dining table w/4 chairs and a kitchenette. A lack of outlets and desk required me to move the dining table to the murpfy bed area in order to work on my computer.Stayed here 2 weeks as a timeshare exchange. Maybe that is why I got a lower class room. Due to flight changes I needed one extra day lodging. Front desk quoted me an owners rate for that pathetic room of $210 for one night. Could have booked online for $150. Decided to go elsewhere. Thermostat for each rm was old style and difficult to find a sweet spot for temp.This place brags that it is close to Waikiki Beach. Maybe if you could fly over the other hotels. In reality there is a bit of a walk. Lots of street noise.

This is a nice resort one block off the beach. the staff are nice and they help as much as they can. We were given a room on close to the bottom floor. The windows were 5 feet above the floor and could not be looked out. there was nothing to see anyway, except a service alley. seemed like a basement. The rest of the resort was very nice. just a poor room

We stayed a week here and loved it. It’s nothing fancy but the room was clean and the staff helpful and friendly. The location is very convenient to the beach, shopping and restaurants. We loved Nahe at the front desk. She always had a big smile and a friendly hello. We would stay at this timeshare again for sure.

Our studio room was newly remodeled very clean we had a ocean Peakview. Bed was very comfy. All areas of the hotel very clean. Great hot tub’s. Great location. Customer service was excellent. Automobile parking was inexpensive it compared to other areas of Waikiki

This resort is showing its age and is probably not worth fixing as it would cost way too much. Its only plus is its location 5 minutes from the beach. Just note that the beach is sandy until you get into the water where there are pieces of sharp coral rock and large slippery stones. We tried out the roof-top pool, but when the wind comes up you can feel the building move so we did not feel safe. Stay away from the lobby stores, which are over-priced and the saleswoman in the clothing store was really pushy. We just wanted to look and she talked us right out of the store.

We have stayed at this resort other times and for the price can’t beat, its steps from ocean, shopping and right in the heart of all the action . People are really friendly here and very accommodating. This is perfect for the whole experience. Don’t need to spend 500 a night to get the great feel of Hawaii .

Enjoyed another great stay at the Imperial. We love the location and are happy with some of the renovations. We have been here numerous times and will return. Location is great for the beach, shopping, dining and other activities. Almost feels like home!

Nice friendly staff! Clean rooms. Nice walking distance to the beach and Denny’s attached to it! Our room was updated, could have used a few more plug ins And the vanity was a bit small but otherwise ok.

Upon arrival for a week stay we were assigned a suite on a lower level that looked out at the wall of the adjoining property, and above the air conditioning equipment also for the adjoining property. We were told we could request a change of suites the next morning which we did. The initial response was nothing else was available, then, yes, we could move up a few floors - a few not being defined. We returned to the rental office a little later and asked to see the new suite which we saw and requested a change. It was in the same tier but a high floor where we could at least see other buildings around us, but still over the air conditioning equipment. This made the use of the balcony somewhat usable as it was not in the first unit. Unit was okay but difficult to get cooled down during the day time when the sun came in - had to keep the shades closed all day. Location is very good with good restaurants within walking distance as was the Hop On/Hop Off main terminal.

We loved this property as it was located right down town. Very good location for people who do not have a car to drive around. Also the buses were at our door step. The beach was walking distance and very beautiful. The restaurants were all on the main street and the entertainment was excellent.. We had a good time and would recommend this property to friends and family. The manager Michelle was amazing and accommodating and the staff very friendly.

Good location friendly staff, very helpful, clean room lovely members lounge with live music and fireworks Friday night. A great ABC store with food connected to Imperial. Also a Dennys connected to the Imperial as well.

We arrived into Honolulu last night. We exchanged a week of timeshare to stay at The Imperial Hawaii Resort. The foyer is clean and welcoming. The lady attending the front desk, going on midnight, was excellent!! She was kind, informative and very friendly. We felt very welcomed, even at such a late hour, and after a full day of travel! We booked a one bedroom with living room, which is fairly roomy, clean and comfortable, except the bathroom is small. We were cold the first night. Our room thermometer said 60 F. We tried to bring it up to 68, but it stayed 60 all night. So, sure missed our home comforter...they have only sheets/thin blanket for bedding. We are used to heavier bed covers! The air was turned too low...we will have to figure it out, so we are not cold through the night. We love that there is a Denny’s on site!! We had a good breakfast there this morning. And, it is always a plus to have an ABC’s store near. There is one just off the foyer. Additionally, we love access to the 26th floor as timeshare owners! Our room has a fridge, microwave, toaster and coffeemaker. No stove; but, we are allowed to use the stove on the 26th floor. There is a small, warm pool on the roof top, along with lounge chars. On the 3rd floor is a sauna, jacuzzi, fitness room and laundry. Today, we found all the staff we came in contact with very welcoming. We will miss having our own stove in our room, as we do like to make a few meals on our own. There are no BBQ units. We do like this facility and if you are in the area, we think you will too!!

Great place to stay it was central to everything extremely well priced its a block back from the beach but is so close to everything it was amazing. The rooms were a little bit old but extremely clean the staff was helpful & always happy to see you

Though the area has changed, this was a large part of my living in Waikiki 1987-92. I enjoyed the valet parking by calling in advance $100 weekly fee was the best value. Waikiki streets can be confusing so please be careful.The staff was warm and friendly. the 27th floor view and pool were very nice. Righfully so the pool was closed several days with high winds. The nearby Friday night fireworks were viewed with many others on the 26th floor. New Jaquzzis on the third floor were a welcome find! Live Hawaiian music nearby 7 nights a week at the Kani Kapila bar with tasty nightly local food. specials. the Blue note and other music venues are with in walking distance.

Our stay was booked in February. We traveled with our daughter and her family. We were told when we arrived that our rooms were not on the same floor. We also did not get the rooms reserved but went ahead and opted for the larger room as it was only$80.00 more for a 6 night stay. The rooms are much smaller than they appear on the website but seriously, who goes here to stay in the room??? The pool area was smaller than we expected but was never crowded and has a fantastic view. There is an ABC store attached which is very convenient. There is also a Denny's. We enjoyed the free lei making in the lobby. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We were given a tour (by chance) of the owners lounge. What a view!! Shopping and the beach are so convenient. On the down side, we apparently had termites in one of the bathrooms. The view from our room was partial Oceanview and the parking garage. Our daughter had a beautiful Oceanview. I would stay again if I ever returned however that's unlikely. There are many more islands to see!

This was our second time staying at the Imperial Hotel and we were even more impressed this time. With many long time employees everyone was super friendly and remembered us from our first short visit from earlier this year. The accommodations are beautiful and very clean. The staff super friendly and helpful. Thank you Tony for helping us with our reservation. 2 other couples decided to trade hotels and move over to the Imperial when they saw how awesome it is!! We will be back. The sooner the better for us!!

We really enjoyed our stay at The Imperial Hawaii Resort. The high-rise is a block from the beach, and right across the street from the new mega-complex anchored by Halekulani and the Beach Walk mall. We decided to rent a car for this week of our multi-week trip, and the valet staff was efficient and went out of their way to make sure things were easy for us. All of the staff was terrific, and really made us feel like family. We had a studio room with a murphy bed, and had plenty of room to move around while it was down - we left it open the whole week. Our room faced Lewers St, and we could watch the people walking around and see the tiki torches on the sidewalk - it was nice, and quieter than we thought it would be, being so close to the busy street. We hope to be able to return, and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if a trade is available to us.

We stayed for four nights and were on the 20th floor so had a sideways view towards the ocean. We were in the palm suite with a family of five _ well worth the extra bathroom. Location is great _ hotel smack in the middle of a fabulous part of waikiki and a block back from beach. Room size for five is tight but we managed and worth it for great location and price. We, would stay again. Staff were helpful and friendly.

I’ll start with the pros, they are fewer. The location is fantastic. In the heart of Waikiki, steps to the beach and plenty of restaurants and shops, many high end. Everyone we met who was staying there was unbelievably nice. The unit was updated a bit but not fully. The kitchen was new and bathroom sink but the shower looked about 25 years old and the wallpaper was peeling in spots. Strange that they would go to the effort and not do the whole thing. The two negatives are significant. The unit had two outdoor patios that looked out on a parking garage. It was noisy and not attractive to say the least and made the unit very dark. Didn’t feel like we were in Hawaii until we left the unit. Lastly and probably the worst was our terrible reception when we arrived. This was a timeshare exchange that my sister gave me for my birthday. We didn’t do an official transfer, didn’t know we needed to. When you’ve been on a 12 hour flight, the last thing you need is trouble checking in. They were so unhelpful but finally agreed to give us a room if we paid for it. And it took three conversations to get the charges removed. We shouldn’t have been charged at all since this was a timeshare! I would up calling my sister late at night because of the time change to confirm she was giving me the unit but they wouldn’t speak to her. Wanted her to fax - is it 1983? - her ID with a signed letter giving her permission. After much wrangling, they agreed to an email from her, as long as it was clear that it was her email address with a photo ID. Seriously? Needless to say, it soured our stay. Not everyone is going to have this experience but it doesn’t take much of an effort to treat your guests well. Make them feel welcome, not like scammers. It’s called hospitality.

I stayed in a high level room with a nice view. The decor is older style with a pull out bed, but comfortable. Has a small kitchenette with amenities, great for eating in. It's in a good location at the top of Lewers St. Short walk to the beach. There's a farmer's market opposite a few times a week and a large ABC store directly below. I would recommend this hotel.

Be aware of the pull down beds in the studio but besides that the property is perfect for your stay. Minimum of 1 BR would be required if you do not want to sleep in a pull down bed. Also, very nice host room for timeshare owners.

Even the view from the appartement is not "impressive" (depending of the location) the view from the Ownerslounge at the 26th floor is excellent.The cleanliness is good.The location is excellent. Everything (shops, beach) are just a few minute- walk away.

Great location beach and shop and more It’s not a mega resort with lot of ground and beautiful gardens but it make up with the view and the quietness the clubhouse is the view of sunset to die for and the friendly staffs we feel the Aloha spirit here and our friends love it here too Mahalo !

My Birthday Blast was great. Thanks to Lisa at Elite Concierge for helping me plan all of my excursions. My room was very clean and spacious. The front desk employees were fabulous and valet knew me when i picked up my car daily. Friday's fireworks on the rooftop was great. I had such a awesome time while in Honolulu and being so close to the beach made it better

This is an older resort, but the maintenance and upkeep has been kept up. Although the unit was smaller, because of location, it was convenient for most of our wants and needs. With Denny's restaurant, and ABC store located in the same building, this took care of immediate needs. Trolley service is the best way to go, so unless you need to travel to sites that are out of the trolley service area. Concierge Diana was most helpful in getting tours, trolley service and just answering questions. Don't miss out on the farmers market located across the street for food, fresh produce, malasadas (famous 'donuts') and arts and crafts for purchase. will be back

Check in was confusing. You have to park in front of the ABC store. The view from the room was excellent. I liked the pool table. We watched the Huskies and played pool for three hours. I liked the hot tub and location.

The Imperial is an awesome place to stay. The location is great. One block from the beach. Lots of nice stores for shopping, the ABC store right downstairs, along with great restaurants within a block. The Yardhouse, P.F. Changs, etc. Every single employee from the Front Desk, housekeeping, to the Valets are all so nice & helpful. We would definitely stay here again. We were on the 19th Floor and had a pretty good view of Wakiki Beach, with a nice balcony to sit on to watch the waves & surfers. We didnt spend too much time in the room, as we were gone everyday, but the room was very nice, as well.

We stay here for a week in July 2019. It is very convenience. You don't need a car because everything is close enough, you can walk to all of restaurants, beaches ...If you are a share time owner you can watch the firework on Friday evening. It is beautiful. Everything is good for us.

A good 4 star complex, very convenient to Waikiki beach and city center. Rooms of a good size. Try and get higher up to avoid any noise. Apartment well fitted out with microwave, cooking facilities and a coffee machine

Overall a good experience. Excellent location of the resort and friendly staff. Small unit and average looking but I would definitely recommend it because of the central location in the ''million dollar block".

Good location. There is a Dennys right in the building and an ABC market right next door . 5 minute walk to a nice Beach with a great cement Boardwalk . Clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Fireworks every Friday night that you can see in the owner's Lounge at the top of the building. We had an efficiency which was a bit crowded but the only real complaint is the bed was a Murphy bed that you pulled out of the wall or the sofa turn into a bed. Neither was vert comfortable. All in all, I would stay again.

Loved the location - so close to everything. We had 3 people staying - 2 bathrooms, plenty of room (Palm Room). Could walk everywhere. So close to the beach (1 street back). Staff were lovely and couldn't do enough for us.

Not even 5 min walk to the beach. The water is clam, easily to swim. Free visit to US Army Museum. Farmers market on Tuesday & Thursday. They are all only a block away. The public transit is easily & cheap $5.50 day pass get you anywhere. Not to mention shopping, from bargain shops to most luxury stores are all around..

As an exchange package seem to have been given the worst unit available (after talking to other guests and owners) pull out bed had to be packed away during day to give full access to bathroom (bad layout design)No cleaning down to room except rubbish removel and bed made once. Towel change had to be down by ourselves. I thought Honolulu overcrowded concrete jungle and not value for money. every trip we went on seemed to be designed to get the maximum amount of dollars out of you.

The resort was clean and spacious. The resort is located in a wonderful location. One block to the left, is the Waikiki Beach. turn out the right side of the resort and there are so many restaurants, shops. Denny's is attached to the hotel, nice to get somewhere to eat right there. Also, ABC store is directly beside resort. I bought my groceries there, fresh fruit, cooks cooking meals right on the premises- it also included beach items, first aid items, souvenirs, so much more. I felt safe the whole time I was there.

This resort is located just 1-2 blocks from the beach. Denny's on site was great for breakfast. Many other restaurant choices nearby plus shopping. Room was in need of an upgrade and very small. Murphy bed was used to provide a bed and space in the room. Bathroom just had a walk-in shower, a single sink for a vanity, and the commode was right next to that sink.Pool on the roof (27th floor) was small. No bar service by the pool. And, only 1 of 3 elevators directly servicing the 27th floor. Hot tubs were located on the 3rd floor. Laundry facilities located on the 2nd floor in the parking garage. Very odd.
user_name:
Robert B
West Seneca, New York

review_body: We last stayed in this Hotel when it first opened 50 Years ago. The Hotel- "Time Share" is very nicely located between Kalakaua and the beach right behind the Halekulani Resort. The Rooms vary and we chose an economical very minimum room as we were only staying a couple of nights. The small room had a Murphy bed and sleeper couch along with a small kitchen area. The room was adequate for a short stay but if you plan on a longer more relaxing time I would recommend one of the larger suites. The staff was very helpful and efficient. The main shortcomings in our room was a somewhat noisy AC unit with only one hi-speed noisy fan setting and a very tiny bathtub. The pool on the top floor was fine for a quick dip and a nice view. The price was reasonable for Waikiki and with only a $10.00 Resort fee we didn't feel we were being ripped off like most of the other area hotels. Definitely not luxurious but adequate.

Great staff, always helpful, courteous people around to help, Great Waikiki location. Onsite convenience store and restaurant. Owners reception for Friday night fireworks was very nice, live music, dancing too! Facilities updated since my last stay several years ago. Lewers St has completely changed since then, everything is new.

We spent 3 nights here and found the staff to be very helpful & friendly. The room itself was a bit run down however they are in the process of renovating both the kitchens & bathrooms. Friends stayed in a room higher up which has been done & it looked very nice. The room has a Murphy bed which is a little on the short side for my husband, his feet hung over the end of the bed. They don't service the room daily however you can go to housekeeping if you want new towels or sheets. Location was great and just a short walk to the beach.

Staff at front desk could have been more friendly and welcoming. Our family of 6 arrived quite early for check from a long haul flight from New Zealand. We proceeded to the hotel to drop our luggges for storage. It would be great if the hotel had facilities which allows guests who arrive early to freshen up and relax a bit. We felt we had to ask and noone bothered or atleast offered to make it a little bit comfortable for us.We decided to have lunch anyway, checked out the vicinity and requested for a phone call from the reception to atleast advise us if we can possibly check-in a little earlier as we've come a long way and were tired. Never received a call. We decided to go back to the hotel anyway after 4 hrs, Approached front and managed to check in earlier and finally got to rest in our rooms. Had we not asked, we could still have been sitting in the grass close to beach waiting.Apart from that, the suites we stayed in were generally clean and good. Beds were comfortable. Air conditioning a quite noisy.Hotel has activities for guests, lei making at the lobby was enjoyable. Drinks at the pool/ rooftop was ok.A kettle at the Palms suite's kitchen would be handy to have. There was a coffee maker, the drip/ filter kind. But coffee packets were not supplied at all. Strange, considering that at the smaller hotel we stayed at a couple of years ago generously provided guests with coffee granules for the coffee maker in the room. One would think that we the size & popularity of Imperial Resort, basics such as coffee,sugar and tea will be provided, after all you pay a lot more Hotel is in a great and vibrant location. ABC Store and Denny's at ground floor. Good quality shops in the surrounding area. Short walk to the beach, to Steak Shack, Beach Walk, Military Museum, Hilton lagoon for Friday night fireworks

We were greeted by very friendly staff and guided to the ocean suite for my son's wedding reception. The views were spectacular and the setting just perfect. Great selection of cocktails and nibbles followed by a wonderful wedding breakfast.

Location was in a GREAT spot...Great night life activity with some entertainment. Tuesday and Thursdays there is a Farmers Market right around the corner....3 minute walk. Beach access is also a 3 minute walk.

Have to say that the staff and valet guys were terrific. The front entrance and the position of the hotel were excellent as well. Unfortunately the one bedroom room was very small and tired. You could only use the drop down bed as there was no room for any other bed. The bed in the main room was very small which matched the bedroom itself. Nothing in terms of coffee or tea was provided. If it weren't for the location and staff I would say avoid it.

I will definately stay here again. The hotel was close to everything I needed and even a few things I didn't. A very caring and informative staff. I called to let the staff know we were going to late for check out becasue of a tour snafu, they said don't worry take your time and get here when you can. After we had checked out the manager called to make sure we were safe because the staff forgot to tell her we were gone. How cool!

Location great, stone throw away from the beaches, shops etc. Room bit dated, we got a 2 bedrooms apartment. Came with stove, oven, microwave coffee machine. No pots or pans for cooking, one baking tray and some cutlery.Bed is comfortable to sleep. Overall pretty good stay especially is so conveniently located near all amenities.

Travelled with family as a Timeshare exchange. Lobby was very impressive, if only the same could be said for the rest of the building. Booked a one bed apartment to sleep four adults. First room had not been cleaned, the top of the fridge was filthy, the mirrors in the bedroom still dusty. The high pitched whistle coming from the main bathroom was unexplained. The living space was not big enough to utilise the sofa bed without having to stack the rest of the furniture onto the dining room table. having asked to be moved, we were shown two other rooms, the second of which we had little choice but to accept. The rooms are small, outdated. I don't believe they have been refurbished since the day the doors opened (manager proudly told us this was the first timeshare resort in Honolulu). Bathrooms are tiny and dark. Kitchenette work-top (supposedly refurbished) had deep scratches. Water was turned off twice during our stay for "maintenance" and was cloudy when back on. No coincidence three of our party were subsequently ill with a stomach bug, with one unable to travel to our next destination. I cannot express how disappointed we were with this resort and it certainly does not warrant the silver crown status currently held.

The resort is at excellent location. It is near everything, the beach, the designer shops, the night market, good bars and restaurants. The staffs are very polite and helpful. The facilities are very well maintained, very clean.

We always stay at the Imperial! They treat us like family, greet us with a smile and Aloha, and are extremely friendly and helpful with anything you need. Imperial also has the best location! It's near everything, ABC and Denny's next to the lobby, near the Bus and shuttles, restaurants and shopping and of course, the beautiful ocean and beaches! Aloha and Mahalo! Till next year!

Great location and value for money. We used the fold out sofa bed and the drop down wall bed and had to re-arrange all the furniture to make them fit. A real squeeze for family of 4 and luggage. Still nice place though and we didn't spend a lot of time inside anyway. Check in is very late at 4pm so keep that in mind. Pool very windy but beach is nicer anyway. You are only a 2 min walk to one of the small beaches just up from the main Waikiki beach which is busier anyway.Would stay again. Check they are not doing building work when you are due to stay as some other buildings in the area were and they had jack hammers going constantly. You would be guttered if you had to put up with that.

I think my family and I may have found a resort that we may love to frequent while we’re here on Oahu.The price is pretty reasonable considering it’s in Waikiki close to all the hotspots around according to my wife. She knows the prices well.The purpose of this trip is to bring my oldest daughter back to Kamehameha for sophomore year and my wife found this hidden gem on Expedia.Located on Lewers, this place is located right next to our favorite breakfast joint, Denny’s.When we first logged in, the lady at the front desk was very nice and accommodating. The only thing that was questionable was the parking fee but this is Waikiki, pretty much every hotel going be charging the load for parking...ours was $35 a night.The valet attendants were very fast and knowledgeable. We came in a couple times off of a different road, Kalia Road and the attendant knew that and found us right when we were going to come around the block and enter the right way.One of my daughters love the fact that the bed came out of the wall. She called it the transformer room.The AC is ❄️ and the spot is perfect for our family...

The Imperial is centrally located in Waikiki and only steps away from the beach, park, restaurants, and shopping. While the resort has attempted to update furnishings, appliances & etc. over the years, they would have been better served with a complete & deep remodel. For example, the air conditioning is clearly 50 years old—there were 2 different thermostats (again 50 years old) both of which were set at full blast when I arrived. They never shut off, nor did they ever manage to cool the unit below about 75 degrees. And they were loud, though luckily I’m not a light sleeper. My only other complaint—having stayed in both studio and 1-bedroom units is that the floor plans seem more cramped than they should within the space that’s there, but that goes back to their original design flaws. Furnishings were okay, but I wasn’t a fan of the cheap, foam pillows. On the positive side, there were updated stainless steel appliances in the kitchen and newer televisions. Kudos to the staff—all of which were very friendly and welcoming.

We booked and paid for 12 nights and never again ! The “bed” was a pull down double bed from the wall my partner and I had to sleep separately me on the sofa pull out bed him on the pull out bed from the wall ! The unit was old which that I don’t mind but the room was terribly tiny could barely walk in it, the bathroom ridiculously small and bath would flood when you have a shower the cleaning of the place is every average I had bugs crawling Over the kitchen bench almost every night and the cleaners you could tell barely cleaned it properly when they did it twice a week !!! The pillow aren’t even a standard pillow size more like a cushion like wtf!!!! The staff were ok but we ended up staying elsewhere end of our stay as we couldn’t take it anymore and my god what a difference in service , friendliness and professionalism !!! Then we had a decent holiday and loved Hawaii !!!

We particularly chose this place because it had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Even though we didn’t spend a great deal of time there because we were always out and about it was comfortable, clean and had everything we needed. Close to everything and situated well. Prices were good value too

I booked this place not knowing how close it was to everything.The hotel is certainly dated, but had everything our family needed.I would not venture into the hot tub but the pool looked nice.It really is 100m from Waikiki beach.

Loved our 6 nights at this hotel, lovely hotel workers, very helpful, friendly and easy to chat with. The hotel is central to everything, shopping, restaurants, bars, shuttles, uber etc. Yard House across the road which was really handy especially with the 2pm Happy hour, and Denny's off the hotel lobb who give you 10% off if you show them your keycard. A great place to stay, would definitely come back here.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and the Imperial. I can't wait to go back. What an amazing holiday and fantastic place to stay. Locations and affordability are perfect. Staff are amazing and the amenities more than adequate.

all the staff are friendly and very helpful. the hotel is clean and well maintained. very close to stores and restaurants. although it's not a beach front but it's 2 minutes walk to the beach from the hotel. my family had a great time. i would recommend this hotel for family stay.

This was my last stop on a long trip. I chose the Imperial based on cost and location. I wasn't disappointed. I had the small Ohia "suite", which was perfect for me. There was a large Murphy bed that was easy to take down and stow. The living room area was very clean and the kitchenette was perfect for what I needed (fridge, coffee maker, and microwave), plus all the dished and utensils. With an ABC store right outside the front door, it was handy for cereal, coffee, milk, etc.The resort is just across the street from the public access to Waikiki beach.

Over the past 20 years we have traveled to Oahu a half dozen times and this was our 4th time staying at the Imperial. We have tried others including the Embassy Suites (across the street) and have gone back to the Imperial as it is a very affordable family option considering the location to shopping and the beach. We had a Palm room with our recent visit and although still a bit dated looking, one bath had been remodeled and it looks like the carpeting had been upgraded. Overall the rooms are clean and although a bit dated it never bothers us as we spend very little time in the room anyways. What we like most about staying at the Imperial is its convenient location to the shopping, dining and the beach. The other pluses are the friendly staff who always greet you with a smile and the pricing compared to other hotels in the area. Would definitely recommend the Imperial if you're looking for something affordable but yet convenient to everything...looking forward to our next visit.

We stayed in one of the one-bedroom rooms with our family of 2a, 3c. The pull down bed in the lounge was great, but it was the location that earned the review.A great location close to Waikiki and shops. Front desk service could be improved, and facilities slightly worn, but a great affordable place for the location.

Accommodations average or below average. Appliances old. TV has no HDMI or USB ports. Room refrigerator froze food. Tried to use "fridge' in owners lounge. Put name and room number on food. Still stolen by someone. Staff very helpful and friendly. Valets were very courteous and fast.

We had a Palm Suite for 4 adults and found the main lounge area to be a little small when the pull down bed was left down. It was great having a large fridge and oven. Dishwasher was quite small as was bench space but we enjoyed being able to cook our own meals. Rooftop pool was well used but a little windy. Excellent being able to replenish towels, tissues, dishwash etc at housekeeping when required between cleans. 5 minutes walk to beach but not nice swimming there as sandy beach but heading into the water it is shelly and then rocky.

I used this hotel for price and hopes of not getting a room with traffic noise - I read many reviews of various rooms with this problem. It is on Lewers, one block from the beach so main traffic does not flow down this road. Our room was on the back side, so we looked onto another hotel. The lanai was small - of no real use except fresh air. 5 minutes walk to a small beach. Sandy entry into the ocean. Cold showers are at that beach and you can rinse your feet again when you get to the back door of the hotel. The laundry was great - many washers and dryers. A large table for folding afterwards. It is also open air on one side with views to the ocean - so lovely to sit and wait if you so chose. The room was clean with a full kitchen. I slept on the Murphy bed - was surprised how easy it was to pull it down and put away - bedding stayed in place. I did find it firm to sleep on - I requested something to soften it - and housekeeping arranged egg cup foam layer. Problem resolved. The kitchen did lack counter space so that made it difficult to cook. Simple meals will work fine - we like home cooked food. We managed. The pool is on the rooftop - basic rectangle. It was enjoyed by other guests. There is a good exercise room - I needed it to keep up shoulder exercises. Wifi and DVD player were good. Overall I do recommend it for location, price, no street noise issue. The staff were great. We used valet parking - easy. It is also a great location for walking around Waikiki.

The dominant reason i enjoy staying here is the employees. Most of whom have been here for years. Don't let the opening statement fool you, the employees are focused on the hospitality experience. Helpful, cheerful, and friendly. from the bell desk to the front desk you will feel and come to know Ohana.We have come to know of the resort because my father is a vacation share owner. (just to get that out for disclosure) which is how we discovered the Imperial, but we have stayed there as a regular guest ( when dad wanted both weeks those years) the experience did not change.They are doing regular renovations and updating. this happens over time, but there is a chance for some of the appliances to seem dated. Last year the pool was renovated. We have not had a problem with things not functioning, but if that happens they is on-site maintenance to correct problems. To the amenities; The pool is on the roof. the fitness area Gym, sauna, 2 hot tubes are on the 3rd floor. there is a full laundry on the second floor with sets of machines (i think 3-5). the concierge can handle excursions, car rentals and tours. There are computers and printers for checking travel arrangements or self-help event verification.There are a few different room types that are well detailed in the booking site. we have always had access to a full size fridge with freezer; stove; microwave; and dinnerware and flatware service for at least 4 people.Some of the rooms can seem a little odd with the arrangement of the furniture placement compared to the floor plan. Best recommendation when you arrive, figure out the sleeping arrangement (will you use the hide-a-bed or murphy bed) and set the room for sleeping. then see how best to re-arrange the furniture. once done put the beds away, unpack and start vacationing.From the imperial is is a short walk to most anywhere. if you have trouble walking, check with the bell desk they can get an electric scooter delivered.(and most everything else. those people rock) south a half block and you're in the water. North a block and you're at Kalakaua Blvd.2 blocks west is the post office (most cost effective way to get souvenirs home) and the bus stops. East of the hotel is Waikiki and Diamond head (but there are a few buildings in the way) there is not a direct route, but if you enjoy exploring there are some great shortcuts to be found.

Room was great except the fish smell in the room upon arrival. Very good view and very friendly and helpful staff. Owners lounge was great, great view to watch the fireworks from the Hale Koa. Pool was super except when guests had their dogs in the water and had babies with diapers on in the water.

Great location in downtown with excellent customer service. Building is older, and units are small, but well kept and comfortable. Our biggest concern was noise - the single pane windows allowed us to hear everything - loud construction next door, sirens, early trucks - even on the 17th floor.

We decided to stay in the Imperial Resort Waikiki because of its location next to the beach, above a Denny's and large ABC store. The staff were great and the room large that had a kitichen, 2 bathrooms, a separate bedroom and a pull down double murphy bed and sofa bed. The pool is small but OK and they have a sauna and small hot tub.

My adult grandson and I spent a timeshare week there. The accommodations and staff are excellent. Checkin and checkout were efficient. We had the Koa room with a queen bed, a sofabed and two bathrooms. The bathtub had grab bars that would be appreciated by those who need it. The other bathroom had a shower. I asked for a rollaway bed so we woulldn’t need to close the sofa bed every morning. A few minutes after I made the request, it was delivered. The roof top pool had an apparatus that would enable the handicapped to enter the pool. Denny’s restaurant on the first floor and we found the food to be above average. ABC store is on the first floor was handy.Very close to restaurants and shopping. All in all, a perfect vacation stay.

The Imperial Hawaii Resort is in a great location. We had a short walk to the beach which was great. The staff at the hotel are very nice. We rented a car and all we had to do was call down for it to be brought to the front and it was always there. The hotel has a rooftop pool as well as 2 hot tubs, a sauna and gym. If you belong to the owners' club, there is a great lounge on the 26th floor that overlooks the beach. It's a great place to watch the sunset and the fireworks on Friday nights. We stayed in the Palm Suite and it was a bit tight for 4 of us. It did have 2 bathrooms and that was great! No dishwasher but it had a stove. I would have rather had a dishwasher because who is cooking on vacation? The rooms were clean and we had a side ocean view. I would definitely go back and stay there again. There are a lot of restaurants and shops in walking distance.

The hotel is beautiful and has an excellent location, in the middle of things: shopping area, mall, restaurants and very close to the beach. We had a one bedroom apartment with two full bathrooms. One of the bathrooms was very small but we got accommodated quickly. We had a balcony with a nice view. The apartment was very clean and well maintained. The full kitchen provided us with al the necessary utensils, if we needed them (which happened a few times). There is an ABC store at the first floor of the hotel; very good and convenient. I liked the prompt response of the front desk and the maintenance if we needed something such a paper towel or the need to have a bulb changed. We had valet parking which was good and convenient. I would gladly go again and stay in the same resort.

We stayed for 6 days in the Banyon Suite. The location was excellent...could not be better. Sofa, bed and mjurphy bed were all very comfortable and we all slept very well, until awakened by early morning construction. My husband, myself and our 18 year old granddaughter. The suite was immaculate (room 702)...no view however, but looked out on brick walls of the building they were doing construction on. We rented it thru Expedia, and when we arrived, the price was higher than Expedia had told us...and the deposit was more than told us also. It was our first time using Expedia, so I am not sure if this is usual for them.. Our only complaint...it is said to be wheelchair accessible...but the bathroom certainly was not. Very, very small and NO handrails by the toilet. I greatly feared falling each time I needed to transfer from the wheelchair to the toilet...and back. I started using bathrooms in their nearby hotels to avoid this situation. The staff were all wonderful and very helpful...,and if it wasn't for the bathroom problem, I would not hesitate to stay there again.....and the best part...it is in the center of everything!!!

The resort and service at this hotel was excellent. The location is within easy walking distance of everything. Beach stuff can be rented and there is a Hertz car rental on the 2nd floor. We walked most places and used the bus and Uber a couple of times. Maita'i Catamaran; Sunset Beach on the North Shore; Pearl Harbor; Paradise Cove luau; Iolani Palace tour was great; Duke's; Pagoda Restaurant; Cheesecake Factory had best catch of the day very reasonably priced, were just some of the attractions. Landscape architect for Waikiki did an amazing job! Wonderful trip and would definitely recommend the Imperial.

Along with all the physical renovations there has been a full renovation in regards to staff attitude and attention. The original family feel is back and the complex has a breath of new life. The many activities such as lei making, owner lounge orientation sessions, guest artists and musicians, cultural activities for all to participate in and enjoy barely scratches the surface . This is the place to be and experience the true aloha of Hawai’i. Will I go back? You can bet your bottom dollar I will and I can barely wait for my next visit.

We are repeat customers here and always enjoy for service, location, staff and proximity to the beach (1block) and other must do’s when in Honolulu. This trip we exchanged on a timeshare and added 3 nights extra. The studio was clean, comfortable and sufficient but over the street so it could be noisy. When we inquired about a change they sadly had nothing available. BUT when we moved rooms they put us in a high room with an ocean view as compensation! A really nice 1 bedroom suite we reserved for the tail end of the vacation and it was a great stay. Kudos to Todd at the front desk. He has been so nice and helpful every trip and every time we stay here.

Stayed here for a week with my family. First off, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Any questions about the local area of things to do they are a good resource. The location itself is about a block from the beach, your view may be blocked depending on where your room is but its an easy walk. The rooms are outdated, however. The smallest room is a pull down bed and a pull out couch, we upgraded to a room with a full sized bed. The kitchen is a full kitchen which is nice, but most of the furniture and appliances are pretty old and worn. The A/C in the rooms is either really cold or not on there is no in between. The worst thing is the construction all around. They are working at all hours and the rooms are not insulated enough to keep out the sound of trucks and machinery, really dampens the mood of vacation.I would recommend staying here as the location is perfect and the price is great for the area.

On arrival room was ready in advance and the valet parking is very convenient. We were told about the activities in the coming days and the facilites in the complex. Room was clean and convenient. Resort has potential to be even more modern with revamp of bathrooms especiall shower screens to frameless glass

The location is great! Best thing about this hotel. Definitely not a resort, not sure what the “ resort fee” is for. Hot tub looks like it’s in a room converted for the hot tub. Hallways are dated n had a smell. We had a palm suite. Had a full kitchen which was nice and 2 bathrooms. Had plenty of hot water and water pressure. Had to keep ac running to keep rooms from smelling. Bedroom extremely tight with just a double bed. Had a lot of furniture making rooms tight. Looked like furniture was new but the style was so outdated made furniture look tired n dated. Window was filthy even if we had a view couldn’t see it thru window. I would give it a 2 star rating for room, Location helps bump up its rating. I would look for another place in similar location next time, but rate was good also. Would consider paying more in similar location to get a nicer place.

We stayed in the Koa room which was decent sized but the furniture and room itself needs a facelift. It looked a bit old but it met our needs. The location was great, and everyone that works there was absolutely awesome and super friendly and helpful! The parking cost was a bit steep but it is in the middle of Waikiki so I suppose parking everywhere is steep.

Good hotel for the price in a great location, easy access through to the beach and close to shops and restaurants. We have always stayed beachfront, but it was no bother to walk the short distance. The 2 bedroom apartment was good for our family and affordable compared to taking 2 rooms elsewhere. Actual bedrooms quite tight, but good to have living room and kitchen,
user_name:
Jacki T
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Generally a very satisfying experience and the hotel resort is ideally located to many attractions such as Waikiki Beach, International Market,Denny's Diner next door, ABC Convenience Store and close to pick-up sites when going on organised tours. There is a rooftop swimming pool on the 27th floor and the members lounge area, including kitchen, pool table and large screen television on the next level down. The gym facilities are on the third floor.

Loved our stay here. Lovely staff , perfect position. Bonus as we had a view. Loved it there. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. ABC store on ground level where you can buy supplies. Consierge desk gave great advice on tours. Didn’t use pool as lots of children but no issue as we preferred beach anyway. Roof top Friday night fireworks were magical. Thursday night cocktails fantastic too.

We've stayed at the Imperial before. Short - but very odd walk to beach, and the beach is small and you need to walk further to get to where Waikiki beach is really open. A lot of shopping and food in area, from reasonable to high end.

The rooms at this resort have all been renovated and have upgraded appliances. The pool has been redone and air conditioning has had upgrades and new chiller unit. This is a much better option than the Wyndham beach walk next door for the value. They offer discount at Denny’s in the building by showing your room card and with the Denny’s 46&8 dollar deals you can get a breakfast for two for under 20. The lobby at the imperial has been upgraded as well. Wyndham has washer and dryer in the room but we had issues with those at our last visit and we had an issue with one manager at Wyndham. We deal like ohana (family) at the imperial and we’re there for the Super Bowl party which was great this year except that it should have been New Orleans instead of the Rams. This resort is within a block of the beach and you can see fire works on Friday night from the roof or you can walk towards the Hilton on the beach to see them. This is free every Friday night.

This place was super nice location and staff was friendly and helpful. Great place for the family, pool and hot tub for relax at the end of a long day of exploring the city and beaches ! They have parking, laundry service or do your own, you can rent just about anything their to do or tours in Hawaii. There is a store below the hotel basically in the lobby. So much close things beach is literally 5 minute walk and easily accessible.

Hotel was reasonably priced and provided plenty of space in the one bedroom units. Rooms were only serviced every 4 days which I found odd although you could request fresh towels by going down to housekeeping. Has a small gym but some equipment was difficult to use. Pool on the rooftop was very small. The term 'Resort' is probably overrating itself a little. Staff were very helpful and friendly at all times.Great being so close to shopping, restaurants and the beach. Denny's linked to the hotel was very handy as was the ABC Store where we could get supplies.

Room was a small box with several things wrong plugged shower squeaky doors and locking mechanism for main door had to be replaced. ( they very quickly repaired problems excelleht service that way) We were told we had a kitchen ya right no stove no hot plate bar fridge only microwave and a coffee pot and toaster they advertise 100 yards to the beach as the crow flies only need to take a few streets and a walkway to get there lugging all your beach belongings including a chair that you have to pay to rent for the day and if you want to rent directly at the beach 55.00 per hour US food and drink very expensive even water outrageous prices. Got woken up every morning at 4 am with the back up beepers and banging of the trucks emptying the garbages behind the hotels and then construction started at 7 am. So packed with people cant even go for a walk at any time day or night and if you like shopping at Jimmy Choos Tiffany's and Valentino;s great but way too high end for me. Will not go back weather was awful and congestion way too much not relaxing at all and Way way to expensive to even eat a decent meal I wont be back

Our room was very disappointing, very small and dingy. We planned a magical anniversary trip to the island but our room was so cramped we had to take turns in the bathroom getting ready. In the large room if the bed was being used we could not use the couch and table area. The wicker furniture was not comfortable anyhow. This space was so small you didn't have room to change your mind. The resort was in the middle of a remodel so the elevators were always full of construction crews. The resort said it had a kitchen that consisted of a coffee pot, sink, and a mini-fridge. No way to even boil an egg. We did enjoy our time at the open market, Pearl Harbor, and at the beach before we flew to the other islands.

This resort is very central.Pool area was great. Watching the fireworks on Friday nights were great. The service was fantastic.This resort has everything you will need.The ABC store is great it has everything you will need and the Denny’s has assume breakfast from their value menu.

This hotel/timeshare (non resort style) is hands down the best location in all of Waikiki. Downstairs is an ABC store which the locals will tell you has the best food in the back. The hotel is across the street from the Beach, Yard House, (the original) Roy's, shops, Hawaiian Shopping mall, one block from luxury row (Gucci, Louis, Hermes, you name it)The only thing better than the location is the service. Bryan, the GM and his staff went above and beyond to truly make us feel like ohana. The valet's knew our names, we were always greeted with a smile, they checked on us and made our trip one of the best yet. I will absolutely stay there again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved the apartment and having a full kitchen. We traveled with young adults and small children and it was a perfect fit for everyone. Hospitality at it's finest.

We stayed in a Palm Suite which is fine for the 3 of us we were here for 17 nights. This is our second time staying here as we love the location its so handy to restaurants and across from the beach. It is very clean the rooms are not huge but big enough and comfortable.The staff are very helpful. and of a night go to the 27th floor for afternoon drinks great lookout to see the sunset. The roof pool is clean always manage a pool lounge. The laundry on the second floor is good also. I really enjoy staying here and will return again.

This is a great hotel/timeshare. The employees go above and beyond and are extremely friendly (its the hawaiian air) The location is one of the best!You have less than 100 metres to the beach, restaurants all around, transportation is really easy as well. Rent a BIKI Bike for a few hours.the hotel has great amenities, roof top pool, exercise room, hot tubs, extra cooler and chairs to rent.the studio is fully equipt with dishes, cutlery, coffee maker, fridge, convention oven, sink bathroom shower and tub, balcony, murphybed and queen sofa bed, couch, table n charis.

The Imperial Resort is a great central location in Waikiki to all the action. Only a block away from the beach and a block away from the main drag of Waikiki with all the shops and restaurants you can imagine. Check-In was easy. The room was updated fairly recently. We had a studio with the pull down bed. I thought the bed was a little stiff but comfortable. The view was of the building next door, but we were at palm tree level so not a bad view. Noise wasn't a problem either. Amenities aren't good as well. We did an exchange through a timeshare. Would recommend to those who want a great centrally located hotel in Waikiki.

We had a 2 room suite with room for 5 people. It included a fully equipped kitchen with refrigerator, gas oven, microwave and dishwqsher. The room also had a great balcony and ocean view from the 22nd floor! Good prices and comfortable rooms.

we recently spent 5 days at the Imperial Hawaii Vacation Club. We had a Studio room on the 8th floor. We appreciated being able to use the Owners lounge on the 26th floor, and the sauna, hot tub and pool. Location is terrific and it was quiet at night. No real view from the terrace - from a corner you could see a little bit of ocean - but it was a just a block away. Very convenient to all the buses. The only negative for us was the condition of the mattresses on both the Murphy bed and the sofabed. After one night on the murphy bed we switched to the sofabed which was only marginally better. If you can, hold out for a one bedroom or larger - waking up with back pain every day put a bit of a damper on the trip. Other than that we enjoyed staying there and would do so again.

Resort was a walking distance to all restaurants, and markets. Highly recommended. Vehicle is not required if staying at this resort. walking distance to beach. ABC store is connected to resort, plus a Denny's for a quick breakfast.

Great location, very friendly staff, but looking tired!. Pool is only a plunge pool, so swimmers, forget it.Only 2 minutes to the beach and a 5 minute walk to most bus stops. Surrounded by plenty of dining options to suit all pockets and plenty of variety. Our rooms were partly carpeted and the bathrooms are old and looking rather sad and worn!.

Resort located in the center of the business district,with easy access to city bus line, beaches and restaurants. Resort staff was very friendly and helpful of information of the area. The unit was clean, bathroom was tight/small. Unit has coffee filters, but lack the complementary packet of coffee, tea, sugar and cream

The resort was well situated central to everything. The accommodation was excellent and the staff were great, friendly efficient and more than willing to help. The amenities were well maintained and a pleasure to use especially the pool table area.

So wonderfully close to the beach and shopping. In midst of upgrading rooms but studios need work. Love owners lounge with views that are spectacular . Personnel are wonderful and extremely helpful. Worth money,

Imperial is right in the heart of waikiki walking distance to the shops and beach and the hotel is super clean i would love to go back there ❤ hotel facilities and also dennys restraunt is locate the bottom of the hotel n they are open 24/7

I had a wonderful time in Hawaii. The studio was large and had all the necessities available. It was clean, had a lot of bedding, sheets, blankets etc. The staff was helpful and polite. Overall I was very satisfied with my vacation. Will return to the Imperial again for sure.

close to all amenities .We were allowed to check in early .Enjoyed the resort facilities .Staff quick to respond to request .I wanted a rice cooker and electric water jug and got it promptly .We stayed in one bedroom .Rooms are pretty average and lounge room gets bit squeezy once the roll bed is opened .Bit noisy due to the rally going on ,but didn't bother us at all .We were given ample warning about it by the staff .Close to beach , cheese cake factory and the trolley bus stop and its right in the centre of Waikiki shops

3rd night of a week long stay and I can’t wait for the week to end! The unit is uncomfortably small, dark and dingy. Bed is a full size at most, and bathroom is hard to get to because of small bedroom and furniture placement. No closet light at all, had to use cell phone to see in suitcase! I don’t expect a 5 star but this is the worst property we have ever stayed at in timeshare properties. It’s ridiculous and I would never stay here again! On a positive note the staff is very friendly and kind.

An excellent service from the valet and bell hop. The location was excellent but the resort needs some upgrade.The unit is not well lit, the airconditioner is too noisy as well as the vent in the bathroom.

Location, location is everything. Walking distance to beach 4 min. to main stripe 5 mins. Tours all available at front desk. ABC store has just about everything you need to tide you over. Ala Moana Shopping Short bus ride away.

The resort is centrally located to the main strip and to Waikiki beach. Friendly staff. Units need update of the bathroom. Shower stall and tub were very dirty and dingy/moldy. Resort has extra kitchen supplies you can borrow as needed. ABC just next to resort lobby which was very convenient.

Resort was a little dated, but very clean and functional. It worked well for our family. Six could fit in the one bedroom suite, if needed, but it would be cozy.Staff was very nice and helpful. Room was only cleaned once per week as per resort expectations.

The accommodation is very central to everything you need to get to or see in Hawaii. The rooms are small, but you don't spend much time there anyway. We had a balcony with a slight view of the ocean. It was good enough for us. Close to pubs and eateries. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

These appartments were very tired. Desk staff were not friendly.The advertised views were minimal and only if your room was on a high level. The pool area was very 1960’s. Location to everything was the only real positive.

Rooms very small and beds are short.I asked for an upgrade from studio to 1 bedroom my our balcony face two construction dumpsters they started at 5:30am even on weekends then there were strikers from the Westin with bullhorns at all hours windows and doors didn’t block noise. We left after a few days and paid for another hotel on the north side of island

I am still currently staying at The Imperial. The good stuff: the valet service guys are awesome, very nice, very friendly. They get a 3 rather than a 2 simply because of these guys. Having the ABC store right here is awesome. I did find that most employees were well trained and accommodating. The lobby is large and cheery. Okay, done there. The Banyan Suite is extremely small. Suggest no more than two people. Once the murphy bed is down and then to try to use the pull out...impossible. Bathroom is small. We had to have them come change the sheets on the murphy bed our first night as the sheets had hair...gross..also, needed pillow cases as the two pillows in the closet had dirty cases on them, (yeah, snot and blood). Not happy about this. I didn't know when I booked this hotel that it isn't a hotel but a timeshare, owners, yes, resort place and the rooms are rentals for the owners. Pool area was clean but the pool very small. Housekeeping is only on certain days and they will tell you that if you ask for new or additional towels etc. In the end you can take your used towels to housekeeping and they will count them and replace then with clean. So, this is not a hotel where you will have housekeeping everyday, although they do get the trash. The 23rd floor smells horrible. A/C is ancient. Considering all, the best thing about the Imperial is the location. However, that is not enough to convince me to stay again. For what I paid, I can get a much nicer hotel with true hotel service.

This resort is close to Waikiki Beach and close to a bus stop that gets you all over the island. There were also lots of good restaurants and stores within a few blocks. The pool was nice, and watching the Friday night fireworks from the owners' lounge was terrific

For the price of a timeshare exchange you cant beat it. There is a $100. Parking fee which they don't mention until you check in. There is only valet parking which is super nice if you've ever tried to park in a garage on Waikiki it's like a game of tetris with cars. The bad part is you have to tip the valets everytime. For a timeshare parking fees should be included. Our view was the side of another building or parking garage and a alleyway. On the 23 floor is the owners lounge and the whole back wall is windows and also the balcony which faces the ocean right across the sand. There is a Dennys in the building right next to the lobby and a 10% discount if staying in condo. There is also a huge ABC store on the other side of the lobby which has a deli in it and surprisingly the prices are better for food than the Dennys and no grouchy old man waiter and better food. I've stayed in this condo 2 other times with my husband so a Murphy bed studio really wasn't that big of a deal. This time it was me and a friend so I got a one bedroom that sleeps six if sharing beds but, I had my very spacious room and my friend got the Murphy bed in the living room. There was only one very tiny bathroom which had not been remodeled in yrs maybe never. The kitchen was just a kitchenette which was fine since we were on vacation and not cooking. The living room was a spacious size and the balcony had a little table and 2 chairs to sit out on. The location is pretty much right in the middle of everything. The kings court very high end shopping and the beach walk shopping center. It's a mile walk to the zoo and just down a path yo the beach. You dont even have to cross the street to get there. The maid service could have been a lot better because there were 2 hairs in the tub upon check in. She came back on Wed to clean and didn't leave extra toilet paper or replenish the Kleenex which were out. Also, she just threw the soaps and lotions on the counter not even bothering to set them up. The hair was still on the tub but, she replenished the towels and half assed made my bed.clean towels and no theft so it was good.

We stayed here a few years ago when we had a timeshare week.Loved the convenience of the short walk to the beach and the ABC store right in the same building! If you haven been to Oahu you need to enjoy the ABC stores when you do go.They have Everything!!

The hotel is centrally located. Very noisy. Couldn’t promote this hotel for accommodation.We booked 16 months ago and were given a poor quality room. Paid dearly to be moved to another room. On arrival which was a day early than we had booked, the receptionist was quite rude.

Very impressed with everything about this resort. Location amenities cleanliness service. All good.Staff was very helpful except for the female Bell Captain. Pull out bed was not comfortable but the rest of the room was great.

We arrived at the hotel with no help from any staff with our bags- while holding two children under 3 and were told we were charged for any extra ammenities we needed. Extra $7 for cot. Ridiculous. Next we entered the room and it was something from the 80’s. Everything very old fashioned, an awful stench and a bed that pulls out of the wall... it said this suite fit 6 people... it couldn’t fit more then 3! Our sheets were completely stained when we went to get into bed and had some random people’s hair on the sheets which was repulsive. When we called the reception to sort the issue they responded they don’t change sheets. I advised we hadn’t even stayed the night yet and our sheets were dirty. Finally we had a man come to the room and leave the sheets on the bed and exit. I asked if he was going to put the sheets on. He replied with a no. It’s not his job to do a turndown service... wtf. The bathroom had no space in it and definitely couldn’t have more then one person at a time. There is no kettle so we had to go across the road to get the baby’s bottle sorted. The tv and DVD player actually been tied up with little seals like we would steal their stuff. It’s beyond disgraceful! I will never come back.

We have owned a unit in this resort for nearly 20 years. This is NOT a luxury hotel/condo but it is half a block off Waikiki beach and from the higher units and the owners' lounge the view is the same as from the luxury hotels that are right on the beach. There is a small pool and a hot tub area. Our unit is one bedroom 2 baths. The kitchen has all the appliances - stove, microwave, oven, smaller fridge (NOT tiny). If you need some other equipment housekeeping can get it for you (colander, rice cooker). The same people have wok=rked in reception and housekeeping for as long as we have been coming here.

Just got back from our first visit to Hawaii and we loved the Imperial. Location was brilliant close to two beaches one is calmer than the other. We stayed in the palm suite and was fine for two of us. Furniture was a bit large for the size if the unit but didn't bother us.I slept on the Murphy bed and it was comfortable. The fans were connected to the lights so couldnt sleep with them on just the aircon but it worked out fine.Pool area was nice but didn't use the pool with the ocean only a block away. Overall I would happily stay here again.

Studio unit satisfied our needs although more room is always a plus. We spent most of our time on beach and other activities so studio was good this time. The air conditioning unit was loud but kept room cool. View from our studio was satisfactory. We were 3rd floor and looked out over Lewers street at Roy's Restaraunt. Lots of shopping and places to eat in the area. Favorite was the Basalt happy hour. The best happy hours prices on food and drinks and a short walk.

We own a time share at the Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki. They put us in a new room that looked right over the ocean. What a view. My Mother came with my husband and myself. We had a one bedroom but slept four people. Lots of space, a mini-kitchen with everything, two bathrooms, and internet. People are nice and have that Aloha spirit. We love that place.

This is a very well maintained and managed faclity with good amenities and conviently located to activities and other services. It it advised to make reservations well in advance as they tend to run full quite frequently.

This is our second time staying at The Imperial Hawaii and I must say that it was still good second time around. We arrived at 11:30 am, too early to get in to our room but because we were RCI members we were able to use the club room. Which was just perfect after an overnight flight, to have somewhere to change and refresh yourself! Thanks to staff member who reminded us that this option was available to us.Though this resort is a bit dated, it was very adequate for our needs, with normal size fridge/freezer and a well equipped kitchen. Free wifi, the gym was good, the swimming pool was great but most of all, it was 1 block from the beach. We used the valet parking this time and it was reasonably priced at $20 per night for members. Oh, the kids loved Denny's downstairs and you get 10% your bill when you show them your room key!We liked our stay here last year and we were not disappointed with our stay here this year. If we come back to Waikiki next year we will definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for two nights and it was okay. The bed was extremely uncomfortable as it was one of those pull down from the wall things. The kitchen had everything you needed. It was dated and not so clean.

Actually, my review is for a week’s stay in Dec 2016. After visiting Maui, Kauai, and the Big Island on previous holidays, we finally got around to Oahu. Of course there are more luxurious hotels in Waikiki, but the Imperial has nice rooms, good amenities, and a PERFECT location. But most of all, I want to relate a story from TODAY about their customer service. I had purchased two embroidered shirts at the lobby gift shop. On a subsequent vacation in Colorado, I hand-washed them, hung them up to dry.....and left them there. I contacted both the Imperial and the gift shop more than 1-1/2 years later. They found two of the same shirts for me and shipped them out the same day! Now THAT’S customer service. If you don’t think it exists anymore, just try the Imperial!

We booked 5 rooms for our group of 16. Always family friendly, convenient to Waikiki and easy on the budget. Love the proximity to the public beach and the Outrigger Reef. Easy to catch Lyft, a cab or walk to where we wanted to go.

Wonderful vacation! Oahu Honolulu what else is there to say! Beautiful place. Resort has everything we needed. Right down the road from the malls and restaurants and lots of beaches and entertainment choices!
user_name:
Paul H
Conneaut, Ohio, United States

review_body: Hotel is clean, modern and well appointed, staff are friendly and the location is ideal with the beach being just a minutes walk away.Price is good and the pool area, while small, is nice.Ideal for a family holiday, I’ll be staying here next year when I return.

Small space but well set out and so convenient to shops ,beach and sights.Good kitchen space, just disappointed there was no starter pack of tea, coffee milk etc.Pool area great, loads of loungers, pool is very adequate, with towels in rooms supplied. I liked it here and would definitely use again if having to stay over in Waikiki.

The Imperial is conveniently located to everything you really need. It only took us a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach. There is an ABC store right on the main floor of the building where you can get groceries, a deli section where you can get a grab and goal meal, and the prices are quite reasonable for the area. We had two bedroom suite with a kitchen. Everything was there to make your own meal and such. If you are going to make your own food, you'll need to make sure you get some oil, salt and pepper as they don't have it in the kitchen. From the owner's lounge, you can see the Fireworks on Friday. Initially we had some problems with our check in and reservation. But the Front Desk and Tony from reservations made it right and were very accommodating with our situation. They really went out of their way to make our trip a memorable one.

If you are after a place that is central to shops, beaches and pubs, Imperial is the place to be. We stayed here for 10 nights and it’s so convenient. The rooms are functional, not the best looking but hey, we are here to experience a beautiful island, not a room to stay in. For the price you pay in Waikiki and where it is located, I would say it’s probably the best deal you can get especially during summer season.

For the price, this location and facility cannot be beaten, especially for a downtown Honolulu hotel. Our suite fit our 6-person family quite well (murphy bed and sleeper sofa) and gave us walking distances to a lot of what we came there for. We knew about the $$ for Valet parking, but honestly, most hotels downtown charge, and the convenience of pulling in and not worrying about parking was pretty satisfying. The beds were not extremely comfortable, but the room was great. For a suite, the bathroom was incredibly tiny, but it got the job done, and the kitchenette was adequate and helpful. The pool on the top of the hotel was great, and made for a fun visit. However, be prepared to wait for the elevators! The co-location of an ABC store next door was pretty awesome (Dole Whip!) The nighttime noise was a bit excessive, but it was the 4th of July so there were plenty of drunks and loud cars about (they were there at the fireworks shows and just continued drinking, so I couldn't expect much else)

This is no 5 star resort building wise, if you want fancy fancy not your place. BUT it has friendly staff, comfy enough quarters, easy valet, clean, and GREAT location. I would stay here again, we stayed at 3 resorts during this trip (really high end and medium/low) and were happy with all of them for different reasons. Location vs. price this would be the most likely we would revisit. Prepare to pay a resort fee everywhere, they have the cheapest. Valet is $35/night it will be at all hotels. Get discount 10% off at food downstairs. 2 min walk to beach.

The Imperial Hawaii Resort is in a great location. Beach at the back door and shops in all directions. Lovely little roof top pool with amazing views. Hotel is a little older and could do with a refurbish but it is clean and tidy and family friendly. ABC store right next door and great place to buy everything!! We were able to walk to most places and just got a shuttle out to the best outlet shopping venue near the airport. This is worth a trip, great for bargin buys. Target , Wallmart and the shopping mall just before them are all within easy walking distance and great place to look around especially if you come from NZ.

We stayed a week with our Vacation Club, and really enjoyed our stay. We had the Hala Suite - 2 BR, 2 Bath with a sea view and balcony overlooking Lewers St. If you're a light sleeper, Aircon a bit noisy - we always take earplugs when traveling. The Suite is very comfortable, clean and modern - it was lovely to have a full kitchen on the occasions we didn't want to eat out. Great, helpful, friendly staff too. Imperial Hawaii is located in the perfect place to walk and use public transport for getting around Waikiki. We also used "The Bus" to get to our tour of Pearl Harbour, departing just a block from the hotel. A great ABC store for supplies [great Poke!] directly under the Hotel, and many restaurants within walking distance.We'd definitely stay here again if we come back to Waikiki.

Very old building and needs serious renovation, everything is falling apart, we have ants in the room and it seems they failed to fix, room size is reasonable, the main view is a parking of other building,

Alot smaller than photo's online. We moved furniture a little and found trash. Bathrooms very very small. Decor fairly nice and really nice service. Location really central to shops, restaurants and beach.

Small but adequate units. This resort continuously is upgrading but still has a ways to go. Recent staff isn’t as friendly or helpful-please work on this!!! The pool is very, very small. Housekeeping is ok but they skipped a lot this trip. Location is amazing as is the Owners Lounge. Dennys and ABC store underneath is awesome. Kailua Beach is rocking this time of year.

As my title indicates, everything about this hotel is good. Good = reasonably priced, reasonably appointed, reasonably good distance from everything. We stayed in the Banyan Suite. We loved the fact that it had a full kitchen, so we saved money by cooking breakfast and or snacks. Having 2 bathrooms was great as we had 6 people in the room. Although things were a little cramped, bed space was plentiful due to the murphy and sofa bed (in addition to the bed in the room)The ABC store there had EVERYTHING. It even served food and had poke. We spent a lot of money there between beer, snacks, clothing, meals, and souvenirs. It was literally a one stop shopping megalopolis. I thought the best service came from the valets. We rented a car. At the Imperial, you simply drop off your car and the valets park and retrieve your car. They were ALWAYS prompt, professional, and friendly. By the end of our trip, we had interacted with valets so much, we were on very friendly terms. They made our experience at the Imperial.

excellent location , easy to reach everywhere by walk, confortable rooms . They help us to early check in and late check out. Hotel facilities such as loundry , house keeping , pool area and jakuzi etc. are enough to stay a week . By early bird reservation you can stay here for reasonable price .

We were very pleased with this hotel- we stayed here with two teenage boys for 5 nights and the intent of this trip was a surf vacation. We arrived early and the hotel was able to check us in right away with a hotel room on the 26th floor which included an amazing view. The staff were kind and very courteous. Ty Gurney Surf Shop is on the same block, so we rented surfboards for the week from them and the hotel also had a surf locker for the boards which was very helpful. The bellmen were also very accommodating when we needed to get the boards out which was several times a day. Room: we were in a suite with a separate bedroom, one pull out sofa, and a pull down bed. Bathroom was small but functional. View, as mentioned before, amazing. You could easily watch the Friday night fireworks from the balcony. Location: Also amazing- you won't get a real resort vibe here, but the location is in the middle of high end, upscale shops. And lots of them! The ABC store underneath the hotel is more than just a package store. You can get beer/wine, but also a grocery store, and restaurant.
