There is a Longs Drug Store right around the corner for anything else you might need. Food: Yard House for Happy Hour, Duke's for the lunch buffet, and farmer's markets for dinner. Loved the variety and local foods you could get at the markets as there was something for everyone at very reasonable prices. Activities: We tried to stay out of the sun during the hot part of the day. There is a move theater about 2 miles away, but highly suggest renting a car to get out of the city to the North Shore one day and another to visit the Kualoa Ranch and Polynesian Cultural Center. I think our favorite thing was hiking Koko Head Crater which is hard both going up and coming down, so plan accordingly. We didn't see young children or too many older people hiking this- it's too strenuous. There are 1200+ rail road ties up the mountain, no paved walkway, or handrails. It took us 1.5 hours round-trip, but our boys made it in half that time. At night, there are also street performers on the main strip. The hotel was reasonably priced and very well located. I would stay here again.

It is a great location on Beachwalk and if your lucky to have a room facing the ocean you have a great view and the Friday night fireworks show from the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort. Walking distance to everything: beach, dining, entertainment and shopping. There are lots of place to eat at especially at the ABC store downstairs. $20 parking per day is cheap for Waikiki but it is for valet service only which adds on additional expense for tipping.

We were welcomed by the receptionist Todd and he was super nice, despite we got there super early, he did his best to check us in as soon as possible and offered us a place to change our clothes and such, definitely the best service we have ever received in Hawaii, and his hospitality made our Hawaii journey the best !The location was really good, close to the beach , convenient stores, restaurants , also pink line stop was close, DFS gallery was nearby as well.The hotel just had refurbishment recently and everything was pretty clean, nothing like the pictures you can find on their website though.The room was located on the 18th floor offering an breathtaking view from the room, and the room had everything we need.There is a pool on the rooftop and also there is sauna and gym and hot tub on different floors.I will definitely come back again !

We rented a car and the vallets were great. Had a plumbing problem that was quickly fixed. I loved the ABC store in the lobby, it even sold Dole whips! You must take a visit to the owners lounge, the view is beyond beautiful.
user_name:
Jeri D
West Valley Utah, United States

review_body: I travelled solo this trip, so what sense does this title make? You never see everything you want your first trip, so it took two times to make it right. It's been 16 years since I last visited when I took a half-day city tour that included the U.S.S. Arizona and the Punch Bowl. When a friend of mine who is native Hawaiian heard where I was staying he said, "You've got to get out of Waikiki man," so he took me to Tantalus nearby, the North Shore, Turtle Bay and a fine coffee stand. Though I took a bike ride my first time to Diamond Head, I got there at 5 pm which is closing time, so this time I got there in the morning. The guide books say allow 2 hours and that's just about right. It's great excercise and has fantastic views all around. I took the bus which picks you up close to the Imperial Hawaii Resort and drops you at the entrance to Diamond Head. I really spent very little time driving in Honolulu. I also took an all day island tour that stops at Hanauma Bay, the Blow Hole, a macadamia store, Kualoa Ranch and the Dole Plantation. What I liked about the Imperial Hawaii Resort is that it has a roof top pool with fantastic views & is a few minutes walk from Waikiki Beach, so I swam in the pool and the ocean every day, starting off with a soak in their hot tubs on the 3rd floor. They also have a nice excercise room and laundry on the 2nd floor. I enjoy photography so I requested an upper level room in their 27 story high rise & wound up on the 24th floor, which was pretty nice. No matter where your room is though, you have that view from the roof top pool. I was very pleased witht the service at this hotel, the staff all around were very friendly & helpful.

Great location. Super close to the beach and lots of shops and restaurants. The room was nice but the bathroom walls were not very clean. Hairs that were definitely not mine on shower walls. $10/night “resort fee” added to the bill. Resort? Because there is no free breakfast or daily housekeeping like a proper hotel has? Seems pretty underhanded to add that fee but what are you gonna do after a long flight and just want to get into your room? Whatever. I would stay here again if I had my family with and got a good rate.

Close to Waikiki beach and shopping mall. Nice kitchen and clean big room. I love to walk and sit on the beach. The hotel has everything what I need. Nice staffs are informative. ABC convenient store is located in front of the hotel.

No need to rent a car as you can walk most places within 10-20 min. Lots of restaurants close by. Beaches & Fort DeRussey park close. Central a/c with TWO controls - 1 in BR and 1 in LR. Tall toilet. Beds & pillows comfortable, ceiling fans in LR & BR. Black out drapes. 3 elevators. If you're trading in on a T/S you can access the Owner's Lounge on the 26th floor - great for sunsets & to watch the Hilton fireworks on Fri evenings.Negatives - VERY small units. We were in #902 "Banyan" - 1 BR, 1 bath. NO view. Only a small fridge & microwave. You can ask for a toaster, electric kettle etc. As in any densely populated area there is LOTS of noise. There are trucks, buses, cars, trolleys - not to mention HORDES of people. Our last 2 nights we smelled marijuana which seemed to be coming thru the a/c. Staff very responsive but not able to do much. Would be nice to have a fan in the bathroom and/or on microwave to put on at night as 'white noise'.

The hotel was in a great location but I was disappointed because I had a Murphy bed and for short stay, they didn’t clean your room ( I stayed 3 nights)And the air conditioning was so noisy.It’s too bad...

Im not sure why they call it resort. I don't think the tiny pool up on the roof which is slightly bigger than a plunge pool counts. Also was really disappointed our bed was a very small Murphy be. The location though is amazing, one block back from the beach, so night time walks to the sunset where amazing.
user_name:
Lorraine C
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: My Experience:This is my 5th time staying at this hotel / resort. So, I have seen the changes of it everytime I'm here. This time was great as well and is the only time I ever called them to fix something. Our bath tub was clogged. I informed front desk as I left for the day (I didn't get any attitude at all) and when I came back it was fixed. The room was clean and roomy as always. And I can tell it was newly decorated / renovated (Lovely job). Staff was nice and attentive as always.I noticed a few disgruntled guest comments on this site before writing this. All I can say is talk to people how you would like to be talked to. If you are rude then I'm sorry your not gonna get flowers. I understand that we're the customers but we're not always right. You had to go out of your way to create an account to warn people about this hotel? Wow...that's all I have to say.And for the customer insulting the Manager on her appearance. Really, you sound really sour and I can imagine how you approached the Manager with a sour attitude.All in All...read all the reviews or look at majority of them their good / great. Your in Hawaii and on vacation. Don't stress and have a great time. This hotel is located in the center of Waikiki and walking distance to every restaurant you could ever want to go to. Their are so many options. The beach is literally 3min away (walking). Rooms are clean, spacious, comfortable bedding and employees are great and attentive.

This hotel was very comfortable and was in a great location if you are looking for the Waikiki beach and nightlife experience. Plenty of shopping and restaurants to chose from! The hotel did charge $35/day for parking and amenities were a little lacking. That said, we had a great time here!
user_name:
Dubvchris
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Comfortable hotel well located Had plenty of room for myself & 3 young Grandsons A very convenient ABC Convenience Store and Denny’s at our doorstep and also plenty of great places to eat close by and lots of shopping It was a shame their pool was closed for most of our time there, especially with 3 young boys who love swimming I would certainly stay here again

First the good news. You are literally a block and a half off Waikiki Beach. Heck, if we could have we would have pitched a tent in a park to be that close. We couldn't, so the Imperial was our 2nd choice. The beach was everything it was hyped up to be. Packed with people, and of course, the Pacific ocean. Wonderful x 1000.The staff at the Imperial were amazing. Anything we wanted or needed they told us where we could find it or they found it for us. Case in point - golf club rentals. Look no further than the concierge desk. Food? Denny's downstairs or the ABC store (largest one in Honolulu apparently) right under the hotel. The only thing they didn't have was a wireless mouse (I know, what the heck am I bringing a computer to Hawaii for, right?)The Imperial also does time shares. Those that participate, get access to the owner's lounge which is about half of the 26th floor. Great place to cook family meals and have a sit down with 10 of your closest friends. Or a great vantage point from which to watch the weekly Friday night fireworks at the Hilton just down the beach.Now the not so good. The place is dated. Everything from the carpets to the beds. We had a Murphy bed that you pull down from the wall, sleep on it and then put it away. I thought, why bother putting it away. Cuz for one, the washroom door won't open all the way. And for two, the wooden skirt on the Murphy bed goes all the way down to toe level, but not all the way to the ground. I walked into that skirt at least two times to massive pain and cursing until I finally got the message that it was better up and tucked away into the wall than hanging around waiting to ambush my big toe again. The shower head was barely hanging from the wall and there is absolutely no venting in the washroom. So smells and humidity hang around for some time after use.Parking was decent at $18USD a night. Ice was only to be found on the 2nd or 3rd floor. Towels were changed daily. You could even use their towels for the beach. Beach chairs were a fraction of the price that beach vendors rented their chairs out at.Otherwise, a safe, clean and hospitable place to stay. Not a Hilton, for sure, but you definitely get what you pay for.Recommended.

Amazing! We stay at the Imperial every year sometimes twice a year. This resort is fantastic and we love it! Best location near everything beaches restaurants shopping bus shuttles etc. The staff are excellent and rooms lobby pool have been updated in the last year. Rooftop pool and owners lounge have amazing views also. ABC and Dennys just out the front entrance. You cant beat the Imperial!

Stayed a week at the imperial. The location of the hotel is perfect in the middle of the city a street back from the beach. Only a couple of min walk. We stayed in what we were told was a 2 bedroom apartment but was just a fold out bed in the lounge area. There was two bathrooms that were handy. The decor was old and dated. Too much furniture in such a small space. We found we had to stack chairs in the corner so we didn’t trip over things. The kitchen was very useful large oven, dishwasher. The pool is rooftop very small, not really enticing to swim in. We didn’t bother. And A hot tub and sauna that weren’t turned on. The only advice I would give is DONT go to the travel agent in foyer. She wasn’t very helpful and looked like she would rather be somewhere else. Very short and blunt. We booked atv at Kualoa ranch. She never informed us that we had to go to the bus depot around the corner and said a car would pick us up at the hotel. In fact it was a large coach. Nearly missed our ride!

This is a great resort in a great location. The resort is older - you can tell by the decor and the furniture in the room, but it was clean. And the staff is awesome! Very friendly and very welcoming. It feels like you're going over to your relatives, if that makes sense. They feel like your uncle and aunties and not so much like a hotel staff. Weird right? But in a good way. You're steps away from the beach, there's a really nice ABC store that's opened till midnight and a 24hr Denny's attached to the resort. And you walk out to really nice shops and restaurants and the street is lined with tiki torches. Really pretty at night. But honestly, all of Waikiki is like this. Very tourist friendly. Oh and around the corner from this location is a 24hr longs drugs (owned by CVS). And if you're doing any attractions that requires a pickup, we found that lot of them will pick up at Outrigger Reef, which is literally right across/corner from Imperial. Lewers Street dead ends at another resort, and next to this resort is Outrigger Reef, which also has a Starbucks attached to it. There's 2 SB's within minutes from this resort if that's your thing. Another PERK! Going back to pick up points. We did couple of hikes that required pickup, and when you're getting picked up at 6:10 am, it was SOOOOO nice to be close to the pickup spot. I'll admit, this resort was not my first choice, but it really worked out for us. And we would definitely go back to this resort on our next Waikiki trip as it had everything we needed. If you're looking for fancy, this isn't the resort for you. But honestly, unless you're planning on spending all your time AT the resort/in your room, who needs fancy??

Great location if you like entertainment within walking distance. The beach, restaurants, shopping and entertainment is within walking distance. So much to do within the area. Front lobby customer service was great.

This hotel has the best location, rooms & staff for the price. Rooms have been updated. You can have full kitchens or kitchenette which helps with reducing your cost of food.There is an ABC store as well as Denny’s on the 1st floor. This hotel is nestled between the new Embassy Suites, PARC Hotel,Halekuni and 1 block from Trump Tower. Beach access is across the street and 1 building away. Location is right on the famous Beachwalk. There are more restaurants and stores in this one block then you can imagine. 3 Starbucks, PF Changs, Cheeseburger in Paradise, Subway, Roy’s, The Yardhouse, Giovanni Pastrami and many more. We have been staying here for several years, tried other locations but always come back to The Imperial. (All my pictures are in my old phone )

I have stayed here a couple of times. This trip not so good. I booked this trip 6 months ahead of time. I requested an upper floor and that we get a room overlooking the front. When we arrived we were put on the 3rd floor min the back facing the back of another building. Very disappointing. Te valets are extremely friendly and helpful unlike the front desk. I heard for a fee you can check out at a later time as most mainland flights leave in the evening It would have been nice if it was mentioned when we checked in. The one good thing about this place is that it is close to the beach and other more high end resorts and shopping.

My parents were to stay at the hotel celebrating their 40th wedding anniversary last month. Me and my borther wanted to surprise them and I contacted the hotel asking if it was possible to oder a bottel of champange to their room with a note whishing them a wonderful week. I was in contact with Bryan which is the resort manager. He was very helpful and helped us suprise our parents. Even sent a picture of the bottle and note set up in the room. I could not have been more happy with the service he gave.

I have never had a worse experience at a hotel in my life. The staff was hands down the rudest I have ever encountered, the beds are gross, and management did nothing to resolve.I have stayed in hostels cleaner and nicer than this place. I literally made a Tripadvisor account to warn people about this hotel. Don't even consider staying at this place. They have so many hidden fees upon check in, spend your money elsewhere.

We have a timeshare. Sleeps six with a complete kitchen and fridge. We've been goin here for some 30 years. Love the management and the renovation. It is in a busy location so if U want not o be bothered by fellow travelers don't go here! Clean next to Waikiki . Every tour picks U up. Breakfast restaurant right next door. Pool on the roof! A great ,but small gym. My wife is disables, she loves this place!

Nothing is cheap in Waikiki but compared to what else I saw this place was great value as it had a real pull down bed in lounge- not a sofa. We stayed in the Bayan suite and it was great for our 3 night Waikiki experience. Great to have some basic cooking facilities as we have a toddler and our mum came too. Location is across the rd to the beach and is in the heart of everything. Staff were super accommodating to us with our toddler and we can't thank them enough. Bathroom isn't large but it had a bath for our toddler. Parking is valet only at $35 per day. We took the bus a few times and had no issues. Side note would suggest to bring your own car seat as they are $14 usd to hire per day. Tip: Parents if you can lug your porta cot/pack n play from home it's worth it as to hire was around $7 US per night. The place does not have room servicing daily but you can get more linen at any time. The gym was fine for a hotel gym too.Would recommend for families as even though the rooms weren't massive we were comfortable.

Nice hotel/condo suites. We stayed in a 2 bedroom “Hala” suite. 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, couch that pulls out into a bed, kitchen table area. TVs in each bedroom with free wifi, small balcony off each bedroom. Laundry machines available onsite. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are cleaned and sheets changed every 4 days although additional linens/towels are available on the 3rd floor. Parking is $35/day but if you have a military ID there is secure parking about a block away across from the Hale Koa. Buy the 1 month parking pass even if you are only in Oahu for a week or two as it is cheaper than the week package. There are in/out privileges with the monthly parking pass. Denny’s is next door to the Imperial and the “Special value” breakfast is good, filling and quite cheap. And the beach is about a block away!

We stayed on level 8 facing Lewers Street in a Studio room. The room was clean although the pull-down bed itself was very uncomfortable. We ended up using the sofa-bed which was larger. The bathrooms here are very small.But.....this hotel is centrally located and the staff are friendly. I had a really lovely stay here even though we faced another apartment across the road. The ABC convenience store located on the ground floor has good supplies and if you need it, there's a Dennys on the ground floor too.If you get a good price, I'd easily stay here again.

We were here for two weeks in two different rooms which we traded for through the Hawaiian Timeshare Exchange, one much better than the other. Our second room was right across from a giant parking garage which was noisy in the morning, but even still the room was nice and I would stay here again. We had access to the penthouse owners lounge which had amazing views of the sunset and the Friday evening fireworks nearby at the Hilton. The location is fantastic. You can rent beach chairs for the week at the front desk and walk out the back of the hotel across the street to the cute little beach tucked in next to the Sheraton where the big tourist Catamaran tours come and go all day. There is also surfboard and SUP rental right there as well as the Sheraton beach bar. It's an easy walk down the beach or down the street to Dukes and the main Waikiki beach.

we stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite on the 12th floor with a partial view of the ocean, clean and tidy and the staff happy to help with any issues. fully self contained with full size fridge, dishwasher, oven and microwave and all glasses and cutlery. A perfect spot to be right in the middle of all the action (the choice of 2 Starbucks within spitting distance of one another) the most awesome ABC Shop complete with Deli that served the best food if you didnt feel like going out and Dennys restaurant open 24/7 under the hotel. a 30 second walk away from the main street Kalakaua Avenue and all the shopping action, if tour operators didnt pick you up from the hotel the alternative was just across the road so easy walking. Pool was clean and refreshing, Guest Laundry spotless and the machines new and all functioning. Would....no will definitely stay here again when we go back and we will be back :)

Everything is at the most a 5 minute walk from the Imperial. That includes the beach, bus stops & at least 3 of the designated "pick up" sites for tours & day trips. The Oahu Go City card is a real money saver.We had a studio apartment which has a Murphy bed, balcony & partial kitchen which is exactly what we ordered. The kitchen had a mini-frig, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, sink, basic utensils & dishware. One is able to check out electric fry pan & other necessities although we did not use this feature. WiFi was great & TV had 50 channels available. The room was clean, tidy & comfortable. The sauna, hot tubs (yes 2 of them) & pool were clean & areas well kept even though they were doing exterior & interior painting & renovations. We viewed Friday night fireworks from the balcony of the owners lounge & it was the best choice for us non-drinking elders.We purchased most of our meals at the ABC store which is adjacent & has a wide assortment of deli style selections freshly made in house. We also ate at Denny's (10% discount) a couple of times. Do recommend the luau at the Polynesian Cultural Center.

We took a 1 bedroom with mini kitchen. Bedroom was tight but clean and new looking. We had apartment size fridge with Microwave and coffee pot. Go to housekeeping and get a electric fry pan and kettle. They have every thing you need in or near by. ABC store has ready made stuff to eat and you can get beach chairs and even coolers , tennis rackets and golf clubs to rent for the day at the hotel.They have a nice hot tub and pool.They have an exersize room and sauna too but we were to busy to look in. Liked the laundry. Because we went using RCI we were able to get keys to the executive/ owners lounge..great place to watch the fireworks on Friday nights. It has a full kitchen in it if you want to cook a full meal. Harold from Elite Concierge is your man for all your tour needs. Right next to front desk.Every thing from Free Hula lessons and Free Lei making to Polynesian Cultural Center. Look for all the little back walkways from Hotel to Hotel as these get you too the beach with out swimming threw the crowds of people on the street.He can give advice on how to get anywhere. Take it all in with this centrally located Resort.

The room was a two bed with living room and two balconies. Well equipped clean and comfortable.There is also a spacious members lounge on the top floor with a balcony giving wonderful views of the ocean and surrounding area.The rooftop pool is ok but not great.Nice sauna but shower arrangements a little odd.Jacuzzi was out of action.The hotel is right across the road from the Halekulani and Waikiki Beach. There is a Dennys accessible without leaving the hotel and a large ABC store next door.There is a Starbucks a two minute walk away and you are then on the Main Street and all the shops and restaurants.Exceeded expectations!!!

Look at the pictures on the Imperial web page to see the nice upgrades that they have recently completed in 2017. The carpets and drapes are new. There are two night stands by the bed. We stayed in a Palm suite that now includes a full size, stainless steel refrigerator. The Palm suite is great for two people and possibly three. It has two small bathrooms - so my husband and I each had our own. Vanity space is limited and counter space in the efficiency kitchen does not exist. But we had everything we needed. (Milk in the ABC store was $11 per gallon and a half gallon if ice cream was $12. Bread at the small grocery store a few blocks away was $4 to $6 per loaf)The pool is small, but it is nice that it is on the roof so you can get sun. It is easy to walk between the hotels to the Waikiki sand. They rent low beach chairs (with storage pockets) for $15 for the whole week. They are easy to carry and nice to sit on. The Owners lounge is great, if your unit does not have a view. I did a one week RCI exchange. I was assigned to a unit on the 8th floor over looking Lewers St. We learned that even "owners" only get view units every other year. You need to be at least the 12th floor to see the ocean. Many people rent for three weeks or more, so vacancies are hard to get. The street noise from Lewers St. begins at 6:30 am - but the Embassy Suites, the Wyndham and the Parc hotels hear the same noise in most of their units. The staff are great. We would stay here again.

Good location with general improvement of rooms but even with its great location the "aloha" feeling is missing. What should be a family centred endeavour seems to be drifting towards a cold, impersonal business operation. Its a toss-up as to if one should comeback.

Great location near the beach and shop. Grocery store right in the resort. Everything walking distance. Great parking with valet and cheap for the area. The apartment was clean and very confortable. The top is the pool on the roof top with vue. We had an excellent stay.

Great location, accessible to all Honolulu has to offer. My daughter was there on a quest pass thru RCI. Time share trading normally gets the lower floors, so not a great view normally. But the hotel was quite clean, staff very friendly, and always willing to help, as needed.The studio was perfect for 2 people. The resort is right across the street from a lot of different shops and restaurants (upscale), with only about a 2 block distance to the beach. really great location.. My daughter got a rental car for one day only, as you are located well in the center of the Waikiki area, so cut her parking costs to nothing, as she picked up the car right across the street from the resort and returned it that night. Outstanding

We are time share owners here and we love it. We stayed over Christmas and the lobby was beautifully decorated. The hotel has gone through quite a few updates recently. They have painted the outside, redone the lobby and updated rooms. The updated they have done have helped reduce the outside street noise and they have tinted the windows which keeps the rooms cooler. The location cannot be beat. The beach is a couple minute walk and the Waikiki Beach Walk is right across the street. There is plenty of world class shopping within five minutes. They have an owner's lounge on the 26th floor which offers an outstanding view of the ocean and you can watch the Friday fireworks from here but arrive early as it can get crowded. The pool is at the top of the hotel on the 27th floor, this has been completely redone and is now salt water. Laundry services are on the second floor and they have new washers and dryers. The hot tub is on the third floor. They have valet only parking and it cost $25/day unless you are staying for the week then it's $20/day. The entire staff are very friendly and helpful. They always great you with a smile and say aloha.

We stayed in a one bedroom owners unit on the 21st floor. The condo is across the street from the beach and in the midst of an upscale shopping area. If you are looking for peace and quiet this isn't the place for you. But if you want to be within walking distance of the action, in a room that isn't incredibly expensive, then stay here.We had a car and free valet parking. The driveway is a dangerous...too many pedestrians. The valet staff is friendly. A.J. was so kind. The front desk staff is friendly. The elevators are very slow.The units are bare bones and the bedroom was very very small. It was nice having two bathrooms. We would stay here again just for the location.

We had one small bedroom, a sofa which opens up into a bed, and a bed that pulls out from the wall (Murphy bed). The room was located on the lower floor-- North side was noisy: We could hear the garbage trucks which woke us up early in the a.m., and the noise from the hotel's garage behind us. The small patio had no view to speak of, the back of a bldg., and the garage which generated noise from cars going in/out. The only good part was that its location was a 5 minute walk from the beach, nearby restaurants and shops. The staff was delightfully helpful. Aloha
user_name:
Cutestuff13
New York City, New York

review_body: Awful and very dirty hotel it is not a resort and charge guest resort fee and room fee which I never received . The manager female one I spoken to about changing the bed linen and clean towels after 6 days was scuffy and unprofessional and dirty her self she looked like she had hangover. She was not aware when we arrived and she ask the reception for the information which was wrong . Also renovation where been completed and you had work men peering at guest near the pool and us taking the lifting They should have not charge any guest for resort fee because the workman doing the renovation had control of the hotel. The place was dirty and staff were un interested in complains as they are problem used to guest been unhappy . There was stinky smell old carpet and can not believe this is a resort . This place is very run down but I understand due to the unprofessional managers and the scuffy staff This placed need to restaff and more professional managers who are neat and tidy and the place need to knock down rebuild by professional .The bell men and Marvin and his manager was only professional staff around and they were very helpful. I will highly recommend people not to stay in this dump . It was near other nice hotels thank god for tours booked. I will never go back to waikiki on time share again It was a nightmare and they charged us 689.00 extras for 2 nights.

Perhaps the most compelling attributes of this hotel are its location only about a five minute walk to the beach coupled with the fact that the per-night price is correspondingly lower than the hotels on the beach. I hesitate to call this a budget hotel but relative to the hotels on Waikiki Beach it was inexpensive. Ultimately though the price reflects its good location and middling amenities so I would say the price is fair for what you get. My friend and I were in a modestly sized studio that had a Murphy bed, pull out sofa bed, and kitchenette. Like many vacationers in Waikiki we didn't spend a lot of time in the room but it was adequate for our needs. Our 3rd floor room faced another building so there was no view but it would be unfair to penalize the hotel for this because I purposely did not select the more expensive room options which presumably do have city or beach views. The rooftop pool is decent but not so great that one would necessarily prefer lounging there versus the beach, unless you're just feeling lazy, which tends to happen on vacation. The staff (front desk and valet) was very friendly so definitely no complaints about personnel. Another plus about the hotel's location is that it's above a large ABC Store, which I learned is ubiquitous in Waikiki, and directly across the street from a town center with a number of restaurants and shops -- though I should point out that there is no scarcity of restaurants and shops anywhere in Waikiki! The resort/amenity fee was $8 per day which is low compared to other hotels I considered but, again, I think it accurately reflects the modest scale and scope of amenities that the hotel offers. Overall it was a good hotel for our purposes and I recommend it to people who who want to be in the middle of the action but not spend a lot of money on lodging.
user_name:
Robert C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Brilliant location and view. We had a studio with a bedroom.and in the front room there is a bed that comes from the wall and also a sofa bed. Small kitchenette with micro oven, toaster, kettle and fridge. Small bathroom but was ok for us. All the staff were amazing and friendly. Right beside the front is an abc convenience store and a dennys which always seemed heaving for breakfast. The Jacuzzi was great, pool.on floor 27 not large but enough for a quick dip and cool off. The hotel however is situated just round the corner from the beach. They have beach chairs for hire. We used the valet parking which was swift.

Located on Lewers Street near Kalia Road, the hotel has everything you need in the hotel or nearby. The driveway looks like a walkway and I suggest caution when you enter as pedestrians are obviously cutting you off. But, the room we had slept 6, a queen bed in the bedroom, and a murphy snd sofa bed in the living room. Sofa pull out was very lumpy and I realized we still had the “old” furniture. Loud noise from all the early pick up of the trash by the dump trucks, so ask for a higher floor. Time Shares available. You must have a massage here at Aloha Therapy. Valet parking only, laundry rooms snd full kitchen was very nice. Patio had no view on floor 6. Great rate for a good room. Two bathrooms made it nice, but the shower in the bedroom is small. The other bathroom has a full tub/shower. Will stay here again. No smoking, Denny’s Restaurant is downstairs with an ABC convenience store too! Beach access is across the street but the beach is narrow and deep. Starbuck in 2 locations for a short walk. Friendly staff, and the bell desk rocks!!!

We enjoyed a 9-day stay here, 4 adults in a Palm Suite. It had 2 full bathrooms a bedroom and a bed in the living area. There was an additional pullout sofa, so it could accommodate 6 people in total. It had a great functional kitchen and a big fridge. Clean and spacious. Friendly staff. It is located walking distance from the main strip and very good restaurants: across the street is The Yard, family friendly sports bar with delicious food and a selection of 130 beers including local brews. Bus stops and beautiful public beaches are also a-few-minutes-walk away. Do not rent a car, traffic can be heavy and parking at the resort is $30/day. You can walk anywhere from here. There is a lot of nightlife happening, bring earplugs for restful nights. Shops are open until late too. Do not miss hiking opportunities i.e. Diamond Head or Koko Head trails. I highly recommend to explore on your own, tours are super expensive- sales people are everywhere!- and with little research and the use of google maps you can have a better time for less. Bus Day Passes for $5 per person are totally worth it and will take you anywhere safely. Drivers are friendly and will help you! The Polynesian Cultural Centre is a 2hr bus ride, make a day of it!

We stayed here via timeshare for a week and had a great holiday. Staff were great - front desk, housekeeping, concierge and location is fantastic. You are between an ABC store and a Dennys and a short walk to beach. Public transport is close by and a lot is in walking distance. We had a one bedroom unit which had plenty of room - kitchenette area is not big but it was ok. Coffee maker but no kettle, however a quick trip to housekeeping fixed that.Fans in main room and bedroom as well as individually controlled air con in both. Plenty of storage space and 2 x suitcase stands - yay! Would have been nice to have a bedside table on both sides of the bed but we made do with bringing in a chair from the bedroom balcony. Coin operated laundry facilities were very handy and the wi-fi worked well. There are also a couple of computers with printer in the foyer which was handy for printing boarding passes. We would definitely stay here again if we get the chance.

We exchanged to this location and it's just ok. They are in the process of renovating everything, so give them time. The lobby is beautiful with a huge fish tank. Staff is wonderful. Parking is valet only, $25/day or $100/week. Rooms are not 5 star glamorous but clean. We did see 1 roach during our stay but apparently this is not uncommon in Hawaii from what I'm told and what I saw in Maui as well. We had ants on the kitchen counter near the sink the first 2 days and we observed the exterminator in the building and did not see any after. We had a 1 bedroom with 2 full baths, full kitchen, balcony, lr, and 2 flat screens with dvrs. Full size bed (also common in HI). You cannot beat the location which is close to everything. Buses are available if you want to go outside the downtown area. We rented a car, but only used it twice during our week stay. No onsite restaurant but Denny's is downstairs (food was not great so go to a local place). Rooftop pool, owner's lounge (if you are a timeshare owner) bar, fitness center, hot tub and sauna. ABC discount convenience/souvenir store is downstairs and open until 1 am. We did not hear any noise once in our room (706), corner room with view of other highrise hotels.

We returned here for our last few nights in Hawaii. At the end of Lewers Street just across the road from Waikiki Beach, diagonally across from Roy's Waikiki Beach restaurant, within a couple of minutes walk of trolley stops and bus stops, this hotel really is unbeatable in terms of value and location. We had an amazing view from our room. For those on a super tight budget, there are cooking facilities in the room or food trucks in Beach Walk on the site of the old Hawaiiana Hotel (such a shame that was demolished) which can stretch the budget further.Our last visit here in December 2013/January 2014. The lobby has been renovated and there is now a dedicated computer for guests use which is a huge improvement. I miss the Hawaiian retro decor in the lobby but the lobby is bright now and the room we stayed here had still retained that Hawaiian retro vibe which I love. We didn't notice street noise this time either. The staff too this time were all very friendly and gracious. This hotel really is unbeatable value in Waikiki.

The folks at the Imperial was very friendly and helpful. From the front desk, house keeping and the valets everyone was great. The room was a little small, but very clean and comfortable. The location is great too, easy to get to all the shops, restaurants and beaches. Lewers street is a happening place too, so the action is right outside.

The front desk people were amazing, I felt right at home from the start. We upgraded to a two bedroom and we were very happy with the room we got. Huge master bedroom but much smaller 2nd bedroom but it worked. 2 balconies and view of ocean. Denny's was in the building and a large ABC Store also. Thank you for making our first week wonderful.

This resort is in a great position very close to beach, transport, shops,we had a verylarge ABC store at the building entrance were you could buy all your needs.We had a 2 bedroom unit for 5 people with 2 bathrooms and full kitchen which was great, plenty of room for all.Staff were very obliging nothing to much trouble and as our Air New Zealand flightarrived at 7:30am and checkin was 3:00pm they got our room turned around andhad us in hours early, very greatfull.They also have a Denny's on the ground floor of the building so that was veryconvenient for the odd dinner or breakfast.A great holiday.Gail and FamilyNew Zealand

This is our second time staying here. We booked through VRBO, Room 1409. We love staying here. Great studio. Such a comfy king bed. Huge TV and fridge. Everything you need is provided. Even down to the beach chairs and beach toys, (which we used everyday). Very, very clean. The staff at the Imperial are lovely and helpful. Cheery even at 4am. The location is amazing. Denny's in the lobby almost, ABC right next door. Cheeseburger in Paradise, Roy's, they are literally all across the street. The beach is such an easy walk to. Dukes and Cheesecake Factory a short walk up the street. Ross, Nordstrom Rack, all so very close. The owners are wonderful, easy o deal with and quick to respond. We had no issues. Amazing weather. Thoroughly recommend.

This was a great find for us - staying in downtown Honolulu at reasonable price! Our room was on the 22nd floor. The hotel is just one block back from Waikiki beach with many eateries nearby. There is even an ABC store right next door. The hotel is actually a time share, so our unit included a mini kitchen. We had a small balcony, but it was big enough for my wife and I to have breakfast on, while looking out at the early morning surfers. The staff were very helpful both on our arrival and departure days. We arrived a little after 9:30 in the morning. They provided a hospitality area for us to freshen up and stored our luggage for us while we went out for a day of sightseeing. The day we left, we were able to shower at their gym/sauna after spending the morning on the beach. There is a pool up on the top floor. It is small, but it is still worth a trip up to the top floor to see the views of the city and surroundings. We would definitely stay here again!

We loved the location that was within an easy walk to the beach, shops, marina, and even able to walk to Ala Moana shops, although had to catch the bus back as did some shopping but the bus at $2 was no problem. The ABC store below was a godsend for late coffee or easy meals. Found out about the room at the top for views which was good, pity didn't know about it before the fireworks. The pool is tiny, but the beach is so close not sure why you would bother. The were a couple of problems. One was our room looked directly at a wall and over an alley, that was noisy at times. However we were out and about so much the location outweighed the no view. The second was the ensuite bathroom was a bit gross with a scrappy lifting piece of wall paper stuck over a stained mouldy bit of wall. Luckily we were able to use the other bathroom However even with the issues that would normally make me stay clear of a place the location and other facilities means we would happily stay there again.

Our family of five stayed in the penthouse for 2 nights. We walked to the beach, shopping, and dining while staying here. We had a beautiful view of the Friday night fireworks display. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. There is an ABC store and Denny's on location which was nice for the little things we needed to pick up or a quick meal. We would definitely stay here again.

a bit dated but great location. great staff. Unfortunately pool cold and wind swept on top of building and not very nice. A good location to do stuff in Honolulu with lots of bars and restaurants around you . No resort feel to it for relaxing .

Our family of three spent a week at this hotel and were very happy with the experience. We had a fantastic view of the ocean and city, and were able to see the Friday fireworks show right from our room windows. The staff was always helpful, every request was courteously and promptly met. Location was ideal, right next to the beach, mall, stores, and restaurants. No need for a rental car at all. We were completely satisfied.

The hotel was outdated. The mattress has stains on them (it's was very gross) you have to pay for maid service. You have to change your own sheets and go down to the 3rd floor for new towels. Parking is $30 a day. They do offer free wifi. The hotel staff was very friendly. The pool area is under construction. I wouldn't use this hotel again. It was affordable compared to other hotels but it was very outdated and the bed made my back hurt ( I'm only 24) ugh.

We had a really pleasant stay at the Imperial and would recommend it to any traveller who isn't driven by 5 star luxury. It's very comfortable, clean, perfectly located and with an ocean view! We were on the 15th floor and stayed in a palm room. It suited our family of 5 well. The pool could be a little nicer but to be honest with the easy 5 minute stroll to the ocean, we really didn't use it that much. The staff were helpful and tried to accommodate us as soon as possible given our flight arrived so early. Close to everything, I would stay here again.

We were here on an RCI exchange. Smaller hotel with lots going for it. Check in was a breeze and the staff were awesome throughout our stay. Literally 1 block from Waikiki Beach. You can walk through the Outrigger and rent umbrella and chairs from the stand outside and spend the whole day on the beach! ABC store right downstairs where you can buy anything (groceries, drugstore items, cosmetics, even have a deli counter) and a rental car kiosk right there. You are right on the Beachwalk with shops and restaurants galore. There is a top floor lounge that has a full kitchen you can use and windows all around with an unobstructed view of the ocean and the fireworks at the Hilton on Friday nights. Sunsets up there are amazing!Our room had a mini kitchen without stove but we checked out an electric skillet and cooked full breakfasts. You can also check out other appliances i.e. blender and there is a toaster and coffee maker in the room. Table & 2 chairs and what we thought would be a problem...a Murphy Bed. Double bed sized... There was also a sleeper sofa and we opened it and each of us slept on one. Surprise! Totally comfortable and the sleeper was amazingly comfy!! Not luxury by any means but clean, well maintained and I understand they are doing some updating. We would stay here again.

stayed here a week as a timeshare member, in the 1bdr 2 bath Palm. Was very comfortable with two doubles in the bedroom and a Murphy bed (dbl) pullout in the Living Room. The furnishings were pleasant and easy to live in. Anything the kitchen didn't have was available on the 3rd floor at housekeeping. We used the hot tubs (inside and outside), gym, computers, concierge and laundry while there. The location was very convenient... good restaurants, shops, and right next to the Bus Depot (for tours). Also the hotel is very close to the beach. The Staff were very helpful, and a member discount was available for valet week parking... Only thing we couldve used was a USB/plug-in for our phones on the nightstand. ABC store next to lobby had whatever you needed/wanted/liked at good prices.

We booked the penthouse on the 28th floor about a year ago for our 4 day stay on the return trip from our Alaska cruise. We were 3 couples and found the position excellent. 24 hr reception, well maintained building and near a number of cafes, restaurants and bars.Just a couple of minutes walk to the beach.Would definitely stay here again.

This was our seventh trip to Hawaii and right up there with the best as far as close to shops, bars and restaurants. We usually stay at the Outrigger beach resort which is great but is getting expensive. The only negative is that you have to walk up to or near the Outrigger for the best part of the Honolulu beach and they don't have a bar area in the Hotel. We stayed in the Koe suite which was great for the four of us. The room was clean and had everything you need and large enough for 6 people.
user_name:
Graeme W
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We have stayed here several times throughout the years. I never been disappointed with the staff or the facilities. As the years go by they make improvements to the resort to make your stay even better. The location is great close to fine dining and entertainment just a short walk to the beach.

Aloha..We have been to Oahu about 30 times and have stayed at various timeshare properties, I stayed at the Imperial two years in a row and am returning next year with plans to do so every year. Honestly you cannot beat the location, everything is so handy and the front desk, bell staff and of course Michael at concierge are so pleasant to deal with. They did a soft maintenance project and updated most of the rooms, we stay in a Banyan or palm unit and all was great...Mahalo!!

Great location....close to beaches...shops..restaurants and night life. Rooms clean....spacious...well equipped with kitchenettes . Staff are very friendly...warm...and welcoming. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again! Affordable too!!

This facility is mostly time shares, but you can request a reservation. Rooms are clean and well cared for. Nothing fancy, but certainly adequate. Conveniently located near the beach, restaurants, shopping in a safe and beautiful part area. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

My room is a 1 bedroom 1 bathroom room. Comes with a bar fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. There are a few other appliances available from housekeeping no charge. A full sized refrigerator costs $25/wk. I found the bed very comfortable. The bathroom is small with limited storage. Also found the water temp in the shower fluctuated a little. You walk out the lobby door and restaurants shops etc are at your finger tips. There is a Dennys restaurant an ABC convience store, Jewlery store, and a clothing store on the ground floor. They have a penthouse room that gives you an excellent view of the ocean, the sunsets and the Friday night fireworks.

The Imperial Hawaii Resort is very well located. Everything is just across-restaurants, ABC grocery store just on ground floor and nice sandy beach just 3-4 minutes to walk. This beach I would recommend is located next to Sheraton Hotel and has tree that could provide you a shadow(many people enjoy shadow around this tree ), nice grounds at Sheraton, bar and you could have enjoyable walk in any direction of the beach.This is a little bit outdated hotel, not a 4 but good 3 star hotel. A little bit busy at main floor but as I mentioned before nice located. Rooms are relatively clean. We had 2 bedrooms and 2 bath what is good if you are with family or share expenses with another couples. Full kitchen and you could prepare food if you want to save some money on something else. Hotel has a swimming pool the roof and hot tubs on 2 floor. Overall hotel is overpriced if you are buying on web. This is typical time-share hotel.  If you going to stay in Honolulu week or longer I would recommend you to buy food at COSTCO. Be aware they don’t accept Mastercard-only VISA.Overall we spent nice time at this hotel and it is recommended especially if you could get good deal

Beautiful lobby with a convenient market on site. Great location near the beach, shopping, restaurants, and Fort DeRussy! Nice rooms with two bedrooms and two balconies and a full kitchen. The furniture and mattresses could use an update but it's well maintained. We used a timeshare exchange to book this resort and it was very nice vacation.

The reason I rated it 3 out of 5 is that it has a great location. For the rest it is less, at least the unit given to us. The units are very small. They do not even have a night table on both sides of the bed, which is NOT a king size bed. But the worst aspect was that we had only a solid concrete wall to look at if we opened the drapes. This was for as far as we could see. In terms of a unit that should allow for some meals to be cooked in the unit it had very few utensils and not even a no stick skillet. The bathrooms had so small a counter that the normall bathroom items like toothbrushes and soaps would hardly fit.If you are OK with the size then best you make sure when the reservation is made that you have a unit that faces in a direction away from a concrete wall.

I really liked this hotel. I stayed here for 8 nights with my wife, my sister and my parents. It's an apartment hotel and we had one bedroom with a bathroom, very clean. The rest of the family slept in the living room/kitchen and also had a bathroom. The only down side was that the kitchen/living room area was a little small, especially when 3 people are sleeping in the room. No bedside tables for these beds do there was a bit hard to keep all luggage easily accessible. But over all I really liked this hotel. Very friendly staff. The beach is only 5 minutes walk away and then you get to the beach and the Hilton Village fake lagoon. The army museum was also very close. The Waikiki shopping streak was just up the road. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Close to bus stops.

Near everything but if you don't want to be in the middle of the tourist attractions this is nothing for you. The hotel was nice the only thing was that the room was a bit small fore a family of five.

Family vacation,great resort very friendly staff very clean hotel.excellent owners lounge on the 26 floor with Beautiful views, nice new swimming pool on the 27th floor, and the best of all we were right in the middle of Waikiki beach just one block away! Highly recommended.

I stayed at the Imperial on the 3rd floor. I had read mixed reviews so wasn't sure what I was getting myself into. I was pleasantly surprised. The room had recently been renovated. I mean renovated from the top to the bottom. I was in a studio with a murphy bed. The bed was brand new and was very comfortable. The kitchenette was brand new with everything I needed. There is no breakfast but it is right next to an ABC store. For those not from Hawaii that's an convenience store with just about everything there. So, I went over and bought cereal, milk and whatever else I wanted. It's open 24-7. Well, they have a system at the hotel. You bring your towels and exchange them. I liked that. The people were extremely helpful... everyone asking if I had been helped everytime I went to the linen department. I love clean towels so I went there often. The people at the front desk were kind and helpful. The location was the most amazing part. I walked a few blocks down and past all the stores turned left and a few more blocks I was at Waikiki beach right where the famous statue is. I think the prices were a bit more reasonable than most of the descent surrounding hotels. Be careful when selecting. Look at the reviews because there were many hotels around that looked a bit scary. I was so happy with my choice and would go back again.

We just returned from a family vacation for 2 weeks in Honolulu staying at the Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki, staying with my wife, myself and our 15 year old son. Let's start with the good. What's good (or even great) is the location of this property. It's at the bottom of Lewers st Waikiki across the road from the Halekulani, and it's literally a 5 minute walk out the back door of the hotel to be standing on beautiful Waikiki beach! For the cost of staying at this property (e.g. roughly 1/3 to 1/4 of Halekulani) it's outstanding value and for the versatility of having apartment style accommodation you'll find it hard to beat. There's an ABC Deli store on the ground floor, as well as a Denny's restaurant, and Lewers st is littered with places to shop and eat catering to just about all budgets. There's fast wi-fi (covered by a negligible daily resort-fee) that works great. We even streamed HD movies using it and had no trouble at all. All the staff are terrific, friendly and accommodating with nothing being too much trouble (tipping aside) and everyone we met (guests included) are just the happiest and friendliest people you could ever hope to come across. I guess Hawaii is just a happy place. Housekeeping is great with an endless supply of beach, pool and bathroom towels. The room gets a full service twice a week, and the trash taken daily. The housekeeping lady who looked after us was terrific and the room was spotless (I wished I'd remembered to leave a tip for her!)Moving to what's OK. The parking is ok, although expensive at $150 per week, so it was over $300 plus tips for our stay. It's valet parking only, but you can go in and out as many times as you like, and the valet service is super quick and worth the tip. Considering where you are in the middle of Waikiki it's reasonable to pay that much. The decor in the room is ok but very dated. I understand there's some renovation happening in the place but the room we were in hadn't been renovated so it was a bit "tired". Nonetheless it was very comfortable with two queen beds in the bedroom and a "murphy" pull-down bed in the living room that our son slept on. The beds were all super-comfortable, including the pull-down. There’s also two bathrooms, and additionally a small kitchen located in the main living area.There’s a pool on the roof which is OK although it's a little barren up there and could do with some greenery as there's little else there other than the pool and some chairs / lounges. The beach is much nicer.So that leaves what wasn't good, which was the noise.We were in the noisiest room I have ever had the displeasure the stay in. The room was on level 9 facing out onto Helumoa Rd at the rear of the property. This road services the hotel, the Waikiki Parc Hotel next door, the Waikiki Sheraton car park, and the Waikiki Trolley and bus services, as well as the rear back alleys to all the hotels and shops along Lewers St. The noise starts just before 4.am with delivery trucks to the Parc hotel, the ABC shop, and other properties along the back alley. Then there's the garbage trucks picking up all the dumpsters, which is followed by even more delivery trucks. By about 6.am (if you've managed to get back to sleep) the busses start picking up tour passengers, and the limo drivers pull in waiting for jobs (I got to hear every conversation the limo drivers had, and some of them were quite colourful). The Sheraton car-park begins to fill up around this time as the cars race around to find the best spots. The bus arrivals and departures will be pretty much continuous by now, arriving and reversing out again until around just before 9am, which is when the Waikiki Trolley kicks off with one every 10 minutes. Trust me you wouldn't believe the noise! Yes all the windows were closed, and the drapes drawn, but it made no difference as the windows are so old and worn out they may as well be wide open. On the first two nights I was lucky to get four to five hours sleep. The only reprieve was that the Monday after we arrived was a public holiday, so there were no deliveries that day. Bliss!I spoke to the front-desk, who referred me to the reservations team who were nice and accepting of the problem, but could do nothing to help as the place was full (like the rest of Waikiki in January). In desperation I headed to Lowes Hardware and purchased a large roll of heavy duty duct-tape which I used to seal up the edges of the windows in the bedroom. That helped reduced the morning din by at least half and allowed me to get some sleep (and retain my sanity) for the next two weeks. Is there nothing duct-tape can't do?I'd give this property 5 stars as a great value family vacation destination, if it weren't for that noise. If you can get a room on a high floor, or perhaps a renovated room, it might be worth the risk. If you can't get that guaranteed I'd recommend to pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

Last here 18 months ago, since then, they have gone some reno's & spruced up the reception area & the apartment had a refurb in the kitchen. Great location, location& location. Friendly staff. Dennys & ABC store downstairs great place love it.

We stayed at Imperial Hotel for a week. This was an amazing stay the rooms are very comfortable and clean with everything you need. We had view of the ocean from our balcony. Beautiful view of the ocean from the 26th floor balcony wonderful place to get amazing sunset pictures. The staff at the Imperial made our stay a great one they was so friendly and helpful with such generosity. The Hotel has ABC store which was cool to shop at the famous ABC Store. There is also a Denny's in the Hotel that has amazing food at affordable prices. Just a short walk across the street is a private Beach with a Bar lay in the sand and watch Ships or Surfers or take Sunset pictures. Or you can also swim with Turtles my sister was swimming with 2 Turtles on 2 different days. Imperial Hotel is in the perfect location with amazing services and full of activities all around you to enjoy.

We were a group of 6 travellers sharing a 1 bedroom suite, with kitchen and 2 pull out beds. The hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Great location: close to shops, restaurants and beach. Good amenities: pool, hot tubs, sauna, gym. They added a mandatory resort fee, although inexpensive, was a surprise. We would stay there again and would recommend.

The last time we stayed here it was great...but now it's even better. They renovated about 2yrs ago which actually was the last time we stayed here. All improvements are great. The lobby is great and so are the rooms. The staff is awesome as always. Lynette is great but yet so is everyone else. Can't wait to go back.

We stayed recently at the hotel whilst on a trip to Honolulu . We thought the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly . The hotel needs an upgrade but for the price and the convenience of being in the heart of Waikiki it was well worth it. Met a lot of timeshare people there, who were friendly and nice to chat with. The pool on the roof was lovely but the spa was on the 3rd floor which we thought was strange why they were so far away from each other. We loved our stay there.

We stayed for eight nights- a family of five with adult children. We had a one bedroom apartment. It was a bit tight for five people but the kids were comfortable and so were we. Place is clean. Location is brilliant. Staff are friendly and welcoming. Next time I think we will opt for the bigger room. Price to stay was reasonable for Honolulu. Overall I would stay there again. Lewers street is the best.

We stayed at the Imperial for a week during a family vacation. We were a mixed group of women with a Grandmother, Mother and 2 teenage girls.We had a one bedroom Bantan suite. The actual living area was quite a bit smaller than it looked in the photos but was still comfortable when the Banyan bed was stored away. The Imperial was clean and comfortable and the staff always friendly and helpful. We did have a small ocean view from our balcony. The area was lovely and we walked to restaurants, shopping and the beach. Bus stops are very close by if we wanted to go further afield.Nice rooftop pool and bar.

We arrived very tired and with a grumpy baby in tow as we had technically been on the go for a little over 48hrs, the check in guy (Todd) i think was incredibly helpful and saw what a state we were in how much luggage we had and suggested that we look at the room we had booked versus a 2 bed version that had become available. So we did and it was a great suggestion as the first room was directly above the Denny's that is under the hotel and the smell was a little intense so after some discussion we decided to move to the bigger room. The rest of the stay was uneventful as we didnt spend much time in the room but is was clean and well equipped if you wanted to save some money on eating out. We did manage to use the pool and the gym a couple of times both of which were more than adequate for our needs.

At first we were not that happy with the room but an adjustment by the front desk manager and all was good :) You cannot beat the location!! close to all. It does need renovations for sure but to stay in the heart of things I think worth it. The staff is very attentive - from the front desk to the valet - they give 5 star service combined with the warmth of family. The top of building owners lounge is awesome! And the pool is decent after a long day. ABC store on bottom is super convenient but we went to costco as well. We rented a car as we go all over. advise a go Oahu card! This location is right across from Sheraton and Haukulani - and there is beach access right there. Walk to restaurants and al the attractions!

top location, walking easy,30 minute to all popular atractions. any direction ,all you could wish to buy,or site seeing,bus service,great, very cost effective.no need for taxi or expensive tour guide deals buses depart every 10 minutes all directions you ask for transfere ticket, you will travel back ,for free if within about 2 or 3 ,hours ,food court ,at ,alomna shopping ,is great variety of food choice. bus to china town, to look at small food court, town trades ,as it did 60 years ago bus direct ,from alamona shopping centre.

The Imperial is location, location, location. Recent renovations have taken a worn down facility and breathed new life into it. The final major stage of renovations, updating the dining and living room furniture in the units, is planned for 2017. With one of the friendliest staffs you will ever encounter, staying at the Imperial as you explore Oahau is the best choice you can make. Anything you want to do in Waikiki is within walking distance and mere minutes from the Imperial. With car rental and concierge services right in the Imperial, the island is yours to explore.

This is actually not a hotel, it's a large number of time share apartments, but is worth a visit nonetheless. The position is great, really good and is only a couple of minutes from the main beach in Waikiki. Rooms are basic but clean and the staff are very friendly and efficient. We were only in Waikiki for a couple of days and it served it's purpose perfectly.

We booked a double room last minute and what we found when we arrived far exceeded our expectations. We had a one bedroom unit with a TV in each room. The living area had a comfortable lounge with beach views, a small dining table and a pull down bed from the wall. The room could easily had slept two couples. The hotel was central to the trolley stops, beautiful beach, and main shopping area. Staff were wonderful. There is a rooftop pool with views. Next door is a convenience store where we got some of our meals, and downstairs is a Denny's where we had breakfast each morning. Would highly recommend.

The Imperial has breath taking views of the Ocean and of the City. The building is located within walking distance for shopping and restaurants. There is an ABC store located next door which sells food, beverages, and souvenirs as well as most anything else you might need. The building is growing older and needs much updating. The staff is very friendly and willing to assist visitors with advice or assistance.

We stayed in the Penthouse on Floor 28 - stunning views. We arrived very early in the morning and were aware that there would be quite a wait, so our bags were taken care of an we were given access to the owners lounge which was a life saver. We were able to shower and watch tv and even have a nap on the lounges! The staff here are amazing, especially at the valet desk (a woman who checked us in did not make a good first impression - she was grumpy and not friendly at all -come to think of it, every encounter with her was the same, lucky the guys at the valet desk went over and beyond to make up for her poor service) The renovation is looking great - cant speak for the hotel rooms as the penthouse is privately owned. I believe our room was supposed to be serviced on the 4th day of our stay but it wasn't. We went to housekeeping to get clean towels and sheets and our garbage was collected every 2nd day. The fire alarm was quite an issue, it went off at 4am one morning and was not sorted until 5am - the loudspeaker tells you to stand by and wait for further information. Such a great location being walking distance to so many shopping and dining choices - and the very convenient ABC store in the lobby. Based on location and the majority of staff being awesome - I would love to stay here again.

Top location amongst all the top hotels but at a more affordable price. Located on lowers st its two mins to the beach, on all the main bus routes and right near all the main shops, bars and restaurants.

I have been to a lot of hotels in my 40+ years of traveling and this has to be the worst.My room feels like a prison,a/c won't shut off and doesn't even work good. I could go on but If you decide to stay here definitely check where your room is located,good luck

I enjoyed my stay until the night before I had to check out, a big ROACH was crawling on my leg while I was sleeping!! When brought up to the Front desk Manager the next morning, she had the nerve to ask me if I kept the roach to show proof like I was lying!!! UNREAL!!!!! I wasn't going to complain about the hot water trickling when I had to take a bath a few times even after someone came to fix that problem, or I wasn't going to complain about how the air conditioning did not work one night for hoursssss and I had to go down again to front desk to ask someone to come fix it but was told they were working on it, and one early morning while we were sleeping. the fire alarm kept going off repeatedly and their announcement that it was a false alarm on the speaker at least ten times. I've stayed here before and will not be back again.

This hotel is very tired. Units are small, furniture out of date and not everything in the unit we had worked. The second bedroom didn't even have enough room for bedside tables. I think this problem is being addressed though. The location is spot on and you can easily walk to anywhere in Waikiki.

While the location is terrific our room was a bit disappointing. It was a studio but with no view...............we did go atop the building with a terrific view of the whole Waikiki. The murphy bed that we had was super comfortable!!! So don't say "ugh" when you see it. We slept wonderfully. The a/c ran constantly the whole week; we didn't turn it off; it didn't seem to get "cold"...........but we survived...........two people is enough for the studio; four would be too small......................

We stayed there from 9/26-29 . The room was awfully small n the bathroom couldn't fit in 2 persons. The bed was folded n a sofa bed . I couldn't find a small dinning table and oven. Well there was a microwave ! Well, pay for the location which just 5 min walk from the beach! With a rental car I learnt my lesson to stay off here!

Great time, great room. Staff are always helpful. Free Wifi. They have a pool work out room sauna and spa. Hertz rental are on site and a lot of rooms have sea views. There is a coin operated laundry with dryers. Machines take Quarters. Although check-in is not until three PM the will store your bags until your room is ready.

Absolute great location about 35 minutes from the airport. we prebooked Speedie Shuttles for our tranfers & were not disapointed with their service. About $80.00 return to the airport.An early arrival @ the Imperial ment dropping the luggage hours before our booking time which went without a hicth, & the staff ever so helpfull.After entering our room we found a very spacious unit with a large bedroom with 2 X queen size beds, 2 large bath rooms & a very large living area with a fully functional kitchen & around 80 TV chanels.There is no restaurant in this hotel, however there is a myriad of eating options within a 3 minute walk.One of the most useful outlets in Hawai'i is the ABC stores with the largest one in the hotel complex. Cooked & fresh meals, all alcoholic beveridges @ rediculously low prices, fruit & vegs, you name it ABC has it.Bars & large duty free stores are within an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel.

The bed is a bit small for 2 people to sleep. Sure it may seem like a double, but come on, I am pretty sure it's smaller. Thankfully the room comes with a comfortable sofa bed. The small kitchenette was great with the coffee maker, the microwave, and plates. We had cooked food during our stay in Maui and thankfully one of our dishes survived so we were able to save money by eating in. The room was clean and cozy and good size. We loved that the ABC store is downstairs. Valet parking is something we were not prepared for in Waikiki. Thankfully here it was only $25. We stayed on the 4th floor. The AC worked well. The net seemed to work exceptionally well also. This was quiet acceptable for the $$ value. If it is going to be windy or there is a hurricane, try to request the lower floors. I had to put a sponge pad they provided between the glass door & it worked. No noise from Tropical Storm Madeline

This is my second stay at this hotel..its not an elegant hotel but its being renovated. I stay there mostly due to its great location...just a short walk to Waikiki beach, the convenience of restaurants, shops, and transportation. My room was a one bedroom, 2 bathroom dated but has everything to one needs. Has a pool on the roof and a hot tub/gym/sauna on the third. The staff is the best. Hope to return there next year.
user_name:
Cutestuff13
New York City, New York

review_body: This place is a great central location for downtown activities, the beach and restaurants. The staff is excellent, from the parking staff to the lobby staff. Building needs to be refreshed and up to date, seems like they are working on some areas, but they really need to update. The rooms are small, and the beds are small, just not built or designed smartly.

This resort is located in a great spot, short stroll to Waikiki Beach, restaurants at your doorstep and great shopping. It's a little dated but undergoing refurbishment so should be very desirable in the near future. Staff are like family (most have been there many years) and are extremely helpful. Good choice of room styles, pool, spa and sauna. Dennys is downstairs, ideal for a cheap bite before hitting the shops or waves. Enjoyed our two week stay there very much

Spent a week there. The hotel/timeshare is conveniant located in downtown Waikiki. The room I stayed at has one bedroom, two full bath, living room, kitchen, and two balconies. There is a convenience store (ABC) and diner (Denny's) at ground floor. There is a pool on upper floor.

They are in the process of renovating the property, and it needed it for sure. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. My only complaint is that the air conditioning couldn't keep up, or even cool our suite below 80 degrees.The staff was friendly and did everything in their power to make our stay enjoyable, including having a maintenance man work on the HVAC.We own a timeshare in Myrtle Beach, and exchanged a week there for a week at the Imperial Vacation Resort; this gave us access to the owner's lounge on the 26th floor. The view from there was exquisite, and the air worked up there :)Hats off to the staff for being helpful and pleasant, even when they know that some conditions are out of their control.

Our room, the Ohia Suite, was a studio suite with a mini kitchen, a double pull down bed and a queen futon sofa bed. The decor was a little dated and the TV was an early model 40" LCD with an external DVD player and no additional input ports. So leave your Firestick at home. The central air is cold and loud. The noise is a plus for those who like to sleep to mechanical humming sounds like me. That said, the room was clean and comfortable. Besides, you're in Hawaii so who really cares about the room as long as it has a bed, a shower and is cleaner than that room in Manila. Am I right?!Parking is available for $25 a day or $100 for a week. It is valet only due to limited parking but since you are paying up front for the parking, tipping really is optional. I did drop a twenty at the end of my stay for the kind and prompt service.What ever you do, do not waste your time and money at the restaurant downstairs. There are so many good dining and takeout options within 5 minutes in any direction from the hotel that you would most certainly be doing yourself a disservice. One of the best things about Hawaii is the variety of local grinds. One of my favorite places was a lot of food trucks one street west of the hotel. A little prices but the food is really tasty. My advice is takeout and eat back in the room. You can buy your drinks and dessert downstairs in the ABC store.I don't want to make this review too long winded so I'll get to the good stuff. The best thing about this hotel besides the 2 jacuzzis, the sauna, and the rooftop mini pool from the 70's has to be the relative close proximity to the beach and everything else in Waikiki. If you're gonna lounge around on the beach and swim a little, I recommend bypassing the beaches in front of the Halekulani and Reef and walk to the beach area in front of the Hale Koa and Hilton. This area of the beach has more sand and surf, and less coral and rocks. Also, there's less of a crowd. The same water activity rentals are available there as anywhere else. Do yourself a favor and rent an umbrella and two chairs for 2 hours for $25, $15 with a military ID.Our vacation was filled with nothing but eating, drinking, relaxing and slow walking to get it all in. If this is what you want in a Waikiki vacation too, then what I recommend is for you. Aloha! Or as we say in Hawaii..."Ahhh...Lowwww...HA!"

Initially we were allocated a room that only had a pull-down Murphy bed. Upon complaining about this, we were able, by paying more, to move to a room with a bedroom. The room also had a kitchen, which we didn't use but would be good for families or those wanting to self-cater. The rooms are only serviced twice a week. The hotel is in a good location - easy walk to the centre of Waikiki and the beach. The staff were helpful when we asked for their help. The rooftop pool is very small, so we didn't swim there.

The good: If you want to be in downtown Waikiki - this is it. The price was very competitive compared with other local hotels. My room was clean and comfortable. It was quiet and I sincerely enjoyed the outside sitting area. It was great to have weights in addition to cardio machines, in the gym; and while I didn't use it, I'm sure the pool and sauna were nice. The valet was very personable and made sure my car was right up front at 5 am when I left for work. The bad:I had to stand in the lobby for a long time waiting to be checked in and didn't feel particularly welcomed. While standing in line - there were 3 or 4 of us waiting - the cleaning woman asked us to move twice (once to the right and once to the left) so she could sweep under our feet. I was shocked to find my bed was a hide-away tucked into the closet. The ugly: Traffic. Traffic was absolutely horrible. Unlike others, I was in Waikiki on business. If I were on vacation and just wanted to hang on the beach, it likely would have been fine. A very short walk from the beach and tons of stores/restaurants right across the road. As a business traveler though, both my mornings and afternoons were spent trying to navigate vehicular but also phenomenal pedestrian traffic. The valet area is not clearly marked and I went around the block twice before pulling into the Post Office and calling them for instructions.

My family (2 adults and 2 adult children) have just enjoyed a weeks holiday at the Imperial.
