We had a Palm room which is a 1 bedroom 2 bathroom unit with 2 Queen beds in the bedroom and a pull down Murphy bed in the lounge. Ours was on the 14th floor with a peep of the sea from our small balcony. The unit was self contained with a fridge, microwave and full stove/oven. As others have said it is expensive to eat in Hawaii so being able to prepare some meals was a bonus. The air conditioning in our unit worked very well to keep us cool but was very noisy, however we got used to it over the week! All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the car valet staff who fetched our vehicle whenever we needed it. Whilst the car parking is expensive $135 for the week, the convenience was worth it and being able to drive up and down the coast to visit other gorgeous beaches, swim with the turtles, surf, walk Diamond Head, visit the Waikele Outlet shopping centre etc was great. For all of this the BEST thing about this hotel is most definitely the LOCATION, it is literally a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and is surrounded by shops, retaurants and bars. Whilst it is an older property (currently being upgraded) it is priced accordingly and we felt it was excellent value. Mahalo

I had read some less than stellar reviews as we were preparing for our family trip to Hawaii and were going to stay at this resort. Naturally, I was a little concerned. However, I'm happy to say that this place was very nice and we had a great time. First, the valet service guys were great, very fast, always ready to take your car and bring it up to you. The Front Desk people were all very friendly and ready to help you in any way possible. The Lobby appears to have had some renovations done and it looks great, very clean and modern looking. The room we were in was a one bedroom, two bath, with a full kitchen. The good thing was that the kitchen, although a little small, had brand new appliances, stove, microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. It didn't have most of the amenities that we usually get at some other time shares we stay at, but it was enough for me to make breakfast, lunch, and dinner and same a lot $$$$$$ from having to keep eat out. The rooms are a bit dated, and could certainly use some upgrades such as carpet, shower, and even furniture, but it was fine and we had a decent view of the ocean. If the renovations continue as they appear too be, I'm sure the rooms are going to be awesome in a few years. Also, as has been said this place is literally in the middle of everything, shops, restaurants, beach, etc. The rooftop pool was also nice, looks recently renovated, and, at least, while we were there wasn't very crowded. So, overall, I would definitely come back and would highly recommend this resort if you are planning a trip to Oahu.

We stayed for 1 week. The resort is nestled in an excellence location just yards for the beach and exclusive shopping. My major complaint was the rooms were very old and stale. The carpet is in desperate need of deep cleaning and the air from the vents smelled of mold.

I had 2 nights at the Imperial and it was a very pleasant experience. My studio apartment was on the 5th floor and a little dark because of other building. There was plenty of electrical lights in there though. The pool on the roof top was nice and the staff was friendly.I used the express checkout which was both easy and comfortable.The elevators was slow and I had to wait a lot for them.

We stayed for two weeks at this hotel on a timeshare exchange with two nights on the big island sandwiched between the weeks. As many recent reviewers have said, the place is undergoing renovation in the common areas, so we encountered some noise, elevators not working, pool closed for a couple days, and the owner's lounge closed for several days. All of these things were not enough to ruin our stay. We were quite annoyed when we first checked in and were assigned a room on the 19th floor and before we were given our keys our desk clerk was told to give us a different room. He was instructed to tell us that the room had been taken out of service just then. Then we observed the other desk clerk give that room number to another guest standing beside us. We were then given a room on a lower floor. Very disappointing to be lied to. Our clerk tried to make it right so we waited for a room on a higher level (15th) floor so no view, and he comped our parking fee for the week. I'm very glad we kept the paperwork, because at check out, the parking had not been removed from our bill.The rooms are adequate for a week at Waikiki. Our first room had no real cooking capability except for a toaster and coffee maker and microwave. We tend to do breakfast and some lunches in our room when traveling on our timeshares so this was just enough to have breakfast and sandwiches for lunch. Hawaii is very expensive so doing a few meals in helps that cost. Our second room had a full stove so we went to the grocery store by car and made several evening meals in our room as well. The ABC store adjacent to the Imperial has much of what you need for quick meals and drinks, alcohol, snacks, and sundries.There are no king beds at the Imperial so we had queen beds each week. It is still very tight to get around the beds in the bedroom. There was also a Murphy bed in each living room but we didn't need them. A family would be able to make it work but another couple might find it very small. Our first week we had ceiling fans in the living room and bedroom which were important because the air conditioning did not keep the room cool enough. Our second week the room didn't have ceiling fans and we knew it would be brutal. I called the desk and they sent two box fans right up to us. They made all the difference, especially for sleeping.Waikiki beach is just one block away and the Imperial rents beach chairs and coolers on wheels so you can make a day of it on the beach. I recommend getting the chairs, very comfortable, and the cooler to keep drinks cold. Their cost is $10.00 for the day and to rent at Waikiki it was at least $50 for two lounge chairs but you also got an umbrella. I bought a small beach umbrella at the ABC store and used that... The sun is brutal. Watch out for wind because it will send your umbrella flying and turn it inside out!We would recommend the Imperial for a timeshare exchange or a regular vacation rental. It is not beach front, views are limited, it is not plush with turn down service and pillow mints. However, it is priced accordingly, most of the staff (especially bell service) are attentive and friendly and aim to please, and it offers some kitchen options to save a few bucks.

My husband and I just stayed here for our honeymoon! My parents are timeshare owners so we had the added privilege of using the 26th floor owners lounge which offered spectacular view of the Waikiki beach! Our room was on the 7th floor and our lanai looked out to a parking garage so our view was less than ideal but we understand you aren't guaranteed a room with a view when you book. The rooms were ok, a little dated but comfortable. The air conditioning in our kitchen/living room was out for the first 2 days of our stay and then was finally fixed, but the staff was great about it and even made up for it by waiving our valet parking fee which was so helpful!

I have stayed at the Imperial since 1995. Just recently in June it is undergoing renovations which was not inconvenient except the pool area reopened the day we left on 29th June. It is looking very nice if you like to swim in the pool. We always swim at the beach which is right there. The office and lifts were sort of temporary but worked OK. Just the most convenient place to stay so close to everything and the ABC store was at the main entrance for just about anything you need.

My wife and I have stayed here twice using RCI exchanges. Overall we really like the place. Had a one bedroom unit on the 25th floor this time and loved the view. Convenient to Waikiki beach. As others have noted there's a lot of renovations taking place; the renovations were much needed. It does create some noise and inconvenience. But I would still rate this as a good option; especially if you want more space than a basic hotel room. There is a Denny's and and ABC store on site. Many other restaurants close by.

While this place is under renovations and the lifts took forever, I'm sure that once they have completed the reno the lifts will be much faster!! We went to the 'owners lounge' to watch the fireworks for 4th July which was amazing!! Our room was tidy and clean, the staff were friendly and helpful....would definitely stay again!!

They are in the process of much needed updates for this hotel. There were a few projects happening while we were staying here. The lobby was being redone and check in was on the second floor, one of three elevators was shut down which caused long waits for an elevator and sometimes they were very full, they were replacing fire doors which was very loud. The pool opened while we were there after being closed for remodeling for a couple of months. Even with all the noise and inconvenience of the construction we enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect, only a block from the beach and shopping and restaurants are right outside the door. We used the hot tubs which are located on the third floor and the laundry facilities are useful on the second floor, washer is $1.75, dryer is $1.25 and soap is $.75. The pool is located on 27th floor and the remodeled pool deck and pool are great. It can get a little chilly because the wind is blowing constantly so grab your towel quick once you get done swimming.  The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We rented a cooler and beach chairs from the front desk a couple of times during our stay and the equipment was always clean and in good shape. The cooler was $5/day and the chairs were $3.50/day. The free wifi was pretty fast and reliable, they must have upgraded this because we have stayed here before and the wifi used to be very slow. Valet only parking is $25/day. We had two adults and three teens staying in a Palm room. This was a one bedroom with a Murphy bed and a pull out couch. It was a little cramped for the five of us but we really didn't spend too much time in the room. We had a small kitchen with a small refrigerator. The room was a little run down but they are going to be getting new carpeting and repainting the rooms in the future. The owner's lounge on the 26th floor is very nice, the view is amazing. It's a great spot to watch the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks every Friday night. Our flight from Hawaii was at 9 pm, the hotel held our luggage, let us park our car for the day and gave us a key for the owner's lounge so we could hang out there if we wanted. We all took showers before heading to the airport, there are two showers available for use.

The lobby is under renovation so the place is a mess for checking in and coming and going in and out of the property. That is compounded by the construction noise and worse the elevators, which are not all functional. Average wait time for an elevator was 6-9 minutes, with no air conditioning in the make-shift lobby areas. I never complained about any of the above but they really disappointed me on check-out day when i asked for a slightly late checkout from their 11am posted time. i asked for noon or 1130am and they declined. i understand they have to turn rooms for the next guests, but you would think with no lobby or anywhere to go and sit and wait for transportation, and with the horrible elevator service all week, they would at least try to accommodate in some way a 30 minutes request. Not only was the female desk agent short with me on the phone when i inquired, but as i was walking out of the room with my things at 11:02am, my phone was ringing with them harassing me. Not exactly spirit of aloha!

When I reserved this with Interval as an exchange, I wasn't too happy about it. It looked old, and it is, but it was in an okay location, and best of all I could reserve Monday to Monday. We were going to the Pro Bowl so a Monday was perfect (had to find). The parking is all valet so there was a $20 a day fee but it turned out that we only had the rental car for 2 days and they were really fast bringing the car around. The location was perfect. Lewers St is a short street after you turn off of Kalakana, close to everything we were wanting: food, shopping, the bus, or just walking to Waikiki. For those who want a beach there are two pathways to small beaches nearby, they say 100 yards. And my companion walked to 24 Hour Fitness every day on Kalakana St. Many of the floors were under renovation, so the "old" place should look "new" in a year or so. We had just a studio with a full size Murphy wall bed and a pullout sofa which we kept open all the time. On the 7th floor, balcony looked out to the street where we could hear music. Very small bathroom but had what we needed. Yes, it needed renovation which I'm sure it's getting. Waikiki hasn't had a new hotel in years. Housekeeping came only once to empty garbage and change linens but we could pick up anything we needed on the 3rd floor, which also had two hot tubs, an exercise room and sauna on the 3rd floor with the pool on the 27th floor.On one side of the lobby is a Denny's and on the other side an ABC Store with an excellent deli. They had a great looking deli counter, offered full breakfast made to order, sandwiches, salads, deserts, and several times I got the salmon with mashed potatoes, a salad or other side for around $8.Everything at the deli was very good and fresh.There are many different coupon books in racks on every street. Use them!! Especially transportation to the airport. I forgot what we paid but it was half what the hotel would have booked.And the Imperial, though old, has a lot to offer if you don't need to be pampered. If you are there in Jan or Feb be sure to check out the "big waves" on the North Shore. ALOHA

Room provides the basic needs which is great if you want a place to put your head and stow your bags, but dont rely on the amenities 'provided' no responsibility is taken for them, so take pot luck with using them. There is an old saying "happy wife : happy life" well all I wanted to do is a bit of laundry......we also managed to book during their renovation time, but are still charged full price.

When you get a bargain like this just a block from Waikiki beach you can forgive a few rough edges. The hotel is old, but well maintained. Pool was out of action when we were there which was a bit of a bummer. Check in was smooth, Eric was extremely helpful and held our bags until the room was ready. (We arrived on a 6am flight) They have a hospitality room to have a coffee while you wait. The on premises restaurant is a Denny's with reasonable quality cheap meals open 24 hours. The room we had had on the 25th floor, had water views. Beds in the room that accommodates 4 are a double size pull down from the wall and a queen size sofa bed. When the beds are out there is very little floor space left. The bathroom is also tiny. Rooms are only serviced after 4 days but you can change your towels (including the supplied beach towel) on the 3rd floor housekeeping any time. This hotel definitely fills the "location, location, location" bill, forgive its shortcomings

We got a room , was small, couldn't fit in the bed ,and I hit the corners with my toe, which hurt badly,I emailed reservations, a big MAHALO to Tony Gabriel, you made our stay, truly did, thanks a lot, with our kiwi dollar the free upgrade was a wow factor, we were out most of the time though due to trips we have taken.clean hotel, under construction though, all good to me, location, close to everything.view from our room, 24th floor. #2410

The staff is very friendly. We arrived early at 11:00 am and they stored our bags, would call us when the room was ready. No call by 4:00 pm so we came back and it seems they forgot to call us. We learned after check-in that the pool was closed for renovation. The pool won't be open for another two weeks. We obtained a refund, checked out and headed to the Holiday Inn. Had. A great stay there.

Only the location was great!But there is nothing to say good even if I were Pollyanna!First they greeted us to say we're under renovation lobby on 2nd floor.There was a simple white table to greet us,after we went into the room and I couldn't believe it!!!There was a stinky smell old carpet,pull-over twin size bed instead of queen size which they told us double bed!!!I can't believe thet is there any hotel room in the world like that in this century???Anyway we squeezed in double bed the other day came back for shower and dadadaa!!!Surprize only cold water for it!!!!If you go any hotel what you expect at least???Clean and tidy bed to sleep and hot water for shower right???If you don't need it you can come here and spend out your money just to close your door!Don't come this hotel anytime I have to run away tomorrow...PS: They excuse for hot water when I called them and give me temporary card to use another room's shower!But it doesn't have hot water too...If you like nightmares you're welcome!!!

Stayed in Ohia room type. We were extremely disappointed. The bed is not even a proper bed, it's on the wall and you pull it down. The frame is a tripping hazard, I have tripped on that corner so many times, we had to lay towels around it so that we don't trip. Behind the 'wall bed' was disgustingly dusty. The furniture in room was all outdated, old couch, damaged curtains, there were hairs in the bathroom when we checked in, and a leaking shower. There is no sheer curtains so you either close the curtains or just be exposed to hundreds of other apartments balconies. During our stay hot water ran out. I reported it, they said they would send someone up straightaway. We waited for long but no one came. Then we called again to see if someone is still coming. Then a receptionist said ' the whole building is down.' We should have been advised!! We wasted our time waiting. Anyway back to the room type. Apparently all Ohia rooms are like this.I can't believe they are trying to sell timeshare, when their standard is this low. Don't bother wasting your money here, spend it somewhere that has a proper bed, better feature, and customer service.

This hotel is in a great location central to everything. Rooms are in need of an update and are small. Unfortunately the pool was not open and you could not use the verandah between the hours of 8-4pm there is not a restaurant in the hotel only denny,s below. If you are booking this through booking com reconsider as their description of the room is not what is offered when you check in we were high in the hotel with views of the bay

My daughter and I stayed here for a few days last December, then returned this year with a family group for her wedding. On both occasions I had a Banyan Suite - a large living room with a pull-down bed, kitchenette, dining table and couch as well as a separate bedroom and smallish bathroom. Both the bedroom and living room had balconies and as we were on the 26th floor, the views were great. This is not a 5 star hotel, but the room had everything you could need, including an iron and ironing board, bar fridge and microwave. You know you're on holiday as soon as you enter the hotel, with smiling relaxed staff who go through check-in procedures with you carefully explaining everything, which is exactly what you need with a 6am arrival after a long flight. Nothing was too much trouble - I really appreciated being able to use the computer on the reception desk on a couple of occasions. After checking out on my most recent visit, I was unable to get on my flight and had to return to the hotel and they were very kind and helpful and found me a small sunny studio room for the night. This was on the third floor, with glass along the wall facing Lewers Street which opened to a good sized balcony where I had coffee and toast in the morning. The pool was being refurbished while we were there, but as it's only minutes to walk to the beach, this was not a problem. The hotel is a short, flat walk to just about everywhere you want to go. All in all, clean comfortable and affordable.

My aunt has a timeshare unit here, and it was very nice with great views! If you want to be in walking distance of just about everything, this is where you want to be. It's right across the street from Roy's, a block away from Starbucks, and in the center of great shopping and transportation. There's a Denny's right downstairs and the beach is just a few short walking minutes away. Rooms were clean, and service was great.
user_name:
Adrienne S
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: We arrived to find we had a great room on the top floor with outstanding views, the room was very old and outdated but veiws made up for this. We awoke in the morning to very loud jack hammering right above us!! We were not told of the pool renovations going on and the noise we would endure for our stay, no wonder we got that room. I complained and asked for another room or maybe a cheaper rate or breakfast vouchers etc... to be compensated in some way? the staff was very rude and didn't seem to care, only offered us free beach chair hire?? ($3.50) was very disappointed in there customer relations and lack of helping us out esp after I kept going back and complaining serveral times. Apparently because I booked through a travel agent (agoda) they couldn't help us out??!!

This is a "legacy" timeshare that's currently being renovated. (We were informed upon arrival that due to renovations, the pool is closed throughout our stay and for several weeks after.) The rooms are dated but OK, and the location is excellent. We got a room above the 20th floor on the WEST side of the building and enjoyed a stunning view of Waikiki Beach, the ocean beyond, and downtown Honolulu. FRONT DESK STAFF IS TOP-NOTCH...VERY helpful! (For military-affiliated people, it's an easy 2-block walk to the Hale Koa for use of their facilities, tours, or etc. Parking is $20 per day at the Imperial Resort, while it's only $7 per day at the Hale Koa a 2-block walk away...making Hale Koa's the lowest-cost parking in Honolulu as best we could find.) HOT TIP: If you're an Imperial Resort owner OR an RCI exchange guest, be sure to go to the private club area on the 26th floor at sunset to catch the incredible views from the 360-degree balcony (lanai) there!!! Take a camera or smart phone for great pics.

The Imperial can be found at the bottom end of Lewers Street about 500 metres from the beach. This hotel has 27 floors and is a good place to stop over when in Waikiki. The rooms are small but comfortable. We had the Banyan Suite which has one bedroom with a queen size bed with TV on the wall. The main room has a wall bed and a fold out bed that is the lounge chair. This room has cable tv as well. There is a small microwave, bar fridge and crockery and cutlery as well as an assortment of glasses. We were located in 2505 on the 25th floor and be aware it is noisy on this side of the building (East Side) as the hotel next to it has their service entrance. It is not a big issue but do be aware you will have to live with noise if you sit on the Lanai. From the Lanai you get a partial ocean view which is nice. The in-house restaurant is Denny's and I have heard some poor reviews of the place but to be honest we had no issues at all with the meals, service or cleanliness. We ate there 4 mornings in a row and one dinner time. Just outside the lobby is an ABC store where you can stock up on food, alcohol and other items.There are a myriad of restaurants in the area you can go to or you can get take out. One tip for you is Giovanni Pastrami down the road offer discount prices for takeout if you order delivery and the Round Table Pizza in their restaurant is good. The Kalua Pig Supreme is a must. Washing facilities are available on the second floor with a quarter machine if you need change. They have a TV there to while away the boredom of waiting for your washing. There is also an ice machine there too.Overall this is an ok place to rest your head when you are in Waikiki.

We had an Ohia room for our family: two adults and 2 kids. The room was clean even though the furnitures looked old. Before my booking, I called for room size. I was told it would be 350 sqft. I measured my family room to have an idea. But I did not feel the room was that large. We later moved to Aston Beach Hotel. Their room should have been 250 sqft. But we felt the room at Imperial was probably even smaller than the Aston's. I wondered whether they counted the balcony into the room size. Anyway, it was fine for 4 of us. They had one pull down bed and one pullout from the couch. Enough for good sleep. But with those in place, barely enough room to move around for TV, light kitchen, and dining table, etc. Air condition wasn't quiet and not so effective. Fortunately it was windy, cloudy, rainy, and not so hot when we were there. But we felt the ineffectiveness on one day since we felt very slow for it to cool down when we came back.The location was good. We could have a little bit view, between buildings, of the beach far away when we stood on the balcony. It was in walking distance from the beach. I would say about two blocks or just go through the hotel along the beach. Restaurants, shopping, convenience stores were all around. VERY convenient. No room service during our stay. But we could go to the 3rd floor to get new towels and beach towels. Coin operated laundry on site which was important for us. No self parking nearby and we only had valet parking on site. The staff were friendly. Overall, considering the rate we had we felt it was still a fine deal.

We were able to book this place for a week using our time-share. I'm grateful we were able to book something at all in Hawaii, as we were on a wait-list. Hawaii is wonderful! Required visit for anyone who has never been! The hotel is located at almost a perfect spot, right near the beach and all the action. It's somewhat dated tho, the carpet in the room needs replacing, the pool was not available during our visit. At least the hot tube was available (but one of them was broken). The lobby and valet service a good very accessible! With two Starbucks within a block or two made my mornings happy too.I would stay again, but I hope they would have some of their renos done and the pool would be open, so my poor 6 year old son could swim (as the ocean surf can get pretty wavy and scary for my son).

I rate this resort highly, it is in a great location in the quieter part of Waikiki but very handy to beach, restaurants, shopping, Friday night fireworks and transport. Front desk staff friendly & helpful.

I have stayed here at least 2 other times. It has close access to the beach and is close to popular sites in Hawaii. This visit I was staying 2 weeks, first in a studio and then a one bedroom. During my first week I was getting bites, I ended up with over 25 bites on my waistline, stomach and butt. I finally concluded I had bedbugs. With one day left in the suite they moved us out. They never checked on me or apologized or compensated me. ( I had to wash all my belongings to make sure I did not take bedbugs home and buy medicine for the itching) The second week was in a one bedroom. The rooms furnishings were getting old. The wicker coffee table was missing its glass insert. There was extra cost for basic things like a pack and play. I learned my lesson, next time I travel I am taking a special mattress cover.

We own a timeshare on the mainland and traded our timeshare for a 2 bedroom unit here. We booked 7 months in advance. When we arrived they did not have any 2 bedrooms available and gave us 2 1-bedrooms. Fortunately we were 2 couples so it was ok, but the units were not the same, one didn't have a stove or 2nd bathroom, and the air conditioning didn't work in the living room area. The rooms were not very clean, the carpets were in dire need of not only cleaning, but replacing, we would not walk on them with bare feet. The tub floor in the main bathroom was really wobbly and difficult to shower in because if was wobbly and moved while you were standing in it. Felt very unsafe, actually. The view was of other buildings, not of the ocean. We were told only the 2 bedrooms had views because they were on the higher floors (which we were supposed to have). The front desk staff were friendly and helpful to a point, but not able to provide what we had booked, so we were unhappy about that.The location is great, however. You could walk to the beach, and to the shopping and restaurants. They also rent beach chairs for $3.50 a day, or $17.00 per week, which is an excellent price, as they'll charge you $50 a day for 2 chairs and an umbrella at the beach.

Great location, everything nearby, beach, shops, restaurants. There's a gym and a launderette in the hotel. Room clean and if you looking for 3 adults to a room, go for 2 bed rooms. Room good enough for two adults, but too cramp for 3. Beds comfortable and clean linen. Small bathroom

My family and I own a timeshare and we exchanged this year for a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite at this resort. So as many of the other reviews have indicated the location is great. The room was clean but it is need of renovation. My son said he felt he stepped into a Hawaiian antique store. The kitchen was very aged no cooktop just an oven and microwave. It was fine for my family because we ate out but if you want to cook this is not a good choice. We visited the pool it was nice but travelers beware during our stay the hotel posted a sign saying the pool will be closed for renovation from April- June 2016. If you are booking soon and a pool is important this is good to know. The best part was the staff everyone is super nice and attentive. They offer valet parking which was also nice. I did not mind the parking fee because it was convenient and parking on the Island is a premium. I would stay here again but I hope they do renovate soon, new furniture, new carpet and appliances would make this spot much nicer.

I've stayed here many times because of the great location. Moreover, some of the rooms are very good, but you have to be careful when booking or exchanging because there is a huge difference in the types of suites, aside from which floor it is on and whether it has an ocean view. There are three types of one-bedroom suites: 1) The Banyan, 2) The Palm, and 3) The Koa. Try to avoid the Banyan. It is the smallest and I felt quite cramped staying there. The bedroom is so tiny that the bed takes up most of the room. If you need to use a second bed, there is a Murphy bed in the living room, but again, the room is so small that it consumes most of the space. The kitchen in the Banyan is a "mini-kitchen" with a small fridge, microwave, sink, and a few cabinets. There is one bathroom in the Banyan.The next step up is the Palm. It is still rather small, but it has a second bathroom and doesn't feel as confining. The kitchen is also larger. The best suite by far is the Koa. It feels spacious and is a very comfortable size if you are spending a week. When you walk into the Koa you feel like you are walking into a real apartment rather than an overstuffed hotel room. The Koa has a full kitchen and two bathrooms. The bedroom is much larger than in the other suites, with room to move around. So when booking or deciding whether to exchange, try to get a Koa suite, especially if you are staying a full week.

The location is fabulous, right in the middle of everything. The staff is extremely helpful and treat guests like family. The ABC Store and Denny's are both part of the complex. The view of Waikiki from the 26th floor is breath taking. The rates are good.

It was our first time to stay at The Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki last Nov.12, 2015 for one week. We were given a One Bedroom at the Palm Suite with two bath and balcony overlooking Lewers Street which is the front of the hotel overlooking the new shopping center across the street. Our room was very comfortable for three people which consists of myself, husband and adult son. Our room has a mini kitchen with microwave, coffeemaker, cookware and utensils.The hotel was closed to everything and just across the road from the beach. Restaurants are steps from the resort and there's a 24 hours restaurant next to the lobby and a mini market on the outside of the lobby where you can buy just about everything even hot cooked meals which you can bring to your room or eat it at the lounge on the 26th floor with a complete kitchen and panoramic view of the ocean if you don't feel like going out for dinner in a restaurant. Also, within the same block of the hotel is the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center where you can go and eat at their Food Court with different types of cuisines and very inexpensive compared to restaurants in the area.The resort is a safe place to stay. As a matter of fact, my son was out on weekends and went by himself to some clubs and bars for dancing till after 2 AM and he said it was alright walking that late since there are still a lot of tourists walking in that area. We were happy to find this resort and plan to come back again and stay here on our next vacation. For us, it's like our home away from home.

I have stayed at the Imperial Hawaii three times now and appreciate the friendly and helpful staff, fabulous location very near the beach and great shopping. I also like having a Hertz location on site. The building - while older - is very well kept and clean. Issues and special needs were dealt with quickly.

Small rooms and kitchen, but very close to the Ft. DeRussey beach on the west side of Waikiki. Very friendly staff. Lewers Street has everything one would need. A number of very good restaurants, from high end to modest. All budgets accommodated.

Hotel was in a great location in the heart of Waikiki . Shops and restaurants all over the place . The beach was a 5 min walk , the staff was very nice and helpful . The pool on the27 th floor was nice and clean. They also had valet parking . In overall the hotel was very good and in a great location .

The property is located on the finest part of town, it is homey as it may be a little dated for some people, I think I am home, loved every accommodation I have had there. The resort is under renovation, but you do not hear it or see it. couple of hundred feet from Trump Towers, and about another hundred feet to Waikiki Beach, so awesome. Friendly, helpful staff. Lewers St., has been totally redone, with great restaurants just across the street. I think I would rate them a 9+

I was put in room 306 which overlooks an alley! I have stayed here many times but this is the last time. the room was expensive for a room with the view of an alley and roof.for the money I spent I could have stayed at other properties with a balcony with a view.

I love this resort! Close to all the happening spots in Waikiki and within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping malls, stores! I visit here every year and it's clean, staff has knowledge of all the great spots and deals.

I have had a time share at the Imperial for 30 years. It's my home away from home. Since the beach walk on Lewers has been completed it's a perfect location. Over the years there have been many improvements. The TV's have recently been upgraded and Wifi is in the rooms. It's nice to have a small kitchen. I really like the bell / valet guys. they are so nice and helpful. Everything is clean.

We were there from Jan 30/2016 to Feb 06/2016. There were six of us staying in a one bedroom unit on the 20th floor. We had to move some furniture around to make space for the sofa bed and Murphy bed, no sweat! The room had a small balcony with partial Waikiki beach view, a good place to sit and have your coffee in the morning. The unit was a little dated, furniture dated, but really did not matter to us, we were out most of the time, the beds were comfortable. The location of this resort is great, walking distance to stores, restaurants, right smack in downtown Waikiki, can't complain about that!!Most of the staff were friendly and helpful, always welcoming us with a big smile.

We have been coming to the Imperial for the last fifteen years. The staff is excellent and go out of their way to accommodate our every wish. The property is older and outdated which they are slowly renovating. The best thing they could do is update the uncomfortable furniture however it suits our basic needs as a timeshare. The owners lounge is nice with great views and the rooftop pool is not crowded. It is conveniently located just a block from the beach as well as great dining and shopping.

We had a great visit and loved walking every day to see the sea turtles and swim at the beach. The kitchenette was perfect for making breakfast and snacks. We also loved the ABC Store on the bottom floor! Great place to get snacks and necessities!

This resort was magnificent. The location was perfect. It was close to the beach, restaurants, and nightlife. There's lots of shopping and access to various tour locations. Imperial staff were great, friendly, funny, and professional especially the valets. The accommodations were superb. I used the hot tub and they used the pool. practically everyday! At night looking out from my balcony or going to 25th floor to see the city lite-up was gorgeous. We loved our accommodations so much, we have booked for two weeks in November 2016. Highly recommended. This is the place to stay but leave room for us! Enjoy...

The room needed a complete overhaul - there was a cutout in the kitchen ceiling and the bedroom ceiling which had been nailed up but not finished taping of the drywall. So this was a first impression. Then we overlooked the air conditioning units which was by far very unappealing. The master bedroom had two queen beds and the second bedroom had a full bed. The two bathrooms were small, very outdated but has the necessities and we weren't in our room that much anyway. There was a midweek cleaning and replenished everything.The kitchen was small and the oven didn't work and when we called maintenance, he couldn't get it to work either and said they were so old there was no book any more on how to use them. So we used the microwave.The 26th floor had an amazing view though and a great way to watch the fireworks on New Year's Eve and we were only one block from the beach. The best thing they had a Denny's so we were able to get a $2-$6 breakfast and there was also an ABC store where we could get a sandwich that was fresh and fed two people. We also had two complete hot meals from the deli for under $10 and a 44-oz drink for 99 cents. Great bargain for Hawaii.So we would stay here again since it was in a great location, had free wi-fi, $100 week valet parking with in and out privileges.

Very clean but dated and needs reno. Fine for us as we were only in the room to sleep. Great location to beach, shopping and restaurants (but be sure to make reservations, very busy). Quiet ( we were on 21st floor) nice staff, very clean.

They staff is very professional and helpful. They amenities are superior And it is in a great location. ABC store downstairs and the kitchen is well equipped. Pool and sauna very fun for all. They also have a exercise room

Stayed at the Imperial for 11 days - location is great - I picked it because it was close enough to walk to the Honolulu Marathon start and it is also close to waikiki beach and the main shopping strip - ABC store on ground level is good for food shopping - room was large enough with a kitchenette and very clean - we had a high floor (22) so road noise wasn't an issue - there is a gym and hot-tub if required - pool on the top floor is smallish but adequate - staff were very friendly and checkin and checkout was very smooth - we would definately stay here again

The location of this resort was great. Just one block off the beach and very near shopping and restaurants. The staff was great and very helpful. The reason I would rate this location as average is because the rooms are very small with very outdated and uncomfortable furniture. In the bedroom we had to lift our suitcase onto the bed to get into the room. One other thing is that you are required to valet park for $25 per day or $100 for the week which I guess is normal for that area but still not a cost that I've had at other timeshares in Hawaii.

Just returned from a 2 week visit. While there instayed a week in a studio unit called an Ohia and anotervweek in a 1 Bedroom, 2 Bath Delux unit call a Koa Suite.The Resort itself is an older building in a premire location with a super staff. You will find the unit clean and comfortable, albeit the furnishings are a but old. But hey, you don't go to Hawaii to sit in your room.The Resort is just begining to undergo a complete remodel. The 16th has just been completed and looks amazing. It is being evaluted now, but inwould have to compare it to a Marriott or Hilton. You wont get one of the remodeled rooms for a whole as they are being reserved for the owners (the Imperial is also a Timeshare....check RCI or II)The location is premiere at the foot of Lewers street and bargined priced.....also check out their beach chair rentals.....17.50 a week vs. 7.50 to 15 a day at the beach itself.This is one of the Bargains of Waikiki nit to be missed.

This was a time share we were given. The property is dated but renovation is in progress. The staff was delightful and the property is located in a prime location. Would stay again. Tips: a higher room is quieter, hertz car rental in building, eating out at the Cheesecake Factory in walking distance is very affordable/mainland prices, kitchen had most things you need for a short stay and minimal cooking.

Nice lobby and street appeal. After long wait for elevator, not impressed with unmaintained, dated rooms. Several places where ceiling removed for repairs and drywall just screwed back in place. Needed earplugs to sleep due to a/c units below and car park view/noises. Wall bed sloped down hill. Nice location though. Staff very nice. Website showed view of ocean, maybe in 60's when it was built.

As most have said, great location however the 2 bedroom suite we were given is in great need of remodeling, new paint, carpets, window coverings, artwork on the walls and even a soap dish in the shower would be nice. We will never return as this converted hotel is not a resort by extent of the imagination. Don't waste your precious points.

Shout out to the wonderful staff! Morning lady at the front desk, forgive me I cannot remember your name but you helped us out by checking our luggage early because our room was not read and MELVIN thank you for helping us with our luggage.

We stayed here one night. Location is great and staff was very helpful - example how people who are paying for your salary should be treated: welcomed with the smile. "very tired" is the wording Martyn R used in his review and it sums up pretty much everything about the property. $190/night in October looked like decent rate for one bedroom apartment. With $25 for parking, $5 for internet, $6 resort fee, $7 for crib it piles us very quickly. All of that is fine, but charging for a crib and not providing coffee or tea seems cheap.

We stayed in a 12th floor, 1 bedroom apartment that was above an alley. Delivery's began early (4:30 A.M.) and sounds could be heard but was not constant. The room did have a small view of the ocean which is across the street. We went out the back of the lobby through the parking garage and were at the beach in less then 4 minutes. This place is perfectly located. Not only is it near the beach but it is across the street from a bustling shopping area and there are many restaurants to choose from. We had a rental car and when we frist arrived we had a hard time figuring out where to park. The hotel loading zone is under the roof that is in front of the ABC store next door. You actually pull up under the roof which places you in front of the ABC store entrance which feels weird. You have to watch for pedestrians closely. The valet parking attendants were always pleasant and helpful.The air conditioner did not cool the room much during the day but was comfortable in the evening and overnight. We were not in the room much during the day so it did not bother us that much.

This hotel does have a great location, and like others have stated it is due for a re-vamp but it is clean and functional. This only problem we had was keeping it cool enough the air couldn't keep up. We were on the 11th floor they had us on the 2nd but the noise level we asked for higher floor, which was better. You defiantly hear traffic if have the patio door open. I am sure the further up the better. The staff was always friendly and helpful.

This was the 3rd time my wife and I have stayed at this resort over the last 8 years. One of the main reasons for choosing this place is it's location, being very convenient for shops, restaurants etc. Up to this time we have always had a 1 bedroom apartment, on this trip we went for a studio room. Upon arrival we were given room 509 which to our disappointment was a long way off standard. Although clean it was tired with very old furniture, carpets and drapes.The room was also situated right above a food selling convenience store and a Dennys Diner which made it impossible to open the door to the balcony [ the view was abysmal anyway]. Thankfully, thanks to the young lady in the reservations dept she found us a room on the 22 floor for the second week. We were advised the whole building will come under extensive renovation which in our opinion cannot come quick enough.

Let me say the Imperial is not for everyone, and the is as it should be. This is a privately managed property, so it does not offer corporate glitz. What it does offer is a perfect location, personal service and all the amenities one really needs. I love it!Located at the corner of Lewers and Kalio in Waikiki, the Imperial is a block from the beach, across the street from the plaza where free shows are offered every weekend, and within steps of most major Waikiki attractions. There is a pool, hot tub, exercise room and sauna. Depending on your room, you may or may not have a great view (I had a studio on the 24th floor and had a view of the ocean - not unobstructed but beautiful nonetheless. A Denny's is located on the property and bars and restaurants (including Roy's*****), are located within steps of the front door. I could not ask for more.

Not a lot of extras here. The pool is tiny and no cafe/bar near it. You have no option but to use valet parking which is $100/week. View is of the Embassy Suites across the street. But you have a balcony and chairs. Rooms are small but many are here. Relatively uncomfortable sofa. BUT you don't spend a lot if time in your room here and the room is clean. The staff is friendly and they are currently renovating floor 16. So I would stay again.

The property, in its current condition, can only be attractive for its location for so long. Located in the heart of downtown Honolulu and steps away from the beach, fine and casual dining and upscale shopping and services. My husband and I met a couple that honeymooned here 34 years ago that stated the room was exactly the same today as it was when they were here, including the white wicker furniture.. Marginal service, poor and dated accommodations.

This was available in our budget and looked well placed in Waikiki. We were impressed with the location as there were lots of restaurants nearby and the beach is one block away. If you expect a resort you will be disappointed. The pool is just a pool. The spa is just a spa. The reception is just reception. The rooms are basic and look a little rundown. That being said, the bed was very comfortable and plenty of pillows were provided. We had a full kitchen and lounge area.The only real issue was the air conditioning in the living area although blowing cool air, did not blow enough to cool the room. Despite being on 24 hours a day in the coldest setting the room was often stuffy and warm. Would I stay there again? If I was on a strict budget yes. But if you can afford the real resorts and you want the brochure holiday in Waikiki like pools overlooking the ocean or hotel bars, book somewhere else.

This is a little late in posting, but planning a trip back for next year, and we will be happy to stay there again! The 2 bedroom unit was more than adequate for us and our married son and his wife. There were 2 baths, so we all had the right amount of privacy. It was so nice to have a completely separate living room and kitchenette so we could hang out and not be on top of each other. The staff were very friendly and knew us by the second day. Much nicer and friendlier than the large hotels we walked thru where the lobby seemed more like an airport terminal. Yes, it was a little old, and not luxurious, but it was so close to the beach, who cares? We were on a high floor (21 maybe) and we had a wonderful ocean view since the hotel on the beach is not that tall, and we were right across the street. Could not beat the location for that price, we had a lovely time!

The only positive about this resort is that it is close to the beach (even though most rooms would struggle to have a view of the ocean). By studio apartment they mean studio (you have to pull out a double bed from the wall to sleep). You pay a 'resort fee' for basically a couple of beach towels to use as there is no free wifi and you have to stay 4 nights before your room even gets serviced! DO NOT use elite concierge tour bookings in the lobby as the lady, Jasmine, is very rude and unprofessional and couldn't organise a pool party at a pool so to speak as we had a most unpleasant dealing with her in booking a tour. The room was very expensive and you can't even check in til 4pm! The service at the front desk was very slow as there only seemed to be one person working who talked for a good couple of minute about the smoking policies of the room after we clearly said we were non-smokers. My suggestion would be to find another hotel as having the benefit of being close to the beach didn't account for all the other negatives.

So there is no bar here. There is a diner "Denny's" attached which has some darn good service in it. The place is old and DATED. The employees are not very attentive nor do they care to speak with you. I ventured into several other neighboring properties where you are treated like royalty. The furniture is PATIO furniture for your rooms. There is a LARGE smell of mold with in the hotel!

We've been going here for 27 years! Since 1988 this place place is full of memories. Close to the beach for morning and evening walks, close to restaurants, Fort Derussy, Kalakaua Blvd, ect. ect. Rooms & air conditioning are being upgraded, elevators were upgraded recently. The Staff friendly & helpful too! Valet parking is $25 USD a day (lower than Wyndham). We were there for a hurricane warning and did not have to be evacuated since we were above the 2nd floor.

Our stay was 3 weeks in a studio. It had all we needed. The kitchen and bathroom amenities were sufficient; the queen bed very comfortable (& there was also a sofa bed). Housekeeping did a fantastic job & our rubbish was collected regularly. The fitness centre was also well equipped & the pool area very well maintained. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Waikiki Beach, bus stops, restaurants and there is an ABC store right next door. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here twice... Once for a week and then for a night in September and even though the rooms are outdated our stay was fantastic. We stayed in the palm suite. There was a sofa bed and Murphy bed in the living area, TV, DVD player, a small full kitchen with bar size fridge, 2 bathrooms (one of the living area and one In the bedroom) the bedroom had a full size double (twin size) bed, TV and DVD player. The staff are amazing and Richard from checkin was extremely helpful and lovely to deal with. We will be staying here again. The only thing I can really suggest is to book early and request a high floor room (we stayed on a high floor on our first stay and on a lower floor on our second stay)as there is street noise on the lower floors (it's not that bad but it's there) I'm sure we will stay here again. Conveniently located one street away from Waikiki beach. Situated above Denny's. Perfect for families.

This hotel truly is in a great location. Use the concierge in the lobby for your car rental as opposed to going directly to the Hertz office in the building. The Hertz office told me that the concierge in the lobby gets their cars through them anyway but the Hertz office tried to charge me $110 more for the same car on the same day as the concierge! Otherwise, most of the reviews I have read are pretty close. A little run-down but nice staff and ok rooms.

Late review, we stayed in June 2015. If you have a large group like we did, 5 families and almost twenty persons, this is the ideal place to stay, in terms of both price and location. Everything is literally steps from the hotel front door. Rooms are spacious with plenty of elbow room, place is showing its age and could use some TLC, but its not a resort, really a good place to drop-off your things and sleep in-between activities. I will say, the staff is what will make your stay that much more enjoyable, all very professional and helpful.

Stayed here for a week with 2 other friends in a room with 1 master bedroom. The living room had a Murphy bed and a couch bed, so it worked out for the 3 of us sleeping wise. The room had a small kitchen which came in handy. The timeshare is older and a little run down, but it's in a great location with a lot of restaurants, cafes, beaches and shops all within walking distance.

We just spent a week at this location and I have to say that I was very please with my experience. When you are staying at a timeshare facility you sometimes are worried that your walking in to a place that is out dated and dirty but you could tell right from the beginning that they were working on updating their units.The unit that we had was very clean and had a great view along with a balcony that had 2 chairs. The rooms were a bit warm because the afternoon sun is pretty strong but they cooled down pretty quickly.I would have to say that in my experience with timeshare properties this is one of the better ones around and you will be very pleased with your stay here.

This is an older hotel but the position is great close to the beach and shops. The rooms are a good size with a separate bedroom. We thought it was well priced for its position and the staff are brilliant.

Just rapped up our vacation. I would say this "resort" is far from that. They have started renovation and didn't let anyone know. Very noisy, rooms are very small and very outdated. Employees are very friendly and location is fantastic.

We were two couples and own a two bedroom timeshare. We received a small master with no ensuite and a double Murphy bed in the kitchen/living room. The kitchen had a bar fridge and microwave and no A/C in that area. It was broken and the condos we're old and needed updating.Not near what we usually stay in.

I would give this place zero stars if I could. This place is severely run-down and the service here is horrendous. While trying to pitch us a time share, an employee asked several offensive questions about my father passing away which was unprompted. I waited for over an hour to speak with the concierge, who had no concern of time. The staff is very rude and inconsiderate and they are never at their desks. When you do find someone at the desk, they have 10 people in line ahead of you. If you do decide to stay here anyway, may God have mercy on your soul.

This hotel was very close to Waikiki Beach (about 1 block) which was great. The issue I had as well as the other people staying in the hotel was that the air conditioning was awful. It was always hot and it seemed to be throughout the entire hotel. The bed was comfortable but small for two people. These were the only bad things about this hotel. It's not as modern as other hotels ( a little outdated) but it was comfortable and clean and had a balcony. The pool is small and is located on the roof. Tip: Next door to the hotel is the ABC Store where you can buy food, souvenirs, etc at reasonable prices. We had a steak dinner for $9.99 (it was really good). This beats the expensive prices of the restaurants at Waikiki.

Our flight home was delayed and we had already checked out of our hotel. We booked a room via wotif for ourselves and our two children aged six and eight so we weren't at the airport all night for a 4 am departure. The rooms were clean tidy and perfect for what we needed. The rooftop pool was a huge hit with our children. The staff were fabulous and considerate of our situation and helped make the best of it.

Very nice Palm Suite with two bathrooms and a kitchen. Great location, near many restaurants and attractions. The place is clean, comfortable and with helpful staff. Have chosen to stay here two times during my visits to Honolulu.

We came here not knowing what to expect from this place, and wow it didn't disappoint. Very clean, comfortable & helpful staff. Bryan should be staff person of the year with the help he was able to give us. I highly recommend this for anyone, it's very central to shops and close the beach, our room had ocean views.

We used our timeshare for accommodation here & bought my wife's sister & husband with us, upon checkin the receptionist realising there was four of us upgraded us to a bigger room & gave us a discount on our valet parking all of which was very much appreciated, we knew at the time of booking that the room as going to be "Cosy" but she made it a lot better for us. It's an older establishment but clean & well maintained... Nice pool on the 27 floor for referencing evening dip & having a very well stocked ABC store on the ground floor with an extensive "Take Out" menu was just another plus along with a Denny's restaurant...... Everything else was in very close proximity to "The Imperial Hawaii" made for a great first week of our vacation coupled with "Michael" @ guest services who dispensed some great advice & suggestions for us to save few $$ & things to see & do...

We had a friend that has a time share here so that is why we chose the place. It was a nice size apt. 1 bedroom, living room, kitchenette and 2 bathrooms. It could stand some updates as far as the carpet and furniture. Owners lounge is awesome. Pool was ok not huge. 2 hot tubs both great. Staff very nice and helpful, Washers & dryers on site for a fee. Valet parking only. Car rental available on site (return is at a different location) 1 1/2 blocks from the beach, easy access. Lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.

we stayed for a week at this hotel on honeymoon from New Zealand. The staff were very helpful which we found was simply Hawaiian/American folk in general. Our room was 1 bdrm, 2 bathroom. The ensuite shower didn't work but that didn't matter as we just used the 2nd bathroom. It was a shower over bath in 2nd bathroom which would be great if you have kids. Laundry facilities were good and convenient, as was the daily attendance to clearing of rubbish from our unit. The pool was really small but the deck chairs / loungers and space was good. Not too busy when we used it.Our view was absolutely breathtaking. We had a corner unit on the 23rd floor which looked straight out to the ocean. That was the very best part of our stay.Free wifi in our room was great too.

Just returned from a two week stay which I booked thru a trade with RCI. The "resort" is in need a total rehab, but the location can't be beat. The only thing that can make the location better would be to move it on the ocean! The points needed to trade here thru RCI are a bit high & it's because of the location That being said, you are in Waikiki & who really stays in their room?The Imperial is located next to the "Rodeo Drive" of Waikiki. Many nice shops & restaurants nearby. The location is very safe to walk around at night. We had a 1BR unit, the Palm, with 2 baths that slept 6 people. The unit actually had 3 beds. The 4 of us had plenty of room to sleep. The living room area & kitchen are small, but like I said, you're in Waikiki who really is there for their room. Our room faced the back, not much of a view but we were on the 14th floor & if you look over the balcony you do get a slight view of the ocean.The staff was friendly & accommodating. We had 2 separate units, our 2nd week was only 1 BR, 1 BA & we paid $100 upgrade to stay in the same unit for our duration, giving us more space.We ate at Taormina Restaurant & it was excellent. There is a nearby coffee shop for coffee & also we ate breakfast 3 times at Giovanni Pastrami. If you're looking for a night to save money for dinner, try the Food Court in the nearby shopping center, past PF Changs on the 2nd floor. Sometimes you need to save with kids! If the opportunity came again & I could go to Hawaii, I would stay here again, just because the location is so great. Like I said, you're in Waikiki. There is an ABC store downstairs that is convenient for anything you may need. The rooftop pool is small, but nice after the beach. We only used it twice.

I was in Honolulu on business and this hotel was booked for me by my travel coordinator. As it was in the same price range and distance to where my actual work had to be performed.It is within a 7-8 minute walk to the beach. Though it took me a day or so to get my bearings and realize the beach isn’t actually Waikiki but more like the Fort DeRussy Beach Park. Though a 20 minute stroll up the beach would get you to Waikiki Beach proper, with that said I found the Ft Dempsey Beach area plenty adequate for Hawaiian beach activities like - swimming, sunning and boogie boarding.The staff was friendly and effective. One can ONLY valet park. They ought to have a sign that states this as I drove up and could not figure out how to park and I personally don’t care for the idea of tipping someone to “park my car for me”. (Just a personal preference.) Though I can understand it here, as at one point I found myself in the parking garage and the cars were parked VERY close to each other.Also, there were plenty of unexpected charges for this room: $25.00/day parking (ok big city parking I get that..), $6.00/ day resort fee (?), internet was $15.00 / day (I think), and maybe another fee I can’t think of at the moment, and of course taxes on all those fees. So there was quite some difference between the final bill and the online reservation. Still, I think this hotel came in well under the price point of the nearby locations.That all said, the valet staff was friendly and efficient and the hotel lobby/grounds were clean and well maintained. My actual room was large, had an equipped and functional kitchenette, sleeper sofa, a murphy bed, two flat screens (one in the living room and one in the bedroom), the bathroom had a shower only, and there was a small balcony with a stunning view of a parking garage (though this did not confront me – who travels to Hawaii to sit in their room?) and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel only cleans the room like 2X/week, so keep yourself tidy cause no one will clean up after you.I also discovered that if one ventures toward the strip there’s a mall in that concrete mess and a full-blown food court that offers a wide selection of fare and price points. The shops also range from high end stuff to gimmicky tourist trinkets.I read some of the reviews and the biggest complaint I saw was how reviewers thought the over place was dated. To be honest, I felt a little of that but also realized the immense value: its clean and functional, the location was superb and the price point has to be well-below the neighbors. So if/when the renovations are completed to satisfy the “dated” reviews I expect the price point to no longer be an effective edge.Other notables: there was plenty of walking destinations – the strip for example that have multiple shops and bars/restaurants, an onsite ABC store which carries just about everything one would want to get or need (there is another ABC store a short walk up the strip and was considerably less crowded), the rooftop pool offered some commanding views and the kids in that pool weren’t concerned about the wind at all (compared to other reviewers), an onsite Denny’s (though I did not eat there).Upshot: I liked this hotel and would stay again

the hotel has everything.pros...steps from the beach....a dennys in the lobby.....an abc store in the building...every room has a kitchen...shopping across the street...swimming pool on the roofcons...bldg. is old but well kept

We stayed here on the 4th of July to catch the fireworks down the beach, Check in is 4pm, Check out at 11am, We were not given the room we requested, The room was ok, Bathtub was 3 feet by 3 feet squared, Every glass my wife pulled down had lipstick on the rim, The pool is a lot smaller than it looks on the web, It looks to be about 9 feet by 25 or so, They put an extra 100 dollar hold per night on our card in case of damage I imagine, Other than the location it doesn't have a lot going for it, Of course the Denny's restaurant downstairs is a nice touch. But we wont be back.

The Imperial is in a great location - very close to the beach, shopping and food options. All employees we encountered were incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and well maintained. The lounge area on the 26th floor was a fantastic space with a pool table, bar/kitchen area (bring your own) and a great balcony which was the perfect spot for watching the Hilton's Friday night fireworks. I would rate it a five with a little work - it's our understanding that renovations are planned over the next four years so I have no doubt that it'll be a five on our next visit! :)

I stayed many places in Hawaii over the years. This one is in a great location. I understand the price is very good for the area. We exchanged our timeshare, so didn't pay like most. It has a nice balcony with a view of the ocean. It was very clean and comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised. Many timeshares in Hawaii are not so nice. This one does need new carpet, not bad, but not great either.

Stayed here for a few nights. Room was large with a balcony . Very spacious and had kitchenette . Overall a good pick! Had pool on the roof and beautiful view. Would definitely stay here again. Clean,Quiet,near the beach and the strip and many restaurants within walking distance . Liked that did not need a car at all . Very nice staff and people in the area . Great find for a great price.

After a 6.5 hour delayed flight from bris to hnl we missed our flight to La and had to stay o/n in hnl.. we caught a local bus for $2.50 to the waikiki beach and hotel area and just went into hotels and asked for availability. We were offered a studio room. The bed folds out of wall. Theres a sofa bed, dining table n chairs. A small kitchenette with microwave, mini fridge, tea n coffee facilities. Its not fancy but its not disgusting either. Actually its just enough for what you would need if you were spending all day out swimming etc and just need a bed, shower n air con.. great location. We walked to ala moana but theres enough of similar shops nearby. Also night markets for cheap priced souvenirs. A street behind the beachfront hotels. If you want a decent room for a reasonable price. This one is fine. Staff were pleasant. Short walk to beach and shops.
user_name:
Alysa E
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: After our original accomodation fell through we found a room that accommodates 6 people, although it was 1 bedroom 1 bathroom with a pull down bed and a sofa bed in the lounge room, the room was ok. We where greater by smiling Todd, nothing was to much trouble for him. We arrived early in the morning and couldn't get into outperform room o he organised our luggage and off to the beach we went. I'm not sure I'd call it at resort and it's definitely not 5* however the location is fantastic, there's an ABC store underneath and it's close to all restaurants, shops and beach. The room was ok and tidy. There a rooftop pool that is great to see Friday nights fireworks from. The pool water is hot, be carful of wearing hTs as it does get very windy up there. There is a coin laundry in the hotel and there are 2 outdoor spa's that are nice and relaxing. Our room didn't have a kitchenette and this would of been very useful as we where there for 11 nights This place is very good value and the service was fantastic.

We where here one night after a beautiful 9 days and the greeting we got was not a greeting at reception you would like to end your holiday on! Yes we may have been early but we stood in line as there was one on reception, and she was with a couple, I stood there waiting my turn looking around at the foyer and thinking how dated this was, ok it may have been the best in its time around the DUKEs era but it needs to come up to date, any way she finally finished and bellowed me over, no warm holiday greeting at all...The rooms are very dated the bed pulls out from cupboard lamps don't work and the show is so OLD and hard for kids to use.. We pulled out the fold out bed and it wasn't made we had to make it our self the under mattress had stains on it... The bell hops where lovely they had holiday personality..

When I walked into the Imperial Hawaii Resort of Waikiki, I immediately thought this place was probably a hotspot in 1984. Which is around the last time it was updated. I personally kind of enjoyed the vacation time-travel, but I'm weird that way. The rooms were clean, no problem there. The pool and hot tub also seemed clean. There were just spots where it was obvious that no updating had occurred and a bit shabby looking, like the thermostat from the 1960s and the wall patching job in the bathroom that was not painted over. However, this is a pretty good deal considering you are a block away from the beach in a very expensive area. There were some renovations going on that I think if I remember correctly will be ongoing through September. Also, there was a pretty loud street fight that occurred Friday evening that woke me right up. Not the fault of the hotel at all, but if you are facing the street, you might get that on a weekend. It is a party/tourist central location and there are lots of homeless people who camp out at the beach near the Army museum under a covered picnic area, which is a couple of blocks from the hotel, so be aware of that. Most are just sadly down on their luck, but a few appear to be a little drunk and disorderly, so exercise some caution in that area if you are heading to the beach. (Honolulu overall has a terrible problem with homelessness, which you can see now and then as you drive around.) Overall, the hotel was not bad, lots of shopping and restaurants to choose from. It was nice to have the option of keeping some cereal, coffee and milk on hand in the kitchenette for a quick breakfast. There is an ABC Store ( I LOVE that place) next to the lobby that opens from 6AM until midnight that has everything, pretty much, except (oddly) for nail brushes to clean under your nails. The hotel could make their valet parking area a little more obvious. It wasn't really clear and you have to enter at a diagonal, kind of, on Don Ho Street, and tourists aren't aware that cars go in and out there, so be careful. You MUST use the valet parking and there is a charge for it. There's a Denny's in the hotel, but we didn't eat there.

We travelled during a busy season. There were to a of people from everywhere. And some were celebrating graduation. We booked 2 rooms at the imperial. It is very spacious and more than enough room for the 3 of us. The only problems was there were no pots in the unit. We had to rent out everything. Pay for valet parking since there is no where to park. The street it sits on is a one way street, so if you passed by it you'd have to go all the way around again through all of that traffic. Don't loose any towels or anything, otherwise they would charge you for it. And if you needed extra towels or blankets or pillows you'd have to rent them about. And return them so you won't get charged. The ABC store downstairs is a plus. Just in case you want to get food to eat already made. They also have a Denny's below too. We never got to experience the housekeeping service since we only stayed 3 nights. But we did notice that someone took our trash the first day we stayed. It creeped us out a bit, but don't think anything was lost. Also the front desk people looked at our group as if we were suspicious walking around there. Like we weren't well enough to stay there.

We were with a wedding party in two 1 bedroom Palm suites and one 2 bedroom Hala suite for 2 weeks.Check-in was quick and efficient in a busy, but nicely appointed lobby. Location:Great location in the centre of Waikiki - a few minutes 100-yards walk to the beach.The hotel is literally surrounded by other high-rise hotels (there are over 120 resorts/hotels within about 1/2 a mile of the beach, therefore most feel more like being in a city than in a resort).There was (and will continue to be for several months) some street construction right in front and on the sides of the hotel. The noise was supposed to start around 8AM according to the notices provided, but they were at it from 6:30AM.Facilities:Although a daily $6 resort fee was charged, don't kid yourself, this is not a resort. It is simply a well located, dated high-rise that promotes itself as a resort with no additional facilities that a decent hotel offers.The roof-top pool is practically unusable due to consistent high winds, lack of shade spots, and poor views due to ugly high cement walls. A coin operated guest laundry room is available on the 2nd floor.As seen everywhere in Waikiki, your can enter an ABC convenience store within a dozen steps from the lobby. We also had a few good breakfasts a the renovated Denny's restaurant on the first floor.The bus depot is a short walk to the Sheraton parking next door. This was convenient since most of our day trip excursions use that parking as their departure/arrival location.Room:Considering the overall ratings on Trip Advisor, we were all kind of shocked at how dated the rooms were (we had a total of 3 suites booked - all suffering from extremely dated flooring, furniture, decor, layout, poor appliances, (you get the idea)...The suites had in-room safes, but were awkward to use, being placed in the bottom of a closet.The kitchen has nothing more that a (very) small bar fridge, an old microwave/convection oven combination from a few generations ago and a couple of stove top elements. The cupboards were sufficiently stocked with pots/pans, dishes and cutlery.Both bath rooms were minuscule and in desperate need of an update - showing their obvious age. Service:Room cleanup is twice a week, but in our experience, a very quick clean up only (sand on a bathroom tile when we arrived was still there when we left as were fingerprints in the patio door and windows. Trash pickup was done every other day. Front desk and concierge services were excellent.OVERALL:The price and location are good, but I would not return here and would not recommend it until such time as a major reno is completed.

We stayed 3 nights to get a flavor of Waikiki before going on to the other islands. Had a problem with the toilet backing up into the shower but they took care of it immediately. It was one building away from the beach and the Friday night fireworks, close to great shopping and a block from the bus. (If you are a senior and show your SS card you can ride the bus for $1 )

We stayed here as a family of 5. We were lucky enough to be given a really high floor without even asking. Fantastic ocean view and of the street below. We ate in the Denny's attached to the hotel a few times which was convenient. The ABC store downstairs was also very handy for water, breakfast and snacks. The staff were friendly and the kids loved the valet guys. Shopping was in walking distance as was the beach. We also used the rooftop pool. We really enjoyed our stay here and would probably stay again the next time we travel to Hawaii.

We had an Ohia suite booked but once the reservation manager saw how big my family was he wasn't standing for that....so he upgraded us to a Palm suite!!!! The best views I'll ever receive until I'm making the big bucks, but you'll be sure by than I'll own a timeshare in this amazing resort! Best staff! Fantastic owners lounge!!! So many pluses there are no minuses! You have to try this resort out!

We just stayed here for a week and found The Imperial very central. Close to the beach, restaurants and shops. The staff were great and friendly. Loved that we had two bathrooms. I would stay here again.

First off great location, steps from Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. Second, very well maintained and clean. Third, welcoming, happy and helpful staff. Everything one could ask for while on vacation in paradise. Thank you Imperial!!!

My husband and I stayed here for 1 week during one of the coldest winters in Indiana. The staff was great and always helpful with all of our excursions.The hotel was nice, and it was dated, but we managed to get a room that had been updated in the last 10 years. The bed was only a full size, so I slept in a murphy bed in the living room area. A very strange configuration was where the bathroom was in conjunction to the bedroom. It was situated off of the living room away from the bedroom. And, the bathroom was smaller than one we had on a cruise. We had a balcony with a great view overlooking all the action on the street below us and that was a definite plus. (We were granted access to use the lounge at the top of the hotel that had a wonderful view of the ocean.) The 1st night we were able to leave our door open for the ocean breeze, but our second day street construction started and lasted the remaining part of our stay. Ah well, we planned on being out of the room more than being in the room. If you want to stay somewhere reasonably priced with excellent access to EVERYTHING, this is a place to consider. It is a block from the beach, and an ABC store right next to it.We were told that a major renovation is to take place soon. I'd return after the renovation is completed.

My husband and I and a girlfriend stayed here for 2 weeks in December, 2013. The rooms are dated and cleaning staff are pretty much nonexistent. We had to bring towels to the housekeeping ourselves to get clean towels, we had to take out our garbage as they didn't take it from our room etc. The rooms are way to small for 3 people let alone 6 like they say the accommodate and the bathroom is even smaller. The pool sucks and has a cement wall around it with no view, not sure how someone else said there is a great view from the pool.
