We were on the 21st floor and still heard garbage trucks every morning at 6 am. The only thing good is the location to the beach. The staff were no better when it came to customer service. If you like a city and traffic and noise this is where you want to be. If I ever went to Oahu again it would be to Northshore, not Waikiki!

My friends suggested that we go here to the patio bar on the 27th floor to watch the sunset. Good idea Fun crowd, good drinks and great sunset The hotel is only a short walk to Waikiki beach and if I was looking for a room I would check it out

After researching timeshare units in Honolulu, we found this resort and booked 5 days with an owner. Arriving from the airport by taxi was pricey as we later found out the speedishuttle was cheaper. Check in was easy and the staff was friendly.We found our unit was ocean side and had a good view of the water and sunset. We were not expecting to have a view of the beach itself because we knew the resort was a bit away from the beach. Our unit was very clean, tastefully decorated and well kept. We didn't use the pool in the resort because, hey, there is a beach just a short walk away. Coming back from the beach, the Imperial has a foot wash station in the back that we used before returning to our room. We rented a car for a day and parking of our rental car was valet only at the resort. That was okay since the vehicles are parked in the lower levels of the building.The Imperial is located central to Waikiki Beach and is a very short walk to the beach or the main shopping strip. This was a big plus to us. Getting to the beach was a bit confusing at first but once we had our bearing, we learned of the many ways between buildings to get there. There is a small store on the main floor that provides a bit of everything to get you started on your vacation. Taking a car to a local grocery or department store will see lower prices but if you don't want the hassle, then the store will do the trick.On the 27th floor, we went to the lounge for happy hour. It is only open a couple of times during the week so make sure you check before going. The view on this floor is very nice and if you get there in time for sunset, you can enjoy a drink while watching the sun go down. The staff there was nice and provided a relaxing atmosphere.Without reading previous reviews, it would not have been known that this resort is one of the older ones. It definitely isn't brand new, but not a hole either. It offers all the amenities that other resorts provide and is reasonably priced. There is no reason for us not to return again. Its location to local stores, a major shopping centre, various restaurants, small shops, a museum and the famous Waikiki beach are its best assets.

Great location near beach and great shopping and dining. Rooms old and in great need of updating. Termites in bathroom door leaving sawdust and drippings on bathroom floor. Inexpensive but get what you pay for. 26th floor owners lounge best view of sunset ever.

My good friend throws parties and events at the penthouse suite (ocean suite on the 27th floor) which I had the pleasure of attending this past Christmas.I HIGHLY recommend coming here if you're in town and watching the beautiful sunset while the fireworks go off on Friday night as the sailboats float in the distant sea.Nothing compares to the view! If you have an upcoming event... Even better! Book this suite and watch the beauty of the night unfold!

A few years ago we purchased a unit at the Imperial, yes it is the oldest timeshare on the island, but it is in a great spot. Staff is all wonderful. It is old and dated, but you go out the door and in less than a block you are on the beach. Best spot in town. Love it!!! We go every January!!!

I stayed here again on a timeshare exchange through interval international. We stayed in a Koa suite which was nice. We had a one bedroom with full kitchen with 2 bathrooms. The bathrooms are small but one had a tub and one had a shower. The kitchen had a microwave/convection oven which I've never seen or used but it actually worked really well even for grilling! The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept great. The best part is the location. It is a 2 minute walk to a nice beach and close to everything. The upstairs bar is beautiful and has great views. It was clean & the staff was great. It isn't a 5 star hotel and it is outdated but was nice and I would stay here again.

Clean and served the purpose. Good location. Poor layout for getting ice, using the hot tub or pool.Rooftop pool all cement block walled in...so the view is non existent. Don't expect any extras...like early check in or late check out...staff seemed put out if you even ask!Would not return to this facility.

My husband and I stayed at this Hotel from Jan 12 to Jan 22 2015. We had prepaid for our stay at the Imperial 6 months earlier. When we arrived we were told the prices had gone up since we booked so we owed additional money. My husband works for the airline industry and I could just imagine if they pulled that stunt. ( buy a ticket, arrive at the airport and then have them tell you the prices have gone up and you owe us another hundred or so). This is a very poor business practice. My husband and I have traveled a lot and have never had something like this happen before . They could have tried to notify us prior to arriving so we could make alternate arrangements. Cathy and Peter Miller

Stayed here with my sister and a girlfriend for our ladies vacation in April. Check in was quick and everyone was friendly. Had a one bedroom suite that also had a Murphy bed and sleeper sofa. A small kitchenette and smaller bathroom. Flat screen TVs in the rooms and each room had a balcony. The rooms where clean and felt comfortable, just a little bit dated. But we were not in HI to stay in our room! Downstairs you have a Denny's restaurant and an ABC store (loved it) and a couple small shops. The pool is on the top floor with an awesome view! Imperials location is very near the beach, just cross the street with then a very short walk and you're on the beach. Cross the street in front of main entrance and you'll find some great shops and fine restaurants and bars. Or walk down the street on the same side of the road and you'll find more of the same. Everything else is close by with the bus systems. Except North Shore and getting a rental car through the resort for a day wasn't hard at all.

We love this place. It is literally just around the corner to the beach and amidst lots of shopping and restaurants. Local transit is handy and there is a pool, gym and laundry facilities at the hotel. Staff are friendly, making it a place for our repeat business. The entrance to Denny's is in the lobby and the local ABC Store is right next door for groceries, etc. Loved it.

Have just returned after having spent 3 weeks staying at this Hotel in a Palm suite 1bedroom 2 bathroom apartment. Well I was recommended this Hotel by a friend that stays here regularly and all I can say is WoW what a great location clean hotel and very friendly and very obliging staff we asked to be on a high level and level 25 was ours great views.This Hotel is well situated for good restaurants and a nice part of beach which we used every day, the ABC store downstairs makes life very easy the Concierge and front office staff were very helpful. I cannot wait to return and have been telling friends to stay at this hidden gem ..Julie

This hotel have lots of facilities but also looks a little outdated and overpriced. The wifi is very slow, you can access only in many places. With kitchen, fridge, microwave oven, 2 bathrooms per room, nice balcony, they have a gym, nice pool and sauna. Good location. The service is avg.

We just spent 10 days at this hotel in December. We stayed in two types of rooms during our stay (one bath and a two bath). Overall this is not a hotel we would stay at again. I'll start with the positives.Location is great. The beach is a short walk away. We wound up walking a bit further to the beach than other people because the stretch of beach this resort is closest to is not great for swimming. Lots of rocks and such, but its only another 5 minutes and you are in front of the Royal Hawaiian Hotel (pink building) that had a wonderful place to enjoy the water. The location is right by all the stores and restaurants. You do not necessarily need to rent a car since it is right where the action is. The more expensive restaurants are right in the area. If you are looking for deals on meals you will have to walk about 15 or so. We did find a reasonable place to have breakfast across the street. The convenient store and Denny's is right next to the hotel.Desk staff and trip planners were very friendly. They helped with many excursions and advice on where to go and what to see and do. They did an excellent job on helping pick out adventures for us to take or good places to eat. Always friendly and always helpful. This was a great location to venture out from. Waikiki area has the best weather on the island and in this hotel you are right in the middle of a fantastic beach. Waters were great for swimming. Location location location. The not so great...The rooms are somewhat outdated in style.The bathrooms were very small. The beds were too soft with some bad springs and the bedding was not comfortable. This hotel is in need of rennovation. In the bathroom, well, I only weigh about 175 and had to sit sideways on the bowl to fit into the room - enuff said.There is quite a bit of noise outside this hotel. We stayed on the 5th floor for the first leg of our trip and were awoken to many sounds of garbage trucks, street noise, construction and the like. On the second leg of our stay we requested a room on a higher floor. We were assigned a room on the 15th floor and did not hear any street noise. Ants - Exterminators come in weekly to this hotel and we had an ant problem as well during our stay. Parking 20 dollars a day - no free parking anywhere in the area.So overall we had an excellent time in Hawaii and weren't expecting a lot from the hotel. We were happy enough to find helpful people and a good location to use as a base for our adventures. The staff was very helpful in planning our stay. Other than the location and staff this hotel does not have much else to offer. I'd like to think you can do better elsewhere if you are looking for more comforts in your hotel.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel in June. It was the perfect location with the best price in the area. I was a bit worried as I normally like to stay in 4-5 star hotels but we were impressed. It was very clean and the perfect location to the shops and the beach. There is so much to do in Hawaii that location is the most important thing you need. The only con was the fold down bed, but it was comfortable and didn't affect our stay. I would recommend to stay here if you are looking for great value.The beach is very beautiful and we walked 2 minutes to the beach every day but if you are looking to stay on the beach or to swim by the pool the whole time then do not stay here. The service staff were fantastic and friendly.

My husband and I stayed here for our FIRST trip to Hawaii! Yea!!!! The resort is located to where we did not need to rent a car. The shuttle bus pick up and drop off location was very convenient. The people at the resort were excellent! There's a Denny's and ABC store attached to the hotel. My husband and I took the liberty of obtaining most of our meals from these locations. The room was clean and comfortable. We had no issues sleeping on the Murphy bed. The location is GREAT! A short walk to the beach which was much less crowded than Waikiki beach. However, that was a nice walk too passing all the shops along the way. The only thing about our room is I wish we would have had a small stove, other than that, a wonderful place to stay. I would definitely go back!

While the hotel and rooms are tired and due for a facelift, the hotel makes up for it with its location and customer service. We arrived well before our check-in time and the manager changed our room to accommodate us. The staff were friendly and happy to give advice. The hotel has plenty of good restaurants and shopping nearby, please note though that this area is classed as an up-market area and is priced accordingly. A popular tour bus stop is located around the corner at the Sheraton and Waikiki beach is a short walk away.

As always we take the 19/20 bus from the airport & exit at Lewers. Then walk 2 blocks to the hotel. It is on the corner of Kalia & Lewers. Very conveniently ABC & Denny's is on the street level of the hotel with the reception. We had a studio with a Murphy bed & pull out queen couch. A partial kitchen with convection oven , fridge & coffee pot is included... NOT your first days coffee to get you started like most hotels in the world !! Who knew ? The beds are soft and lead to low back discomfort with the pull out couch offering (suprisingly ) a better night sleep! LocationLocationLocation you can't beat it... And you cannot beat the service of the staff--top notch!

We just spent a week in Waikiki at the Imperial. The location is superb and the property is clean and comfortable. Any requests we had were taken care of immediately. On the day of our departure check out was at 11 and our plane was at 8. We were given access to the pool and the owner's lounge until we were picked up to go to the airport. I cannot give high enough marks to Michael, the concierge, who helped us arrange three amazing adventures - Pearl Harbor, Sunset Cruise, and a tour of Oahu.

Even though I didn't have a very good experience here the first time I stayed here, I decided to stay here again. Partly because we could transfer our week from a timeshare and also because of its central location in Waikiki. I'm glad to say that the experience was a little better. Here are some notes from our recent stay, good AND bad:1) Valet service is ALWAYS top notch. Those guys are super cool!2) The room we got this time was only a 1-bedroom. Be wary that not all rooms will have a full kitchen. We had a fridge, sink, and microwave this time, but no stove.3) The ABC Store is now done with the remodeling. It is huge! But, since it's very close to the beach and on the way to Kalakaua Ave, it'll get really busy, too. Also to note, the store has a deli where you can get ready-to-eat food. Very convenient if you don't have the stove.4) The front desk staff is average. Certain individuals are decent, but some won't even smile. Being that it's the first, and maybe only, interaction you have with your hotel guests, it's a good idea to at least put up a front and pretend you like your job.5) They now have wi-fi in each room. You still have to pay for internet access, but it's fairly cheap. Only $25 for the week.6) For the most part, the rooms are clean. It's up to you to keep it that way during your stay as this is not like a Vegas hotel where housekeeping comes every day. They only come once or twice a week.7) Just like in the 2-bedroom suite we had before, the bathrooms are extremely small.All in all, a better stay. I would consider staying there again and if things get a little better, might even think about buying a time-share over there!

I have stayed at the Imperial 6 times over the past 10 years. It is a great hotel with a variety of rooms - whatever kind of room you need you can find it here. Since we now have kids we like the Suites so that we get the bedroom.The pool is okay, the rooftop pool seems great to start but can be really windy on some days so you can't really count on being able to spend a lot of time up there. The hot tub is on a different floor so it would be nicer to have the pool and hot tub together. The hot tub is on the 3rd floor and under a roof so it is protected from wind and rain but there is no view and is inconvenient to get to. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. Rooms and hotel are clean. Our favorite thing about the Imperial is the location. Just a block away from the beach you can easily walk to Waikiki for the day however because you are not directly on the beach the price is incredibly reasonable. With kids or as a couple we have always really enjoyed our time at the Imperial. Walking distance to anything you need, shops and restaurants are everywhere. The Yard House across the street has a great happy hour for food and drinks.

This Place has a very Friendly staff. It's like living in a mall with so many stores and restaurants around. The view from the 26th floor is awesome. Make sure you get your coupons right away before spending all your money. Also the TV does not have HDMI. The washing facilities are nice. With a big ABC Store right next to it.

Even though, my wife and I have traveled to Israel, Tanzania, Amsterdam and cruised the Caribbean on a four masted schooner she still really wanted to vacation in Hawaii. I did not, but things changed when my good friend at work told me that he and his wife were going to a time share in Waikiki and they offered us the unit's second bedroom and bathroom. I surprised my wife with the news and we had a year to plan the trip. This property was perfect for our type of vacationing, which is that the only time we spend in the room is to sleep. The Imperial is in the center of the action on Waikiki, staff members are personable and very helpful. The room was adequate in size and the services offered were perfect. If you have this type of base for your vacation the experience starts out very well. For the first few days we only went to stores and restaurants on our street, Lewers, and on Kalakaua, the main street through Waikiki, then I explored the next street, Beach Walk, which offered more unique local restaurants and a lot with seven food trucks. You can not beat the experience the Imperial puts you in the middle of at Waikiki.

We stayed at The Imperial Resort for 10 days.We own timeshares and were told not to expect luxury. But we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very small,we got one with no view. But we were never in the room. 15 mintes from the airport.The location and the Resort personal made up for it. Cudos to the Parking attendants. Always smiling they named us Florida! Staying in Waikiki was the best. You don"t need your car unless you wanted to leave the area. Or you could book shuttle services to nearby attractions. Everything is expensive. But I'm a shopper. So we found the market/flea market just in walking distance.The prices were fair, the food was awesome better than any restaurants.If you need comforts of home at the entrance of the resort doors is a Dennys and an ABC around every corner with all you need . At night its like you were in NYC all the palm trees lit, beautiful.We just happen to be there on Halloween (not planned) if you don"t like crowds. Do not go outside :/ total craziness !!!We rented a car and traveled everywhere.On Friday and Saturday and some Sundays we went to the Swap Meet(Flea Market) at the Stadium and got all our gifts really cheap.A must see is Diamond Head, Germaine's Luau got our tickets thru Livingsocial worth every penny,Pali Lookout,the North Shore etc... And if you don"t want to go anywhere,the beaches are 2 blocks away.Which you want to be at for all the beautiful sunsets. We had a sauna, gym, jacuzzi, small roof top pool, garbage picked up. I can go on and on about the awesome time we had !!

Visiting Hawaii had always been one of my dreams and my dear friends made it come true! I was invited to stay at their time share -- The Imperial Hawaii Resort and it was fabulous!The Imperial is less than a 15 min drive from the airport (without traffic). It's situated in the heart of it all and Lewers Street is just off the main strip, Kalakaua Avenue (with all the shops (Coach, Michael Kors, etc.) and restaurants) but has nice shops, bars and an outdoor concert area itself. So having that convenience nearby made it even better! In the morning, you could just wake up and go downstairs for breakfast (a popular Denny's is in the lobby and one of Hawaii's popular ABC Stores- it's like a 7-11, beer/wine store, tourist shop and CVS/Walgreens all in one!) or you could walk outside and take your pick of restaurants. The beach is right across the street (we had a balcony view) with breathtaking views.The Imperial staff were really nice and the tour representatives in the lobby helped us make reservations for jet skiing, a Luau, Pearl Harbor, scuba diving, and Kualoa Ranch (where Lost and parts of Jurassic Park were filmed -- we took the 2 hour ATV tour, so worth it!!). The rooms were comfy (two beds and two baths --recently upgraded). The room also had a full kitchen so we bought a few groceries and cooked a few times. Housekeeping came by on Monday and Thursdays to clean the rooms but you could always call down to the front desk if you needed extra towels or something. We also had a rental car and the valet service was excellent. They'd quickly get your car, help you with luggage or bags and park it for you. The Imperial also has a nice pool on the roof and fitness room. The pool isn't that big but it's a nice size for the building which is quiet and has a private feel. I miss Hawaii and it hasn't even been a month since I returned home. I can't WAIT to go back next year! I'm taking surfing lessons for sure! The Imperial is definitely a nice resort, quiet, clean and worth the money-- you can't go wrong!
user_name:
jams_away
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We exchanged our timeshare points for 2 weeks at Imperial. We also paid for 1 night rental for a total of 15 nights. The 1 bedroom 2 bath unit was acceptable for a family of 4 (2 daughters). The 2nd bathroom was a huge plus. Could not have stayed in a hotel room for 15 nights comfortably. It was a tight fit but we do not spend alot of time in the unit so it worked well for us. The unit is older and lacks good air circulation. The unit and resort was clean and acceptable. Just could use an update. The rooftop pool was small but not crowded so it was perfect. Hot tub is separate floor from pool, which was kind of annoying. You cannot beat the location for the price!

Aloha! I recently visited Honolulu HI and discovered a whole new world. Let me first begin by saying my family and I had a fabulous time! Honolulu was a busy, bustling metropolis with the Waikiki beach at arms length. On that note here are a few recommendations if you are pondering a trip to our 50th state. Let's get started:Accommodations: Imperial Hawaiian Resort, right on Lewers Street. If you want to be at the center of many restaurants, boutiques and tourist convenient stores but one block from the beach, The Imperial is perfect! The resort is 26 floors with 1,2, 3 bedrooms. The staff at the registration desk are friendly, professional and extremely helpful. We had a one bedroom with a pullout sofa for my sister-in-law. The overall living space was nicely furnish, 2 bathrooms, small kitchenette, two flat-screen TV's and a small balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. We found it very relaxing at the end of a long day sightseeing. On Friday night make your way to the 26th floor guest lounge to watch the Waikiki beach fireworks. Watching them from this view is simply spectacular! Check out my other reviews on car rental, restaurants and points of interest.

We have owned a time-share here for over 20 years. Though improvements have been made over the years, the current renovation will take several years and will be the most visual renovation. Having said that, don't expect a high-end experience. The rooms are comfortable, but most are on the small side and the furnishings, for the most part, are dated. (How much time do you expect to spend in your room and is this important to you?) TV and DVD players in both the bedroom and main living area, though DVD rental is not available at the Imperial. Location is TOPS to get to the beach (2 minute walk) and shopping of all sorts, mostly high-end. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, such as Hard Rock Café, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, P F Chang's, Cheesecake Factory and many smaller restaurants, such as Denny's which is in the Imperial building. The only complaint we had on this trip is the pressure to attend a time-share sales pitch. We received a call every day the first 3 days we were there. Outside of the Imperial, we had to dodge neighboring time-share hawkers and people handing out gun range information.

Rooms above noise of busy Lewers St. Three minute walk to Waikiki beach. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and have fresh island feel. Best buy in Waikiki area considering amenities , location and price. My second stay and I'll definitly return.

We rented a 2 bedroom apartment on the 14 th floor. The apartment although very "aloha" style it was clean everything was in working order. We stayed for 7 nights arriving Saturday morning early although our room wasn't ready we were able to leave our luggage at hotel until room was ready. We came back at 2 pm to be told room was ready, not only was the room ready our luggage was delivered to the room at the same time of us arriving. The staff were very pleasant always and answered any queries we had confidently and friendly. Thank you I would have no hesitation in recommending The Imperial for price, location, cleanliness and the hospitality of staff.

roomier than the average hotel near courtyard of places to eat, 100 yards from the ocean. very good price timeshare and staff are friendly to help, quiet off the beat path for a hotel in honolulu it is worth the trip, quick tip do not rent a car unless you are planning a private island tour and want to drive

Our family of 5 stayed here for 9 nights. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment. There was enough room for us all. The hotel is in a fantastic location and as stated it is outdated and need of a make over! Having said that we didn't stay here for the decor, it was comfortable and staff were friendly and helpful. We booked our stay through Ray White at Hawaii Condo Exchange and everything worked out perfectly. Would definitely stay here again!

My parents bought a timeshare here many years ago. My sister and I and our families use it now. Although it is older and could use a head to toe makeover, we love staying here. The units have everything we need and the staff is friendly and helpful. The beach is a block away and there are restaurants all around. We take the bus to get around and this year rode to Whole Foods for groceries.Our favorite activity while in Waikiki is the Mai Tai catamaran ride. We usually do it 2-3 times during a week.

I have stayed here two times going for third. The things I love about this place is the location and convenience, two minute walk to beach, Deli,Dennys and grocery all located in building. Walk out front doors beautiful street, shopping restaurants, cafes all right there. The actual room is clean bright and functional, not fancy. If your looking for modern fancy room this is not the place for you, if are looking for all the above this place is great. Lets face it this is an old hotel, but I am only here to sleep so as long as its clean they all look the same when the lights are out. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you are coming on a time share the lounge on the top floor is great, lots of comfy leather sofas, large screen tv, kitchen, tables for card games and a balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean. my rating is not based on the fanciness of room its on everything else.

The room that I stayed in had a bed that pulled down from the wall. Once it was down the room seemed quite small. As the bed was heavy I did not return it to the wall each day. The room had a small kitchenette but lacked a kettle for tea making. Small supplies like tea, coffee, sugar etc were missing. Location is great and the view from the top was excellent. Pool was located on the top floor. The Concierge was great. Very helpful. (Jasmine). Be patient with the elevators.

We stayed in the Hala Suite which I believe is the largest. Amazing location! The beach walk had everything you could think of. Floors 7 and up have balconies. We stayed on the 6th so we didn't have one, but we knew that going into it so I can't complain! Everyone working at hotel were great to deal with. Even my friend who slept on the couch bed thought it was comfy. The rooms are a bit dated but it's clean and if we are being honest - how much time do you spend in your room? You are in Hawaii! Cleanliness is the most important. Thanks Imperial for providing me and 10 other family members with a great week!

The Imperial was a great place to spend for seven days. Most rooms do NOT have a view because of all the high rises around. This is one of the most cost effective hotels in the area for the location. They have a giant ABC store connected to the hotel lobby where you can stock up on beer, wine steaks and pretty much anything you would find at a typical grocery store. The location is what makes this resort !! It is a 3 minute walk to the Waikiki beach and you are centrally located to all the high-end stores/ 5 star hotels the Hilton village so so much fun around! Happy hour at PF Changs is a must. Our favorite restaurant was the edge @Sheraton Waikiki with yellow/orange umbrellas along the boardwalk you cant miss it with amaaaaazing food and a great view of waikiki and diamond head as the backdrop this restaurant is to dine for. All and all great stay if you want a centralized vacation this is the place for you. Rooms are old and outdated but who comes to waikiki to stay in their room? Service was top notch and you couldnt beat the location even if you tried!!!

We recently stayed at this location for one week. We had a 2 bedroom condo that slept 6 people. The master bedroom had 2 full size beds and the second bedroom had one full size bedroom. The unit also had a queen size sofa sleeper in the living room. There were balconies off the master bedroom and living room. The unit had flat screen TVs in both bedrooms and the living room. Wifi was reasonably priced. The unit also had two bathrooms. One had a tub and shower and one only had a shower. The unit was clean. All the appliances worked. Yes, the unit could use some updating but given its location, it is absolutely a great place to stay. We could get to the beach easily within 15 minutes. There was an ABC store and Denny's restaurant adjacent to the property. Other restaurants and stores were very convenient to this property.There is a pay laundry facility on the second floor.  The pool is on the 27th floor and a special surprise is the owners lounge on the 26th floor. It was absolutely wonderful. The view was great for looking at the beach, fireworks and sunsets. We were able to stay there after check-out (our flight was 10 hours later). There also are two bathrooms with showers in the lounge for those that want to take one last swim on Waikiki beach before going home. I cannot say enough about the staff. From the time I made my first contact to when I checked out I have never experienced this kind of positive customer service. It really added a positive element to our vacation. I definitely would stay at this resort again and would have no reservations recommending this resort to friends.

Not a true "resort" hotel, but I give it a 4 1/2 overall. 1BR's are a little small, wish we could have had a 1BR w 2 baths at least. Murphy bed as well as sofa bed, + room bed. But clean, wifi ($25 for the week), pool on roof, workout room, sauna, ABC store and Denny's on site (not too bad prices). Location is a 5. Don't need a car rental if you plan on hanging in the general area, and when you want to go most places, the bus is easy transit, cheap, clean, and every 15-20 min. Shuttles to-from airport $15/person. Request a floor above the 12th - otherwise you have a nice view of the garage in the non-oceanfront suites. we were in 2105 and had a beach "view" from the balcony which was ok. Restaurants of ALL types, within 5 min walk. Subway, Denny's, to Roys (suggest) PF Chang's, and Ruth's Chris. Embassy Suites across the street at $279 gives you an idea of what else is there. Not the finest place I've ever stayed, but no complaints and staff was good to us. LOW KEY promo on timeshare sales, they tell you we know you probably won't buy but the offer a lot of freebies for 90 min of your time (we declined...lol).

In fact I stayed at this property in 1975. WOW has it chamged. Did I say Great Location. On block from beach, one block from Aloha Landing, where all the tour busses pick up passengers. Denny's Restaurant and ABC store located on bottom floor. Ruth Chris across the street and really everything you need or want within one block. We took a sunset cruise at the beach behind the Sheridan Waikiki. Busses and taxi's and shuttles everywhere. We stayed on 12th floor, you need to be a little higher to see a big part of the beach. They have a owner's lounge on the 27th floor with a Awesome view!

Definitely the best part about this hotel/timeshare is the location. We stayed 5 nights at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach which is 75 yards away and that place is 5 stars and full of Aloha Spirit. We didn't encounter any rude employees at the Imperial they just don't have anything to hang there hat on other than location. Our flight got canceled so we had to scramble to find a nights accomodations and I booked this place for $200. We were put in room 1105 which had the slimmest of 'partial ocean views' that could be glimpsed between two buildings. The place is delapidated with budget carpeting. It looks as if refurbishment last took place circa 1985. We had a Banyan Suite; size was fine and there was a kitchenette but what was totally disgusting is that when we curled up to go to bed and I pulled a pillow in close I was hit with a waft of what smelled to me like horse manure!! Several of the pillows smelled like this and it was very present all night. I like lots of pillows but instead of finding a nice cool one to curl up with it was horse crap every time. This room and experience was worth $100 per night max.

the only thing saving this hotel in our estimation was the location and a Dennys resturant next door and an ABC shop.Room looked good on website, has a kitchenette and nice sofa table chairs etc but a pull out bed from the wall and a double one at that. Never ever have we had a double bed in all our travels around the world. Wouldn't have booked this place if we had known that. No room service but you could get more towels if needed. Charged a resort fee extra when we got there $6.00 for what I dont know. Carpet was absolutely filthy!! Room smelled like cat pee. They did offer to move us but by that time we had gone to bed and didnt want to move late at night.Extra charges 4 internet. This is a timeshare place and they were wanting to get you to see a promotion to get cheaper tours etc. was on 4th floor no view despite asking for room on higher floor.

The location of this hotel can't get any better. This is my second time staying here and it was just like the first. You are greater with the Aloha Spirit from everyone. Lynette & Melvin at the bell desk are awesome and remember me from my first visit which was a year ago, how awesome is that. Don't get me wrong everyone at the bell desk was great I only remembered Lynette & Melvins name. Kainoa at the front desk was awesome and so was his smile. Again all front desk agents were awesome. The hotel does need a renovation but remember each unit is owned by a separate person and the hotel rents it out for them when the owners aren't here. So the actual owner of each unit needs to pay for their renovation of each unit. The employees of this hotel are doing a great job on dealing and servicing on what they have. All in all this hotel is great. If your picky and need to be serviced on hand and foot and need to be pampered don't be cheap and pay the extra $$$$ that you will need to pay to get what you want. This hotel is awesome in my opinion. Mahalo to all the staff at Imperial Waikiki you guys are doing a great job.

The Imperial is located in a very nice part of Waikiki. It is only a five minute walk to the beach and lovely park area. The shops and restaurants are in the other direction and even closer. The staff were friendly and helpful. The penthouse had a kitchen area as well that was modern and effective. Sitting on the one of two verandas watching and having a drink was very enjoyable. You get a birds eye view of the Holiday Inn Friday Fireworks from the main bedroom veranda.

This hotel is part of a timeshare, but you can also book it for reasonable prices not in timeshare system. The location is fabulous, a block from the beach, across the street from shopping and dining, an ABC at the door. The service is also warm, personal, and welcoming. The front desk and valet area was always staffed with smiling, helpful people. This was our first time staying at the Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki, and it will not be our last.

Stayed here for six nights in mid to late July. Staff were okay. We stayed in the Banyan Suite with partial views of the ocean which we were happy with. Suite was decent sized, could've done with some complimentary coffee but that's not a huge issue. Otherwise it was clean, plenty of towels. As far as appearance is concerned, the hotel could do with some renovations I think. All in all, the location is EXCELLENT! Only a couple of minutes walk to the beach and few minutes walk to the shops. You have the ABC convenience store downstairs, plus restaurants at a stone's throw away. You cannot beat the location for this price.

I found a special online to stay here. The staff was attentive and the rooms had an old school charm. They were very clean. (If you've read any of my other reviews then you know I am big on cleanliness) We were facing Lewers Street and could see the Ocean, as well. You are right in the heart of Waikiki when you are staying here. You are close to the beach, shopping and dining. They also have all the amenities that you need in this hotel although why stay in the hotel when there is soo much to do and see in Waikiki. Aloha!

Very good location we could walk to a lot of shops and to the beach.the staff was Great very friendly and helpful. The rooms could use some updating but how much time do you really stay in your room when you are in Hawaii. When using a Taxi let the bellhop that's outside the front door call for you and we would get limo for same price as regular Taxi which my teenage son loved. We bought the Go Oahu card which was a good deal that had a lot of tours and a Luau with it. We went for Christmas Week of 2013 and the weather was great the water was cold at the beach but not to bad. Make sure you visit the Dole Plantation for the best tasting pineapples so much better than back home.

The hotel is a little outdated decor, but it is very close to the beach, shops and restaurants (within walking distance). The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a fridge, microwave, and coffe pot (although no coffee was provided). The price is excellent for the location.

We stayed in one of the 2bedroom Hala suites. It is with 2-full baths, a good-sized and well-equipped kitchen with generous dining and living space, a balcony that has a stunning view of the ocean and the busy streets below that is lined with shops. Everything is within walking distance, the Waikiki beach, shopping, restaurants, and some attractions like the US Army Museum. The streets are well lit in the evenings, as in fancy lights that you'd think it's Christmastime. It is really a great location, the hotel staff are all very friendly and accommodating. The only thing I would like to critique is that the suites/rooms could use some updating.

BY FAR THE WORST PLACE TO STAY. The staff did not seem like they wanted us to stay. After having trouble with our room for a few days, we found BUGS in the hotel room. They say that they have a full kitchen but you need to buy the refrigerator.. We asked to move to a different place as in a hotel and they did nothing about it. We asked to talk to the manager of the whole resort and he refused to speak to us. Would you really want to stay in a room with bugs crawling around? We had to put the sheets on our own beds and there was FOOD and hair in-between the layers that were folded. By far, terrible service and this place should be closed down.

Hotel was clean, perfect for two. Great location wonderful views on the 25th floor. Pool is small again nice view. Whirlpools were great. No one in them. Maids did not bother us every day but if we needed something we could get it. Good place for the budget minded. Beware of welcome desk. They tried to get us to go to a time share presentation for a free tour that they said was worth 100.00 each for pearl harbor. When we didn't go they pestered us. Beware of the tour desk. We wanted to actually go to pearl harbor on July the 4th. The guy looked at us like we were green. Told us at this late date we'd be lucky to get a tour as pearl harbor would be packed. If we wanted a tour it would probably cost 150.00 each and we would not get to see the sunken Arizona. When we asked if we could take a city bus he said sure but it would take 3 hours to get there. When I asked why so long? He looked at me as if I was stupid And said the bus makes stops you know. We we walked down the street and a Lady handed out a tour pamphlet and we took their tour for 26.00 each and we saw all the things there were to see. The bus would have taken us an hour and there are shuttles from the airport, to pearl Harbor and the flee market for 6.00. Some tour companies can be total rip offs. Buyer beware.

We only stayed here for 3 days, so it was ok, but for a longer stay I would have chosen a different hotel. we had a studio apartment, which had an ok size with kitchen. But the air-condition system was VERY noisy. you only get room service on the 4th and 7th day, which is a drawback and if you need fresh towels/toilet paper etc. you need to go pick it up yourself. The biggest minus is the $5 a day fee for WiFi. Our bed came out of the closet and the mattress was a bit hard. The location on the other hand is GREAT. its a 3-4 minute walk to Waikiki beach and 4-5 minute walk to Hard Rock Café. You get the deluxe shopping street with all the exclusive brands. There's a 24-open Denny's restaurant with good food and an abc-store right next door to the Hotel if you should need anything. The concierge was helpful booking us a tour and the rest of the staff was also very helpful and nice.

Even though the rooms need some upgrading this place is very well staffed, maintained, and in the best location you can get for the price. The staff are so accommodating it is unreal. There are people cleaning, polishing, and checking on you regularly. The pool area on the very top is a nice little area, and the membership room on the 26th floor is a nice area to kick back and enjoy. There is a Denny's attached (Affordable Mainland menu) and an ABC store attached as well. They are horribly pricey but convenient as all get out. Restaurant choices within a block are so numerous you would have to stay for a month just to try every one off them out...from Ruth's Chris directly across the narrow street to the best coffee muffin type joint I have ever visited. Easy walk (2 minutes) to the center of all the tour bus departure spot. Once they upgrade the rooms a bit this will be the greatest. Using the kitchen here is like a walk back to the 50's (exaggeration), but why would anyone want a kitchen or hang in their room while right here by the beach and everything....Fantabulous!!!!!!!

I used the jacuzzi every night! There's a masseuse on the grounds which I took advantage of. The employees were really nice and helpful. Maye, who owns the jewelry store in lobby was super nice! The valet parkers were awesome !!!! Would def stay here again!

I was able to get a KOA suite from an owner friend of mine and it worked well for my dtr and I. It had two beds in the bedroom and 2 bathrooms which was perfect. It was on the 18th floor which is not bad however I would have liked a higher floor and made that known. Unfortunately one did not come up till the end of our stay. This was the 3rd stay for me at the Imperial and I choose it because of the location and proximity to shops and all transportation options for tours etc. The size of the suite was great and our only issue was the AC. We were saved by having somewhat decent AC in the bedroom so we could sleep and we were given extra fans, but the living room was not working at all which resulted in a warm room with all drapes kept closed. A KOA suite is a corner unit and the natural light is great in that unit. We had a couple overcast days which helped in keeping the unit somewhat bearable if we were there through the day at all. We had relatives staying in the Outrigger across the street so it was a handy place to be for us to get together and on a couple warmer afternoons we hit their place after a few hours on the beach..This was my Dtr's first stay in Waikiki and she had no complaints. The ABC is a perfect place for great snacks and Starbucks is close by and of course the shops.The Imperial is showing its age and up for some renovations which include AC so I was happy to hear that. The owner's lounge is awesome and we did spend some time up at the rooftop pool however most of our time was at the beach. We took shuttles to the Outlets and we walked to the mall.The Manager was apologetic for the ongoing AC issue and even sent up cookies and juice when it was known that there was not much that could be done about this particular unit. Other than that issue the place is great, the staff are great and helpful whenever possible. I know I will be back again to enjoy a great week in Waikiki. Mahalo to the great staff! Miss you all and hope to be back soon.

My bff and I stayed here for a week. We got the timeshare from someone, so we got "owners privileges". Basically it means the owners lounge with a balcony, hot tubs, you can view the fireworks from the 26th floor (owner's lounge) or the 27th, the pool which is on the roof. The pool is nice. The hot tubs are awesome and they have 2 of them. 1 is indoors and 1 is outdoors but on the same floor. They came in handy since I ended up getting hurt in Hawaii by 3 huge waves with undertow and was hurting.1st off I loved our stay. This is the exact type of resort I like. So for my gf and I it was perfect. I do not like maid service daily. Housekeeping comes in 2x's a week to do full cleaning and be sure you have nothing on your beds or they will not touch anything. Good to know. On our scheduled day for cleaning it felt nice to walk into a freshly cleaned room but again this isn't anything I need everyday. However, everyday they do come in and empty the garbage whether you put up a privacy card or not in the slot of your room.The timeshare was for a studio at a decent price. We had no intention of staying in our room except to sleep anyway after all we are in Hawaii on vacation. We were on the 20th floor which was great and made our stay that much better. So we had 1 pull down bed and the sofa bed. Now if you're thinking we weren't comfortable with those options...nope you're wrong. Both beds were comfortable and believe me I would have been miserable if they were not because I have fibromyalgia. I was real happy when I saw we had 4 various pillows to use because I use 3 to cushion myself at home. Turned out that for the 1st time in 3 years I was able to sleep flat and only needed 2 pillows. So that should tell you how comfortable I was and I slept on the sofa bed. I don't know how many of the rooms have a comfortable sofa bed but ours did. We had a kitchen with a convection microwave, toaster and coffee maker. From our room we could look down at the center of the street and see the people walking around and also had 2 areas of the ocean we could see. Loved it. Michelle and Dave at the front desk were extremely helpful and very caring because I got stung and bit by a fire ant. Michelle gave me the Dr. phone # and they pick you up at the condo and bring you back for free. I was unable to use it because the Drs. office wanted me to go to ER but that is another story. The point is the care I got was incredible. Dave looked at my foot a day or 2 later and said that's a fire ant sting. I said I know and it hurt. LOL Dave also gave us some options of where to go swimming safely and we truly had a good time. I pushed myself knowing we only had a couple days left and when we left I cried like a baby in front of all the valet guys. Oh well really didn't want to leave yet. Everyone we talked to at the condo was super pleasant. The valet guys are happy and uplifting and Paul went out of his way day 1 to comfort my gf who has anxiety if she doesn't have fast access to her car. They all fully understood and she was relaxed finally about valet parking. Now about valet parking...if you rent a car there is no way around paying the fee if you want to park at the resort itself. This is an additional fee not included in the room charge. Tipping is something that should be done. I did hear that you can park a couple blocks away for $15.00 per day and if you have no disability that is an option if you rent a car. We wanted to do our own thing our own way and needed a car. We didn't do any cruises or that this time around. We choose to go on adventures and we sure did. We wanted to really see the Island. Now the other option you have is not to rent a car at all. You will find options at the airport to get you to this resort. Once here you will see buses and trolleys going by every 5 minutes or so. If you are booking tours or boating excursions you can get picked up at the Imperial sometimes for free and other times for a fee. I suggest checking the cost of transport to the resort, to and from the events you book, and weighing the options of walking around and how far you can walk. The beach is closeby.Everyone is just so pleasant. Enjoyed new friends I met at the smoking area. Food your surrounded with good restaurants. This Denny's is great for breakfast. The ABC store has drinks and this one is one of the best with a full deli with fresh food, high quality at that. Delish. I intend on going back and met a couple I will get a week timeshare from. Can't wait. To all of you at Imperial, Mahalo!!!!! Miss you all. If you like Jewelry see Mae, work a deal. Sweet lady. For my gf and I it was a 5 star, for the sake of letting you all know it's not the Ritz I gave it a 4. If you need daily maid service etc., I give it a 4 for your benefit. They do have 1 and 2 bedroom suites also. Our studio even had a bathtub/shower. On timeshare WI-FI is free. LOVED STAYING HERE! ALOHA

Stayed in a studio unit on 21st floor, the hotel is very outdated.Staff were very welcoming, pool is on rooftop but the views are minimal and the area is very run down. Our room was simple our bed came out of the wall, the mirrors on cupboard were held together by tape. This hotel really needs a renovation. The location is perfect for us close to trolley stop, restaurants, shops and the ABC store right underneath had dinner deals in case you want to stay in

I come here about every two to three years. I own one unit that allows me to come every year, but I come from the East Coast of the US and that is a very long and expensive flight and a six hour time difference during daylight savings time. So just one week isn't really worth it. So, I take advantage of the Imperial's internal banking program which allows you to bank your week and use it up to 2 years later for a nominal fee of $75, so I can come for two weeks without having to deposit with RCI and spend over $200 and hope to be able to trade back in, or I can deposit 2 weeks and come for three for one airfare. I own several timeshares and this is the most liberal internal banking any of them offer.I own a studio, which as some reviewers have pointed out doesn't have a full kitchen, and is a bit small, but it is fine. It has a fridge, convection and microwave oven, toaster, blender, dishes, etc so you can make breakfast or other meals in the room. But sometimes I want to really cook, so I just go to the owner's lounge which has a full kitchen and make a meal there. The lounge is beautiful, with several tables, soft furniture, and the best view in Waikiki. No better place to watch the sunset or the fireworks on Friday nights. And it has free computers with internet access, a huge tv and dvd if you want to watch tv or movies, restrooms with showers if you have to check out early and have a late flight (they provide towels for the day and showers before you leave).One day, I went fishing and caught some Mahi and Opah, and made dinner for myself and several new friends I met in the owner's lounge. It was a highlight of the trip.I just don't understand some of the less favorable reviews. I own 8 timeshares, some gold crown, and many are fancier. Yes, the Imperial could use refurbishing and they have plans to do that, but I don't really care if they do or not. The rooms are very clean, the staff very friendly, they take out the trash for you most days, and provide maid service with fresh towels and linens every 4 days, or you can exchange them every day if you like at housekeeping. Best owner's lounge in the business. There is an excellent concierge service in the lobby for all your excursions, restaurant reservations, etc., and you can't beat this location. It is right in the middle of everything.I have been here two weeks, but unfortunately I have to leave tomorrow. Check out is 11:00 am, my flight is not til 10:15 pm, but I can spend another full day in Waikiki, they will store my luggage and give me a key to the owners lounge. Then, I can come back, shower and change, go to dinner, and enjoy the sunset from the owner's lounge before my shuttle picks me up at 7:30.I discovered some knew interesting (local) and inexpensive places to eat this trip and you can read my reviews on Tripadvisor. These are all local favorites with great food at cheap prices ($7-13 for a full meal). Diamondhead Market and Grill, a great Udon noodle place a few blocks away on Kuhio, Eggs and Things 2 blocks away on Saratoga, the café at Honolulu Museum of art, Little Village Noodle House in Chinatown, Nico's on Pier 38, Uncle's Seafood on Pier 38, Giovanni's Shrimp truck, Big T's shrimp truck, Hula Dog truck (all on the North Shore), Matsomotos Shave Ice, Happy Belly in Chinatown.You know, a resort should be a place to sleep and shower, unless you like the all inclusive thing, and your real vacation is what you make of visiting the local culture and haunts, and that is why I love this place. An inexpensive base camp with a lot of great people from all over the world from which to experience the best of what Oahu has to offer.So if you don't like it, stay somewhere else and pay what they charge. For me, the Imperial is my home in Hawaii.

I have given maybe 30 reviews over the years and this is the first one i have ever given just two stars to. That says a lot. The hotel is in a great location, as others have stated. So are about 100 other hotels though, all in the same area. So, if the locaiton can be duplicated, then the room has to mean something too.The room was small and ill-equiped. Very small. The partial kitchen? It had a fancy microwave and a mini fridge. So does every Holiday Inn Express I stay at, but they don't call it a partial kitchen. It had no stovetop. No oven. No dishwasher even to do dishes. I'm sorry, but I like the idea of using a dishwasher instead of doing dishes while on vacation. SHoot, it didn't even have a garbage disposal in the sink! It just ... "didn't have". One of the other things it didn't have was a bathroom in the bedroom. It was only a one bedroom, but I was fine with that. Our son stayed in the living room on the pull out bed. However, if we wanted to go to the bathroom at night, we had to leave the bedroom and walk past him to go the only bathroom in the unit. I can't think of the last time we didn't have a bathroom in the bedroom. in ANYunit we have stayed at. We are on vacation. We don't want to be walking past our 5 year old son on the way to the bathroom afterwards if we decide to be romantic in the bedroom (or just need to go bathroom.) I just didn't like the unit. Too small, not enough amenities, and that DOES count when other places have the same location benefit and much better rooms. I won't stay at the Imperial again. I WILL go back to Oahu again, but not the Imperial. that's an honest opinion.

Great place to stay with only a 2 minute walk to the beach. It is situated well, with transport nearby as well as shops and restaurants. The resort itself is dated but still comfortable and clean after all it is only for sleeping and you should be out and about enjoying Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The concierge was great and we arranged many tours through the front desk. He knew what we liked and recommended tours accordingly. A great stay and will be back again.It is a bit like the GC in QLD Australia how it was 20 years ago.

Stayed a few times at Imperial but this was the best as we were on 25th floor overlooking the beach.We had fantastic sunsets every night & the fireworks on Fridays were great.The hotel is looking a bit tired but we were informed that refurbishment was going to take over the next few years.Staff are always very helpful.

Date26 March till 10 AprilWe had stayed here last year & were pleased with the value for money, thus our return. This year scored us a higher floor ..14 room 11. Room 11 is furthest from the beach and the last room on its floor so neighbours one side only.A warm arrival awaited & we were pleased to find our room ready early. 1411 had us facing the Embassy suites across the way again but also an ocean glimpse in between the 5 star Halekulani & theOutrigger Reef to the left. Views up Lewers St the right. Again a decent size lounge/ diner/ kitchen, which we noted had been updated compared to last years room. Better counter top finishes in the bathrooms & kitchen. Stove, fridge &micro Newer carpet & fresher wall paint throughout. Sofa bed, pull down bed, dining table, single wardrobe with safe all in the lounge room. This room had a marginally different room layout to last years. The bedroom door had " shifted" making the bedroom an awkward room . It only left just enough room each side for a double bed. No space beside the bed either side for a lamp table, in fact no space to really get out the bed on the wall side. This caused a few awkward moments with hubby trying to get out of bed in the middle of the night for the bathroom & trying to not wake me as he clambers over. This room would be better suited to maybe two twin beds. The headboard also knocked the wall whenever you moved...solved with a rolled up Macy's bag shoved in the gap ;)We also found this bedroom airless and a call to housekeeping saved the day with a table top fan supplied. It was much quieter on this floor compared to last years lower floor..much less street noise.On the whole though, I think we once again got value for money. Great location with clean & functional rooms...albeit a little outdated with furniture & furnishings in some places. If u want posh furnishings this isn't for you...if u want clean & functional this is perfect. We were happy enough to book again for Christmas this year!

My husband and I stayed in suite 1010 in March 2014 for a week. Other family members ( 2 other adult couples) stayed in 2 other suites.Ours had a partial kitchen, with sink and microwave. It was stocked with dishes and cutlery and coffee maker. We had two balconies-one off our living room and one off the bedroom.Our views were of Lewers Street.The suite may have been dated, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable.The only complaint that we had was the noise from the street at night, but this can hardly be helped by the hotel.Other family members stayed on the other side if the hotel, facing an alley I think, had no noise issues.The ABC store was right next door and we definitely made good use of it for making breakfasts in the mornings. The location was excellent. A quick 5 minute walk and we were on the beach. Lovely!Also, we found area in general very walkable and access to public transit and tours was easy.We would consider staying here again for the location alone.

Avoid!!! Tired and dated is being kind to this place. Rooms look like they haven't been refurbished since the 1950's. Location is the only thing in its favor. The owners would be best served raising to the ground and building a decent resort from scratch.

I have been coming here since 1987 and the five times I have stood here I have seen the mom and pop restaurants and the corp juggernauts who are the neighbors now. A family timeshare that has good size rooms for the price. next to the royal hawaiian and a 100 yards from the water it is well worth the stay

Another great trip to Hawaii! was glad to see the friendly staff once again. I always have a great sleep. This feels like my second home which keeps me coming back year after year. Can't wait till next year!

Talk about location, location, location! Our stay at Imperial was awesome because it was close to everything and everywhere we wanted to go in Waikiki, the entire staff was very courteous, cheerful, and helpful, and the room was clean and orderly...and the price can't be beat! The rooms aren't the most luxurious around, but who spends a lot of time in a hotel room while in Hawaii? We'll definitely stay there again!

Great location that has many amenties! Kitchenette with fridge, microwave, and large t.v.The folks at the front desk were very helpful! We were able to rent beach chairs at thehotel and simply walk across the street to hit the beach.
user_name:
elena m
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Good location but in need of some updates in the room. Friendly staff who are very helpful. Owner's lounge has a few computers for use circa 2003 - using IE6 as a browser so very slow and didn't load pages properly.

one of the best located hotels i have stayed in. quite daggy interior of the room, however it was clean and functional and we didnt spend alot of time in the room. served a purpose for a few nights. wouldnt stay for a long time or luxury. it was okay.

It is nicely located in Waikiki but our view was just of the street & hotel rooms. Go to a different place for better views. It is a very noisy place with trucks making deliveries early in the morning with their backup beepers going & trash trucks dumping. It is not a run down place but could use some updates. Bathrooms are dated but the big issue is the size. We were in a room that was on the 9th that was to be a hotel suite not a hotel room. Murphy bed that took up most of the room & too small for 2 people. Did have a sink, fridge & microwave. The pool is on the top floor with no views. The location which is close to bus stops, trolley stops, attractions with being only one street from the beach with easy access. We had only okay service at the front desk.Calling to get anything was the fastest service we have ever had at any stay anywhere. This happened twice. Both times it didn't involve any money for them, so it was not that. They were great. Some places we have stayed at say they will be right up & hours to days go by with nothing done till you call again.

We stayed at the imperial January 20 - 26. We were in a Koa Suite which is a Corner unit. We had #807. It was okay. It was in the middle of Waikiki in a decent location but our view was just of the street and other peoples hotel rooms across the way. And it was very noisy with trucks making deliveries early in the mornings with their backup beeping and trash trucks and so forth. It is pretty old and could use a good carpet cleaning and new paint and the bathrooms redone if nothing else. They show a photo in their website of a Koa suite with a magnificent ocean view but in reality, very few rooms have that view unless you are in a very high floor to see over the top of the Halekulani across the street. The pool is up on the top floor surrounded by a brick wall so no view from up there either. Without a balcony with an ocean view there wasn't really anything to do there unless you went to one of the resorts and bought something to sit in their bar with a view or unless you went down to the beach itself. I worked out in the gym one time but it was so hot in there I couldn't stand it.  Food in Waikiki is really expensive and it just wasn't really our kind of place. The days we rented a car and went away from Honolulu were the best days. Also, we asked in the lobby about renting a car and were told that because it was Pro Bowl week, rates were high but he could get us a "discount" of $89 per day for a compact. We walked down the street and had a choice of 3 different companies each offering cars for about $55 per day. All in all, we wouldn't choose to stay there again. Without a view, it's just a rundown hotel in a noisy expensive city.

We stayed here for several weeks. Let me start by saying that the location is unbeatable - down the end of Lewers Street, and across the road from a number of narrow alleyways, any of which will lead you straight onto Waikiki Beach. PROS:Apart from location which is also close to bus stops, trolley stops and all the major attractions and hotels in Waikiki, the decor in the lobby and rooms is tropical and Hawaiian so you feel like you are in Hawaii. For what you get, it is very good value for money.The mattresses on the beds were turned over twice weekly which I thought demonstrated a degree of caring for the guests which I have not experienced elsewhere.Most of the facilities at this hotel were very good - There is a guest laundry which was very convenient; ice machines on two floors; a swimming pool, jacuzzi; exercise room, non denominational religious service each Sunday; signs on every floor near the lifts with upcoming activities around Waikiki, an ABC store next door, 2 clothing/gift shops in the lobby, Denny's chain restaurant and Happy Hour drinks once a week.The male staff, in particular the two managers, were absolutely delightful to deal with and resolved minor issues quickly, efficiently and graciously and took on a more complex issue until it was satisfactorily resolved. They are an absolute asset to that Hotel. Mac, the guy at the activities desk, was really lovely and very helpful. The Hawaiian cleaning lady was really lovely and efficient.CONSI cannot be as complimentary with the female staff with one in particular at the Front Desk needing either a new job or complete retraining. My dealings with her were not conducive to a relaxing vacation and unfortunately I was not the only guest to find her manner abrasive, rude and unpleasant. The same can be said of the Filipina cleaning lady in the laundry.The hotel is across the road from a number of restaurants and bars, so a certain amount of noise is to be expected. The problem was the drunken revellers in the early hours of the morning and the sound of reversing trucks made some nights more difficult to sleep when staying on the lower floors. This problem however was not experienced if one stayed on the higher floors.Air conditioning - There was difficulty operating the air conditioning leading to some uncomfortable nights sleep. Lack of Business Centre - this hotel is marketed as a resort and guests are charged a resort fee of $6 per day but there are no computers available to guests who either have difficulty accessing their emails via wi-fi in their rooms or do not bring smartphones or such devices with them on vacation. The only computer available is one laptop at the front desk which is purportedly only for the printing of boarding passes but is not signposted as such and with a policy which is arbitrarily implemented. For anyone visiting Waikiki, you will be hard pressed to find better value or location for your money.

My family and I have been staying at the Imperial since 1980 and it's gone through a lot of changes, with more to come. Renovations are planned, but don't expect high-end refurbishment. It's destined to be a middle-income hotel/condo so the prices should stay reasonable, compared to the Trump Tower and the new Ritz Carlton. That means the other 99% of us can at least afford to stay somewhere nice when we visit Hawaii.The location is ideal: 1/2 block from Waikiki Beach, and 1 block from Kalakaua (the main drag). An ABC store is right downstairs and parking is available. Lewers Street had gotten a bit classier over the years, but you can still find some reasonable stores, if you look hard enough, including stores that sell products that are locally made in Hawaii.The rooftop pool is a nice alternative to the beach, with sun from about 9 am to 3 pm. The Owners' Lounge on the 26th floor provides specatular views of Waikiki Beach, the ocean, and the Hilton fireworks.The staff is EXCELLENT, especially the valets. These guys work hard and are very nice to me each and every time.

The week before Christmas we (five of us) in a one bedroom apartment on floor 10 (glimpse of water). Room was ok double bed, single murphy and double sofa (very comfortable) plus kitchen area (only used this area for breakfast). Dinner was on the amazing floor 26 common area for sunset dinners plus photos! Visits to ABC store was a lift trip away along with a short walk to beach and main shopping area. Staff were no different to any other place I have to - helpful

I just returned from Hawaii on Tuesday, Dec. 24. We stayed at the Imperial from Dec.18-23, 2013. Everything was fine about the hotel except the location of the room. They put us on the 7th floor and I could hear EVERYTHING that was happening on the streets below. We checked into the hotel late Wednesday and got straight into bed. I could hear people yelling, horns blowing, motorcycles revving their engines. It took me a long time to get to sleep.The next morning first thing my daughter and I did was get up and go to the front desk to see if we could switch rooms. I was told I had to go to 2nd floor reservations and so we did. The woman at the front desk up there was rude. She was not at all considerate or caring. It was all about "business." She said she may have a room on the same side of the building and I said that was fine as long as it was much higher. She then told me about the $50.00 cleaning fee. WHAT!!! $50.00 to change sheets on a bed because that's literally all I did in that room. Absolutely ridiculous. I hadn't unpacked a thing. I literally plopped on the bed and slept in my clothes. Or shall I say "tried" to sleep! Well, I walked away and was really upset the entire day but had to let it go so I could enjoy myself without the stress. Each night was the same except come Monday morning, Dec. 23rd I was awakened at 5:52am by the trash truck, I'm guessing anyway. And they must have had 20 trash cans to pick-up because the noise seemed to last forever!!! I couldn't get myself back to sleep and it was my last morning to sleep in. For this reason, and the lack of respect and caring, I will never stay at this place again. I am a timeshare owner and have paid thousands of dollars over the years for the timeshare and maintenance fees. I exchanged one of my locations for the Imperial and I would THINK I would be treated with more consideration and kindness!

We spent 2 weeks at The Imperial in November. Excellent service from all staff and they could not be more helpful and friendly. The location is one of the best in Honolulu. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment with a kitchen consisting of dishwasher, fridge, full sized oven (I even cooked a turkey), microwave, toaster etc. - just fully equipped. We had 2 bathrooms and two TV's. Could not have asked for anything more. The sunsets from the lounge on the 26th floor are just stunning. We will be back next year.

..and would never go anywhere else. Best value for money in Waikiki. Love The Imperial. The location is just the best, the staff are very friendly and helpful - the rooms spacious and nice linen too.The Ocean Suite bar is not open every night but is well worth a visit when it is - sunsets are gorgeous and the Mango Chi Chis worth coming back for.ABC conveniently downstairs is a great bonus too and open early to late.

We stayed here for two weeks, and on arrival after a smooth friendly check in, the first impressions were really good. And what I really look for in a hotel is a clean smelling room (No Smoking), and unlike some people on here I have no intentions of crawling around the floor on my hands & knees like some old sweetie wife checking under the settee for any fluff, or inspecting the furniture for scratches, or measuring the soap for thickness. Me personally I found this room on the 22nd floor more than adequate and with a good view of Waikiki and in particular the Pacific Ocean who could complain about this? Yes I do agree the room could do with a makeover but it wasn't that bad to be honest and the Murphy bed was a godsend in itself as one simply flicked it up out of sight and behold, a bigger room.! Now who the hell comes to Honolulu and stays in their room and continually inspects it when there's a whole tropical Island to explore and enjoy? I can never understand people who make it their mission in life to find faults in a hotel, like a fellow guest we kept bumping into who spent his entire holiday complaining to the desk about stupid things like his towels not being "Soft Enough" even the room cleaner got an earful one day.Looking around my room it had everything one needed to be self catering if you wanted, microwave, fridge, iron, flat screen TV etc. but we rarely used this room for cooking as we ate out mostly, but for people on a budget well, It's perfect and here downstairs you have the ABC store which sells just about everything you could possibly want, they even have a delicatessen too. Next door is "Denny's" a fast food diner, and just around the corner is the famous beach itself. As for the laundry you have the self service washing machines on level 2 on the car park, you don't even have to travel far for anything here, as for the rooftop pool well, it's wet if anything but don't go up here expecting to be doing an Olympic back stroke, or scuba diving lessons, as it's quite small enough to just enjoy the gentle breeze and peace it offers. Also on a Tuesday night there is a fireworks display further down the beach and here is the perfect place to watch it.!Our room in particular was cleaned every Tues, Sat. and if you needed fresh towels, sheets, in fact anything at all inbetween then simply pop down to the maintenance floor and the friendly women will happily change everything for you no sweat. One day our Ironing board broke and on reporting it found it was replaced an hour later good service, As for our bathroom it served it's daily purpose too. The reception staff were always friendly and waving to us, and as for the bell boys outside they were brilliant always up for a laugh with me, one even impersonating my Scottish accent badly which was always in good fun, needless to say he got it reciprocated very quickly. These guys were so efficient in the parking of cars and arranging taxis even getting me a great deal up to the punch bowl etc. Thanks lads. As for the Concierge's Michael & Scott, they were top blokes in arranging trips and giving out really good decent advice, with no Bull**** attached, they'll advise you on anything even the weather for the next day if you want. Michael's quite a character beware.! One day we managed to get up to the owners lounge and here the views over the Ocean were simply amazing, but unless you get an invite it's out of bounds to us mortals, (As we sneaked in, shhhh) , but the location of this hotel is it's major selling point as your central to everything within walking distance including the many bus stops taking you anywhere in Honolulu as well as the many restaurants to behold. Even better the US Army Museum is just around the corner too, and having stayed in many hotels around the World most good some bad, the Imperial stands out as being very good. In fact it was pretty quiet with just the odd door slamming Imbecile who somehow couldn't fathom out how to shut a door quietly some days, it's a common disease which seems to afflict certain people on holiday, however it wasn't as bad as what you get in some hotels in Europe, where hotel door slamming is considered a synchronised door slamming Olympic event, a truly annoying phenomenon which seems to affect the simple minded, the worst being in Egypt some years ago when around 50 Russian guests were leaving at 4 in the morning absolutely horrific.As for the Imperial Hotel, I would definitely stay here again no problem as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, with no worries at all. Even when I e-mailed some requests before we arrived they were answered promptly, and do check out the large colourful Aquarium behind reception a real eye catcher. Once again the staff were a credit here, very friendly and helpful too.Just be aware folks of the hidden extras in the final price like local taxes etc, as it can be a sore one on checkout as some people found out to their cost. as for me I was well ahead of the pack on this one. And after a "Tiring" day shopping, drinking, eating, lazing around the concrete madness of Honolulu, one can always retreat back to the safe haven of the Imperial... Mahalo.!

We exchanged through Diamond to get a 1-bedroom in this Interval timeshare property. The Imperial is in an absolutely fabulous location amongst the better known big hotel chains and Wakiki Beach Walk outdoor shopping mall. Lots of night life fun. There's only a short walk to the beach, great dining and shopping. The Denny's and ABC store next door make it easy to stock up on needed items or get a delish and inexpensive breakfast. Very thankful to the helpful concierge who booked our side trips. On the downside, the room needs some renovating. The lobby is fine, but the rooms could use a facelift. Bathrooms are tiny. Beds are full only, but a Murphy bed and sofa bed in the room will appeal to larger groups. Kitchen area has micro/convection oven, refrig with sink and usual condo type dishes, etc. Little balcony lets you get a fresh air breather but no view on lower floors. Pool on the roof and access to the 26th floor owners' lounge with panoramic view saved the day for me. Overall, fine enough. Despite it all, I'd stay again just for the location alone!!

Just arrived back from a week staying at the Imperial. Room very clean and comfortable was on the 17th floor.Staff very helpful and cheerful.Great location close to beach shops and restaurants.Having full kitchen was great as we had breakfast in the room and could relax to discuss the days agenda.ABC store on ground level that sells everything.
user_name:
Elizabeth P
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We have stayed here many times and keep coming back as it is so central to all that we do. The rooms are adequate size wise but the bathroom is 'petite'. The rooms are in desperate need of a make over but the facilities outweigh the negatives. The rooms are kept clean. The laundry is downstairs - coin operated - with dryers.
