On the same site, is Denny's and an ABC store. Lewers street offers a vast array of restaurants and shops. It is a short walk up to the main street to access the trolley which we use extensively.

The location and staff were awesome. The only downside would be they only made the bed and changed towls every other day. Definately would stay again when going back. just walking distance to beach, shopping, and dinning!.....Great Place!

And have been here since 1995. Place has wifi/modem in each room. Towels, Gym, Sauna, Pool, etc And Denny's & ABC Store on-site. It works out great.. Plus it's across the street from the best "downtown" block in Waikiki. Ruth Chris and PF Chang are on the block.

We exchanged with RCi for a room at the Imperial. Of course, this saved us plenty of money, but not enough to justify staying again.The room needs an upgrade, and a good cleaning. The furniture is ancient, the kitchen is outdated, there are stains on the carpets and the walls, and the bed is one of the most uncomfortable I've ever experienced. Mostly, we just wanted to be out of the room as often as possible.The "pros" were true pros, though. The location is great....right in the center of shipping at Waikiki, and within a short walk to the beach. The concierge was helpful in planning activities, and the front desk employee who checked us in was helpful. There is no dining on site, and when we asked if any places delivered, so we could finish packing at night, the staff had no idea.We only spent 5 days there, as Oahu was a stepping point to another island.... if it's a cheap exchange with RCI, for just a few days, this hotel might be tolerable.Otherwise, staying somewhere else will likely enhance your vacation.

The Imperial is in dire need of a renovation. Furniture is dated and uncomfortable. Bathrooms are worn down . Beds are full size no queens. The upsides are that it is close to the bars, beach, restaurants and shopping. It's very quite as well.

You can't beat the location, tucked in behind the Sheraton and the Halekulani. So close to the beach, cafes/restaurants and shopping. And so reasonably priced compared to the bigger hotel chains around you. This time I had a room at the back, which was quieter, but I still got a glimpse of the ocean from my balcony (17th floor). Clean rooms with a kitchenette with everything you need. You can even get a blender from housekeeping. Comfy Beds, plenty of towels, separate beach/pool towels. Friendly staff, valet staff always right there to greet you when you pull in and always fast to bring your car round when you're heading out. The gym has enough equipment to be able to get in a good workout. There is also a Sauna and Hot tub. There is a coin operated laundry. The ABC store downstairs has everything you could possibly need, even now a Deli where you can order a sandwich or salad. Great place to stay, I'll be back

Kinda hard to find, you pull right in front of the front doors of an ABC store and have Valet park your car. NOTE! Always inspect your car BEFORE the Valet takes it, and when they BRING it out! Had some drama regarding this, my bad for not checking when it was brought out before I drove to North Shore. Have always gone to Maui, first time to Waikiki. At first was I was thinking why did I come here! High rises etc, but after looking out my 24 floor balcony, I was really glad to be there. Nice Ocean view AND skyline at night was way cool! nice room, friendly staff and everything you could want very close by. Don't bother paying for computer time, it was 1990's slow, total rip off. Also, Valet parking is 100 dolars for the week. If you don't plan on going to the North Shore but wanted to go to Pearl Harbor you could go without a rental car and use public trans or tour. I would stay here again. I rated breakfast poor because I don't care for Denny's, Plenty of options though

the Imperial hotel resort is a great place to stay it has a laundry and a swimming pool ,and it is central to everything,the staff are frindly and helpful, a great ABC Shop downstaires that sells everything you need, across the road and up one leval is a restaurant that sells beakfast at 5.99 two egss anyway you want hash browns toast tea or coffee and the service is quick.and a short taxi ride to the ship if you are cruising out of Hawaii.We booked with booking.com

So, I had always avoided this place since some reviews were not so great. However, a very spur of the moment trip left me with little choice of available rooms.So. I booked thru an online booking service. Not my usual style- I like to book directly. I already knew the location. Our preferred area in Waikiki, quieter than up near the main street. You are across the road from the beach. There is a hotel in your way ;) but its still only a skip across the road to a beach access passage. ABC shop downstairs & plenty places to eat & drink. Anyhow. I arrive to find they don't have my booking. The young lady searched hard for vacating rooms etc. There was a more expensive room available but the manager wouldn't upgrade me...not even when I offered to negotiate a price for it. After a while they found a room. Ok. 7th floor end of the corridor. Decent size lounge room with full kitchen, tv, drawers, dining table, sofa bed & pull down bed. Bathroom to the left. Small balcony. Bedroom was off to the left with a double bed ( didn't feel like a queen) tv & drawers , wardrobe & another bathroom. Both bathrooms were the same. Toilet, small sink & bath with shower head. Grab bars in the bath. The view was of the embassy suites opposite & the Wyndham resort to the right. Looking down onto Lewers st. U can see across to the 5 star Halekuani & 4 str outrigger reef. No ocean view fron the7th floor but higher levels do. The room in general was clean , maybe a little tired in places. I'd love to get new carpets in the bedoom. The bathrooms are SMALL. If u have long legs u will need to sit side saddle or your knees Will hit the bath. Hair dryer. We had a few ant friends in the bath. Not in the kitchen strangely enough. Thy didn't bother us. The pool on the roof is small & always seemed to be busy with kids. Laundry on the second floor, soda machines & ice. Beach towels in your room & u can get fresh ones from housekeeping. Housekeeping came twice a week to vacuum & do the sheets.  Couldn't find much to complain about. ( just remember people below you do not wantYour cigarette butt or your spit landing on their balcony while they sit out & have morning coffee!!! - yes that happened twice) For the money it is very good. I noticed hotel prices have risen a lot lately but this is very affordable. In fact, I'm about to rebook for next year & save $70 a night on the rooms in the Outrigger Reef ( we love the o/r but prices have increased a lot).You can't escape noise in Waikiki, but this is a relatively quiet part of town but just 5 minutes from the main road & steps to the beach. Now, where is my credit card so I can book my next trip?

This is an older property but very well maintained. We had a one bedroom, and the living area had a murphy bed (both beds very comfortable). There was only one bathroom and it was quite small, typical of when the place was built. That would be my only complaint. For two of us, it was not a problem, but if 4 people stayed, things could get crowded.

Great place to stay with easy excess to beach. Waikiki has lots of shopping & dinning and hotel is easy walking to all. No car needed. Like service and location. Top floor has beautiful ocean view to watch fireworks from. Aloha

Hotel was alright. There was just the two of us, so room was roomy. Any more people and it would be crowded. The valet parking was nice and the ABC store downstairs was convenient. The walk to he beach wasn't bad, but you had to walk down a narrow alley between stinky hotels. You can walk to many stores and restaurants.

We stayed on the 19th floor for four nights in a one bedroom apartment with a sofa bed and a pullman bed in the living area for our 14 yr old and 10 yr old. With two bathrooms, a kitchen and a balcony, it was a wee bit cramped - mostly because the kids didn't want to put their beds away, but fantastic value in a great location on Waikiki Walk, and it was quiet. The housekeeping staff were great with an endless supply of towels, and the parking was cheerful and cheaper than other hotels at $25 per night. The laundry was also a bit cheaper. The kitchen could do with an upgrade but we weren't there to cook, at the most we heated up some leftovers for lunch and made cups of tea and used the fridge. There's an ABC general store right in the lobby with an ATM where you can buy microwavable meals if you don't want to eat out, as well as a Denny's restaurant which was great fun. The tour desk guide was also extremely knowledgeable and was able to give us a lot of time and book us a fantastic luau. Thanks to the housekeeping staff - I left my camera behind for a week and got it back!

We were shocked at how primitive the appliances and decor was in the rooms. Indoor outdoor carpets, murphy bed(I thought this was only on Two Broke Girls TV show),mold on shower door, aluminum pots, old ,old ,old.The carpet was so gross that I did not walk barefoot. You haveto pay for Wi-Fi. Friendly front desk and valet.

Great location 2 minutes walking to the beach close to all shopping.nice roof swimming pool.And the best of all is the friendly staff from parking your car from the front desk .you can ask for better people.the hotel concierge Michael was super ,very knowledgeable of the area.Thank to all the staff in the hotel.

My husband and I stayed on the 11th floor. Cleaning service was absolutely horrid. They told they were coming on a monday morning and showed up in the later afternoon. We stepped out of the room for 15 minutes thinking they would still be in there, but were not when we returned. The only cleaning they did was take out the trash of the kitchen despite leaving a note with tip. No vacuuming, dusting, dish washing, or bathroom cleaning took place in four days. The room was also poorly stocked although it says on their website they have fully equipped kitchens/bathrooms. We were given one roll of toilet paper per bathroom for four days. Utensils were also limited along with types of pots and pans to cook from. Much of our frustration was the poor quality of the kitchen tools as it deeply affected the foods we attempted to cook. Appliances are also out of date (1980's) so noise was a huge issue. The only reason why we did not check out the same day we checked in was because it was non-refundable. Spend the money and stay at the Hilton, Outrigger, Sheraton, Moana, and the Embassy next door.

My family and I stayed at the Imperial Hawaii Resort in Waikiki the last week of August of this year. I read some of the prior reviews and although it's true the furniture is a little outdated, the accomodations are good for what we paid for them. I find it was a fair price for what we got considering the hotel is within walking distance to the beach, dining, shopping and entertaining. The personnel were very nice and the service was excellent.Be aware, though, if you rent a car they only have valet parking. We negotiated a weekly rate that was less than daily rate. The hotel has a decent size rooftop pool, adequate gym facilities, but only two jacuzzis, although I think it's more than enough as not many people use them.Overall, I thought the place was good and the location was great.

We held a family reunion here in August because one of my uncles owns a timeshare unit here. I think we booked a total of 12 units of different sizes. The general opinion is the building location is awesome and convenient, but the condition of the property (especially the rooms) are in dire need of refurbishing.My family stayed in a Hala suite, a 2-br & 2-bath unit. There are 8 bed spaces, but with a odd layout. The master bedroom has a private bathroom 2 queen beds, the 2nd bedroom has a double, and the living room sofa folds out to be a queen as well. We have 3 kids, so it would've been much better to have 2 queen beds in the 2nd bedroom. That way, one of them wouldn't have to sleep out on the sofa bed. Meanwhile, the 2nd queen bed in the master bedroom ended up being used as a storage...odd if you ask me.Anyway, the location of the building is great! It's very close to everything, very convenient. They provide valet parking service (mandatory & daily charge), so you don't have to worry about parking. There is large ABC store on the first floor that sells just about everything. It's walking distance to MANY restaurants and shops!However, the condition and the rooms and public area are not in the best shape. The kitchen area has very little counter top. We had to use the stove stop to as an extension of the small counter space (we don't use stove while on vacation, only microwave). The same goes for both bathrooms. The sink counters are tiny, and there are no shelves, medicine cabinet to place your toiletries.For the price we paid, I think the Imperial was a very good deal. The unit, albeit small, oddly laid out, and not in the best condition, does provide MUCH more space than a typical hotel room; and, it's location is unbeatable.

Pros:The staff is nice. The location is central. Close to the beach. Owners Suite on top floor.Cons: Old interior in common areas, smelly due to poor air circulation, owners/board members do not maintain their asset by upgrading and maintenance. We stayed in a TINY 2 bedroom Hala unit with a "micro" kitchenette. The stove was from 1972 (no joke) and the dishwasher from the early 80's that was soo loud we would leave when it was on. The carpet was soo gross- 15-20 years old per hotel management and just filthy. We actually traveled with another family so there were 3 adults and 2 kids. We were soo embarrassed as the other family would not even walk around with their shoes off! The master bedroom has 2 old tiny full size beds with prison like bedding- there is a nice balcony off this room to get much needed fresh air in the room. The bathroom is old, scruffy and tiny as well. The second bedroom is more of a closet. Again a gross old double bed but the room was smaller than our RV bedroom!! The "closet" is used to hold a small old 3 drawer dresser that one can access only from sitting on the bed! No room to walk around either- YIKES! The other bathroom by the front door is ridiculous-the door opens into the tiny room so you have to back in and maneuver to close! The old rattan couch was just that- we actually got a spare sheet and threw it over it the entire week we were there and still never sat on it. The list goes on and on...We left every day for Kailua- Shame on the Board Members for keeping all the profits and not investing in upkeep, you ruined our vacation!

This hotel is very close to restaurants and Waikiki Beach. The top floor is great for lounging and watching the sunset and rainbows! It has wall to wall windows and plenty room for lots of people. Like other viewers mentioned, it has a full kitchen on the top floor. The room we stayed was nice, it had 1 bedroom and a pull out bed in the living room. The room only had a small fridge and microwave. We did not stay in the room long- we were always at the beach or doing tours, so this arrangement was fine for us. The ABC store is close by if you need any groceries. Overall, the experience was great. There is a shuttle that will take you to the airport. We did not need a car at all.

We stayed at this resort/hotel through our vacation timeshare exchange. The location was amazing - just a 5 minute walk across the street to Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of many great restaurants on Kalakaua Avenue. The staff was great and the owners' lounge on the 26th floor has great amenities (full kitchen) and a wonderful terrace with great views.

I stayed with my 7-year-old daughter for four nights. First it was difficult to find the location but it is just a minute walk from the beach and center of Honolulu and ABC mart is right next to the hotel entrance so with a small kid and myself only it was very convenient.Hotel staff at the front desk and parking were very friendly and accommodating.The price wasn't too expensive even for the beginning of July.We could walk down to have quite a good view of July 4th fireworks!We really enjoyed the stay in Honolulu!

We stayed at this hotel for 7 days and it is very centrally situated 1 road up from the beach. The apartment was small but fully equipped and clean. It was big enough for 2 people and the bions were cleaned everyday and the room cleaned once a week. The swimming pool was on the 27th floor and the guests lounge was on the 26th floor. The views from up there were stunning. There are enough restaurants in Lewers Street if you didnt want to cook your own food and the supermarket was right next door. The staff are friendly and helpfull and I will stay there again if we go back to Hawaii

We stayed here for a Friday and Saturday night over Labor Day Weekend. It was centrally located, clean, and was small but adequate for 3 adults. A small kitchenette with fridge, microwave and sink including utensils was nice. This is really a time share resort that apparently rents out rooms when they have availability on their 27 floors. Our 3rd floor room had a view of a back alley and another hotel. Rooftop swimming pool had panoramic views of the city. Our room had a locked door to another room on both sides, so a suite could be made out of the 3 rooms. However, we could hear a verbally abusive husband berate his wife both mornings through one door, which we reported to the desk. Our AC only cooled the room to 80 degrees, which was uncomfortable. They gave us one free day of parking to compensate, which was appreciated. $25/24 hour parking, in and out privileges.

The resort was as expected after reading previous reviews. The room was as described with no complaints at all. We had the one bedroom / two bathroom unit on the 24th floor with a partial ocean view. There was no street noise at all. The two bathrooms were quite handy. Our friends were in the same type of room on the 11th floor and only problem was with the plumbing in one of their bathrooms. The room was booked through Hotels.com who stated that room price included taxes. After booking I contacted the Imperial who confirmed our booking and that there were additional taxes. Even though I requested confirmation of the room cost I was not advised by them that there was an additional $6 per day resort fee and also the requirement for an additional $250 deposit to be paid on arrival to cover if you smoked in the room. Too bad if you were on a budget !!!. Luckily I had taken copies of emails and confirmations as at check-in when I disputed the fees and charges I was told this was stated in the booking confirmation. I had the proof it was not but made no difference and had to be paid. Even when I questioned their own email confirming costs I was told by the manager on duty I didn't ask about any additional fees or charges and it was my fault. All in all it was a pleasant stay and convenient to pretty much everything. Less than five minute walk to Waikiki beach. Convenient to pick up points for various tours if they don't pick-up at the door. Staff were friendly,efficient and willing to book taxis and shuttles. Largest ABC store in Waikiki is at the door and covers all your needs.I would stay there again keeping in mind I now know of the additional fees and charges.

We had a very happy stay for 14 days at this hotel. The location was just great, close to everything we wanted. The rooms were always clean, the amenities were all that we asked for.A short walk to that wonderful beach. We had our family staying in another suite with a full kitchen which they were very happy with too and we have absolutely no complaints whatsoever.The staff were very helpful and on our last day when our flight did not leave until late at night we were very lucky to be able to use the very large suite upstairs until we left.All in all we would definitely recommend this Resort.

This was a great place to stay. It was not on the beach but only a short walk. It was located close to everything from food to entertainment to shopping. The rooms were clean and set up well to accommodate 4 to 6 people. The staff was top notch. We thought valet parking would be a pain. The nicest staff were the valets. You never had to wait over a couple minutes to get your car. We had a most pleasant experience.
user_name:
Susan S
Keene, New Hampshire, United States

review_body: Stayed at the Imperial for seven nights and loved it. We had a one bedroom suite with two bathrooms. The rooms are a little out dated but were clean. Had a room on the 20th floor with a little bit of a view, but we weren't worried much about the view as we were hardly in the room. The hotel is about a block from the beach and a little more than two blocks from Fort Derussy park which has a great beach, There is an ABC store on the property which has just about anything you could want. There is also a Denny's restaurant on the property which is handy if you're looking for an quick and inexpensive meal and the staff there was very nice. There are quite a few restaurants within walking distance and a bus stop right by Fort Derussy, where you can pretty much catch a bus where ever you want to go. There is a pool on the roof which is small but what the heck the beach is only a block away.The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful if needed. There is a 25 dollar parking fee but we never needed a car so it wasn't a big deal. I will stay here again.

The Imperial is in a great central location 1 block away from beach, next door is a ABC shop which is very handy, directly across the road from the yard house, This hotel is a older hotel, rooms are spacious ,the kitchenette was very versatile,living area has a dining room table and a lounge with TV and DVD player, There was 4 beach towels per room and these can be exchanged daily if needed,the pool on the 27th floor is small and has some outdoor furniture which was great after being out and about all day you can come back home have a swim and relax around the pool for a while and recharge the battery before setting off again, The staff are very helpful and very very pleasant.

I called prior to our trip to make sure our room would accommodate our family of five and I was told, "yes, but you'll be so busy that it will only be a sleep box." and that's what it was! When I first walked in the room my heart sank, not at all what we are used to after 10 years of exchanging with RCI. If you asked me today, a week after we returned home, if I'd stay there again, I'd say, "HECK YA!" The rooms were small, we had clothes and stuff scattered from one wall to another with nowhere to put our belongings and I couldn't even put a gallon of milk in the fridge without removing a shelf. The deal is I was in Hawaii, in downtown Honolulu, just steps away from Waikiki Beach with the ones I love most...my family! Sure I would have loved more room but we made the best of it and by day 3 it was home!

Memories! 18 adults and 23 kids. An assortment of room types equals 41 happy people if they're at the imperial. Mahalo for best Hawaiian vacation ever!We gathered from other countries and all around the us. Everyone loved our stay. Yes. Carpets are older and show wear but all the better for the little ones! Beds were comfy, TVs were modern. And all worked perfectly.

Okay this is an honest review and not fabricated in anyway. First off before even booking this condo I did my research and read up on comments from other guests who have stayed here but with an opened mind. I work in the hospitality industry and know how people can over exaggerate their experience especially a bad one. So when booking this condo i kept my expectations low. So here it goes.Arriving:Not a very well lit hotel sign we past it once and had to go around the block again because it is a one way road. But once we got there the valet greated us with the "Aloha Spirit" Hawaii is known for. Valet is $25 a day but its worth it. Waikiki doesn't have a lot of space for parking structures so its okay. But why let this ruin your vacation. Your on a tropical island enjoy it.Oh and about tipping the valet. I read a comment from another guest on here and obviously this person doesn't work off tips otherwise they wouldn't be upset. Yes, I tipped every valet person. Gave them $ when they took my car to park as well as when they brought me my car. Lynette at valet was awesome and always gave ideas of things to do. Thanks Lynette keep up the great work.Check In:Arrived to the front desk. Area was clean not as big as a hotel but this is a condo not a hotel. Please keep this in mind. I was greated again with "Aloha Spirit" by Kainoa who was great and very informative. He checked us in and informed where I needed to go. Thanks Kainoa you are awesome.Arriving in my room "1807":Walked in and it smelled clean very important to me. Off to my right was a bedroom with (2) queen beds and (1) bathroom exactly what I made my reservations for. Then I walked into a living room which had a sofa bed which my (2) teenagers slept in for 3 nights and said it was very comfortable. There was also another bathroom which they used so the room had a total of (2) bathrooms which was great since there was a total of (3) females in this room.There was a stove, convection oven, fridge and they had dishes sufficient enough for all of us if we wanted to cook a meal. The room had a balcony which I could see the ocean a little. But I planned to see the island not stay in the room. For me as long as the room is clean and comfortable who cares about the view.There was hot water to shower with so that's great. If you need more towels or shampoo & etc you do need to go to the 3rd floor where housekeeping is located which was not a problem for me because if you have stayed at a condo before you don't get this at all. There were also beach towels for us to use which we didn't expect. We went and bought our shampoo & etc from the ABC store downstairs and they have everything you will need while you are here.Location:This condo is in the center of everything. There are tons of restaurants to eat at and tons of shops. The beach is a 2 minute walk away.Well that's all I can think of to say. Oh I also read a review where they said their engagement ring was stolen by housekeeping. Well there is a safe in the room.Why didn't u use it? I know it was a surprise but you didn't have to give her the code. I left my brand new ipad in the room out in pkain sight for everyone to see. We left at 8am and got back at 8pm and it was still there how I left it. Housekeeping only comes every 3 days so I dont know what happened to this guys ring.I hope this is helpful to you.

I have visited this facility since 1986 and have only been disappointed one year when repairs/upgrades were in process.Otherwise, for me & my travel companion this has always been a very comfortable, friendly, convenient place to stay. No, it is not a "resort" but it is clean, exceptionally well situated on Waikiki beach, excellent restaurants, shopping nearby, convenient transportation to other areas of Honolulu, etc. I'm still going back & looking fwd to a great vacation week.

My wife and I stayed for 2 nights there.Positive:Best location near Waikiki beach and Sheraton hotel. Amenities are good: you can wash your laundry. Small swimming pool on the roof.Negative:Receptionist was not friendly (a woman). The hotel is getting old and need a good refurbishment. Our studio was okay but the double bed was a murphy bed. The hotel is like a factory. It is huge and impersonal.

We have stayed in a number of Hawaii hotels and this is the best value for money location.Just around the corner from Trump Tower and over the road from the Outrigger Reef Resort.This is the more modern area of Waikiki and still a short walking distance from Waikiki beach.Close to all transport and supermarket if you have a kitchenette room. The only downfall is the dated cane furniture but that's it.

Stayed here for 4 nights and it's totally worth the money. You stay close to the beach and there are several stores just located around the hotel. You got a guest laundry on floor 2 (1.75 washing / 1.25 drying), a sauna and exercise room (pretty well equipped and everything was working as intended) on floor 3 and on floor 27 a roof top swimming pool (it's no joke!). The view from the roof top is breathtaking. The room is well sized. You get plenty of towels (shower, beach ... ). I had a fridge, a coffee maker and a toaster in the kitchen along with some dishes . For 1-2 persons more than fine! The bed is hidden in the wall so you gain place during the day (although it's not really necessary .)The reception is manned 24/7 so an early checkout is not a big deal. Unfortunately there is no shuttle to the airport (at least I didn't found it) so a taxi cost around 40$ (without tip).If I ever come back to Honolulu I will stay here again!

Easy access to the shopping, beaches and great restaurants. Small pool, but adequate with the beach close by. 1 bedroom, 2 baths, wall bed and sofa bed accommodated all of us. Kitchenette was helpful.

OMG. The price was not right. Valet parking 25.00 per day. Fees and taxes took equal to 60% of the stay. That is imperial piracy. A convection oven-who uses a convection oven? How about a microwave. A coffee pot from the Mayflower. Our room was supposed to be a resort, oh well, no refrigerator, and oh yes, we ended up in a studio. The valet scratched up the rental vehicle and had the audacity to ask me if I wanted to make a police report. I would have mad3e a report to the police, if I would have sufficient time to get to my flight. In Honolulu, you have to have your boarding pass 90 minutes before your flight. There wasn't anything good to say about this place.

Stayed two nights to see 4th of July fireworks at Magic Island. The view from the 26th floor was incredible. Room amenities were a nice surprise-set up like a studio timeshare. If you are looking to spread out and spend a lot of time in your room - this room was not the place. For me and a friend it was perfect - one block from the beach and two from Waikiki main st - Kalakaua Ave. Restaurants and shops nearby and Waikiki Trolley was great.

This great Hotel is a prime location to get to absolutely everything you want and/or need. Everything is within walking distance. The staff treats you like you are one of their very own family too! All around great place to stay...affordable, clean and prime location.

Our stay here was great. It was the nicest hotel suite we ever had, and the price was great. It's a one block walk to the beach, and restaurants all over the place. Parking was free then, but I understand that all the hotels in Waikiki charge for parking now. Too bad. I think it's because of the poor economy, and they are looking to make another buck. It's just like the airlines now, charging for every little service they can. Customer service is less important than the bottom line. They forget that customer service is where they separate the men from the boys. Repeat business will last only so long, before customers start looking for friendlier service.

We stayed here for 2 nights on our return from Maui to Australia and thought that value for money was pretty good.We were on the 7th floor with a partial view of the ocean (but mostly the hotel next door). It is right next door to an ABC store a minutes walk to the beach and central to all the shops, buses etc. The staff are very friendly and helpful the only downfall is the bed. We had a room with a murphy bed and it is really too small. Hubby and I each took a turn sleeping on the sofa as the pull down bed is in between a king single and a double bed so if you both want a good night sleep then a room with the murphy bed is not for you. Bathroom is really tiny smaller than bathrooms in Singapore and that is saying something however it is still do-able. They only service your room every few days but we were only there for 2 so no big deal and you have to pay for wifi. You pay for what you get here at this hotel and even though there are a few features that we didn't like we still would come here simply for the location and the COST.

ALOHA!!I want to make this review as honest and straight forward as possible. As I often mention in all of my hotel reviews, everyone has a different appreciation on the kind of hotel they have chosen. The Imperial is definitely NOT a 4-star neither a 5-star hotel --- so lower your expectations. We have this hotel as a choice from our time-share we have and we werent disappointed at all!! Location wise -- its perfect! Its very close to most of the best restaurants (as listed on the magazine "Dinning"). Yard-House is infront of the hotel, while along the same street you have Cheese Burger Beachwalk, Taormina, Giovanni Pastrami, PF Chang -- and a short walking distance you have Jimmy's Buffet , cheesecake factory, Hard Rock cafe and a lot more!! If you are into food trip , then definitely this ones for you.Room -- We had a one bedroom / 2-bath unit that sleeps 4-people comfortably. There is a small kitchen, dinning table, a sofa bed and 2 flat screen TVs. We were at room 1907 which is a corner room with great views!!! We had both the ocean and the city view that we admire everyday during our entire 1-week stay!! The room was clean when we entered and the interior was nothing fancy. As I told you, its not a 5-star hotel with luxurious amenities. But if you are ok staying in a hotel with basic amenities (comfortable bed, good air conditioning unit, a relatively clean bathroom with very good water supply --- not to mention a great factor -- THE VIEW from our room was superb!! ) then this hotel will be just as perfect as it is!! Hotel staffs -- Hmmmm -- not everyone is pleased. (or should I say -- you can not please everybody either) -- But Mr. Todd, is very pleasant -- His smiling face and a good reception makes our stay wonderful. Check out time was at 11:00am and our flight back home was at 12 midnight, Mr. Todd was so kind to hand us keys to the Owner's lounge at the 26th floor so we can still stay in the hotel while waiting for our airport shuttle service at 8:00pm. Mr. Michael from the tour desk was equally nice too. The concierge Mr. Paul was so nice to help us with our luggages. Over-all staffs were so nice and help except for some of course ( I wouldnt mention names anymore--)At the hotel's ground floor is ABC grocery store (open from 6:00am to 1:00am) -- a great store that sells basic necessities (food, wine, beer, cigarettes, souvenirs, chocolates, cosmetics like sunblocks , lip balm , etc.. fruits milk, juice, and there's a corner for your basic medicines for cold, cough, insect bites, headache etc) I love this store as you find them everywhere!!! Also at the ground floor is a restaurant named "Denny's" great breakfast food ... yummy pancakes!! price range for breakfast would be from $2 - $8 (usual basic breakfast) I gained 4-pounds for just eating pancakes for a week!! hahahahahahaha....Generally, Iam recommending this hotel for those who want a "relatively nice, comfortable hotel" to stay in during your trip. And ohhhh .... I forgot to mention that for SHOPAHOLICS this is the BEST PLACE for you!! Just around the corner from Imperial Hotel you can find top rated designer shops such as : Tiffany & Co., Todds, Gucci, Prada, Louis Vuitton, Fendi, Hermes, Salvatore Ferragamo, Coach, DFS (Duty Free Shop) and a lot lot more!! This is shopping mecca for you!! So there you go, have fun in Hawaii!!Mahalo!

I was really looking forward to coming back to Waikiki but as soon as I drove into the hotel I was hit with extra fees. We booked this hotel because it was a little cheaper than the others in the same area. If you have a rental car you'll have to pay the 25 dollar a day valet fee not including tips. There's no other parking. There's a compulsory daily service hotel charge that allows you to use the pool and sauna. If you want wifi.. You'll pay for it. When we got to the room we opened the curtains to the brick wall of the next door hotel. Beautiful. We had a full kitchenette which we thought would save us money as we wouldn't eat out so much. The kitchen is actually falling apart. The stove, dishwasher looks ancient but still works fine. All very confined. Our main problem was the fry pans they gave us were useless. The food just burned in them no matter how much oil we put in. Fried eggs or pancakes were impossible. They wouldn't replace them either. They also only serviced the rooms on Monday and Friday. And if you needed more towels you had to go the service room to exchange them yourself. We also had to have the fans on with the air conditioning. There was a thermometer and gauge in the wall but no matter how low we turned the gauge it would stay at about 75 degrees Fahrenheit. The hotel room was nice and quiet. The rest of the room was fine. Two good quality tv's a nice lounge and bedroom was comfortable. Having two bathrooms was also nice. Location is fantastic.. Couldn't get much better. Pretty much right on Waikiki beach. So much to see and do. So close to shops and restaurants. Your in the heart of Waikiki. My advice is if you stay here, defiantly get an ocean view room above level 15. And you don't really need a full kitchen because there's so so so many eating options so close by. Just beware the hidden costs!

I've owned at the Imperial for 25+ years. It has gone through a number of transformations over that time and now seems to have really 'found its groove'. What makes this property so very special is the staff. They are outstanding. From the moment you arrive, the front desk folks are there to make you feel special and welcome. Todd is amazing. Quiet, polite and efficient, he gets you organized fast. We always ask for early check-in and he does his best to meet our request.Michael from Elite Concierge has the best contacts for tours and shows...very knowledgeable and efficient. The rooms (I own a one bedroom, 2 bath Palm unit) are comfortable, clean and reasonably quiet (upper floors are better)...it's the location that is fantastic that may cause the noise...you are right in the heart of the action! Restaurants and patios galore! Beach is just down the street...the best section of beach is at Fort Derussy Park... wider sand area, sandy bottom and less crowded.

We are owners and we love Imperial! It is clean and comfortable and right in the center of great activity...restaurants, shops, beach and access to any tour available is steps from the front door at the Sheraton. There is a Denny's downstairs and across the street is Ruth's Chris, Roy's and Nabu for the "foodie" and Starbucks, Subway, PF Changs and lots of local spots within a block. Maybe it is because we are owners but the staff here is helpful and kind. The shopping has every variation from discount tee shirts to Rodeo Drive-esque stores. What we pay for a week here would scarcely pay for a night at the neighboring hotels....Think LaQuinta in the middle of 5 star hotels...Not a place I'd want to spend my honeymoon, but for a once a year getaway with my family, it just can't be beat!

We have a timeshare at this hotel but you can also book direct. The apartments vary - we have stayed in a studio and also a one bedroom unit - both very good. The one bedroom unit has 2 bathrooms as well as a fully equipped kitchen complete with dishwasher and oven. The lounge on the top floor has outstanding views - watch the sunsets over the ocean from here. The pool area is well equipped with sunbeds and also has an ice maker and filtered water available. Certainly excellent value for money and right at the bottom of Lewers Street - across from the beach. Has an ABC store underneath - what more could you want! Looking forward to returning in November.

My parents have a timeshare here and booked it for my sisters visit to Oahu. They were told that we could stay there as long as we showed the confirmation number. At check-in we were turned away completely, no other options offered. The front desk wouldn't even allow me to call my parents so that they could explain. It was 11pm and thankfully we had my house to stay in. The staff treated us like we were trespassing and just told us "NO". 3 days later, after the mess was sorted out through the timeshare company, we checked in and were told that if it smelled like smoke after we left, we would be charged $250. We got to the room and it smelled so badly that I had to open the door and let the bad air and AC out. There was trash on the floor and on the furniture like clothing tags, wrappers, sand. No one ever came to clean the room. It was horribly loud with street noise and ventilation. The place look like it hadn't been updated in 20 years and there were no other guest to be seen.. The Imperial Resort has no redeeming qualities.

First of all, they would not let my sister and I check in since the timeshare was under our parents names. Our mother asked the "resort" if we needed any written permission for us to check in as their children and the staff said we were good to go. However, we still had to fax them permission. Once we finally checked into our room, there was a chapstick and tag on the sofa and ground which was also covered in dirt. The room and the place itself was surrounded by tacky wall and closet mirrors which did not help its already porn-like atmosphere. Housekeeping came in the room once in which they only took the trash and never changed the towels or bedding. Upon checkout, we were charged $20 a day for parking which we were never told.
user_name:
Diane W
Orleans, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: My wife and I had a one bedroom place on the tenth floor. The rooms were small with a TV on the wall, a dining table and a couch in the living area. There was also a murphy bed. The kitchen had a microwaive and a fridge, but no dishwasher. Bathroom was so small you couldn't hardly turn around in it. There was only about a foot of space between the foot of the bed and the wall, but you had to go through it to get to the closet. The whole place was very dated and needed updating. And not just the room, everything except for the lobby looked old. The pool was a bit small and dated. There was only ice available on the 2nd and 27th floor by the pool. No vending machines, but there was a large ABC convenience store next door that even had a deli. There was also a parking garage across the alley from our bedroom window that was noisy at times during the night.Now the good things. This was a very good location in the middle of Waikiki. Although not on the water, it was only about a block away and easy to reach. The staff at the hotel was very nice and knowledgeable. The valets were great, efficient and friendly. The concierge made some very good suggestions. It is on a block with many different restaurants including Yardhouse, Cheeseburger-Cheeseburger, PF Chang's and several local spots. I would consider again if the price was lower or it was updated.

The Imperial is nice because its not far from the beach but other than that I hate it here. My boyfriend was planning this romantic gesture here in Hawaii. He bought me an engagement ring and had a beautiful evening planned. When he went back to the room to check on it, it was gone. He placed it in a hidden location so I wouldn't find it but I guess not that hidden since the housekeeping assumed it was left behind. We've been saying here all week and it doesn't make sense to me how someone would take something from the room when we haven't even checked out yet. We are here with our family and it was supposed to be a memorable trip and now I'm just heart broken. I know things can be replaced in this life but its so sad that someone would do this to people. I never even got to see what my ring looked like. So if your planning on staying at his hotel... Leave nothing behind!! Don't trust the hotel because they don't put YOU first. They honestly never even got back to me about the whole situation. I had to get the police to help. So just BEWARE of his place!

This hotel is old - definitely 'dated' - BUT - the location is great if you want 'in on the action' of downtown Waikiki Beach. Lewers Street has great restaurants and shops. You might have to walk a bit to get to a beach - but the pool at the hotel was fine and I can not say enough about how helpful the staff was - at the desk and throughout the hotel. There is a convenient laundry facility and rooms have a fridge and microwave, dishes, glasses, sink - We had a great time. I think the people who work there make the difference - they are very helpful and want you to enjoy the place.

The hotel is very old, it's almost going to fall apart.... At the location is good and the people are very kind.... I think hotel charged too much for such a look... hotel should be renovated and updaiting to...
user_name:
Za Maja V
Novi Sad, Serbia

review_body: First of all for ratings, I would give this place a 5 star for convenience and friendly staff, but a 3 star for cosmetic and appearance.IHVC- check in is not until 4pm, if you do not request early check in the staff will hold your bags until your room is ready, in our case we stopped at Safeway on the way in and they put our cold & frozen items in the fridge & freezer as well as storing our luggage, very accommodating. For Timeshare owners there is a REALLY nice Owners waiting/lounging area on the 26th floor with beautiful ocean views, T.V.'s, kitchen, pool table, etc.IHVC is a high rise, 27 floors sitting amongst about 6 other high rises, so views are limited of the ocean unless you are on the 24th floor and above. The other floors you mostly see other high rises from the room windows.Main floor: the lobby, activities desk, movie rentals, Denny's restaurant, an ABC store (like a mini grocery/Target) and a few little trinket shops. 2nd floor: parking, laundromat3rd floor: Hot tub, Sauna, workout facility, Housekeeping (available: small appliances, beach chairs, ice chests, extra towels, etc)27th floor: the pool, patio, ice machine, penthouse roomOur room: we exchanged some of our timeshare, we were supposed to receive a 1 bedroom w/partial kitchen but were upgraded to a 1 bedroom with a full kitchen (small fridge, full stove/oven, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, counter, sink, dining ware amenities, SS frying pans, dish towels, etc. if you need anything else just call housekeeping there is a good chance they have it. There is a living room with a couch, T.V. & DVD, a very small balcony w/partial ocean view, a small dining table and chairs, a Murphy Bed (Qn), full bathroom w/tub/shower. The bedroom was small, Queen bed (not the most comfortable), small dresser, closet but you couldn't completely access because the dresser is in front of it and there is no place else to put it. A full bathroom w/ shower only, T.V., DVD, small outside balcony. The room has A/C, a safe, iron, ironing board, beach towels. The decor was dated and even though the room looked newly painted there were stains on the ceiling, the carpet looked like it could be cleaned and it had an overall aged worn look and feeling as well as the hotel in general. Even though IHVC is fairly close to the main drag noise was not much of an issue. Every now and then you could hear sirens or Harleys. I rarely ever heard other guests, never to the side or above us, only occasionally in the hallway. We were directly in front of the elevators (3), I was a little nervous when we first saw this but it was never a noise issue either.IHVC sits on Lewers st 1 block West of Kalakaua ave at the north end of Kalakaua. Kalakaua is the main avenue of Waikiki where most of the shopping, International Marketplace, restaurants, Resort entrances, etc are. Kalakaua avenue is approximately 1.8 miles long ending towards the South at the Honolulu Zoo and Kapiolani Park. For the average person this is a great walking area and you can also pick up the local Trolley's for a nominal fee if you get tired or do too much shopping. Kalakaua is a one way street running North to South for vehicles. There are quite a few one way streets in this area, I would highly recommend getting a good map of the area and becoming familiar with the streets if you are renting a car. Also the IHVC parking fee is $20 per day.Lewers is approximately .2 miles long from IHVC to Kalakaua ave (west to east). The following is on Lewers: several boutique shops, restaurants; The Yard House, Roy's, Giovanni Pastami (they deliver to IHVC & you offer a 10% discount if you pick up the cards at front desk of IHVC) Subway, Sushi restaurant, Cheeseburger's, P.F.Chang's, Ruth Chris Steakhouse and Nobu is around the corner. There is a Starbuck's on Lewers and a Starbucks and Tea House 1 block over on Beachwalk ave.Beach: directly behind IHVC are 2 resorts which sit directly on the beach, The Outrigger and Sheraton. You can access the beach by walking on either side of the resorts or we also found you could walk through most resorts to access the beach they just frown on using their pool.Because we exchanged timeshare time it is hard to compare IHVC based on pricing. As I said it is in a convenient location the staff is very friendly and it had all the amenities we needed away from home just in need of a facelift.Notes: The following is additional info on some of the things we did, so you can continue reading if you like.Airport shuttle-We used Oahu Airport Express. On time. It was a flat $30. No other passengers just our party and luggage. You can only book 3 days in advance but usually not a problem. I requested in advance to stop by the grocery store and he was able to accommodate our request for an additional $15 (based on addt'l time). Once with him you can book your return and any other shuttle service you want on your stay. It took approx 40min airport to IHVC @ noon on a Wed (excluding 30 min store stop). 20min from IHVC to airport @ noon on a Wed.Restaurants: (please remember Hawaii is more expensive so meals tended to be about 30-50% higher then what we normally experience in AZ)YARD HOUSE-reasonable pricing, good selection, very close, nice atmosphere, dining & bar, Happy hour 2-5:30pm M-F, casualFURUSATO'S-decent pricing, great sushi, fast food atmosphere but not fast food, on Kalakaua about 1 mile south (see review on T.A.), dining, casualNOBU-Expensive but good, sushi, beef, Kobe, restricted menu, very close, behind IHVC, hip atmosphere, pretentious, dining & bar, dressyGIOVANNI PASTRAMI-Reasonable pricing, good selection, breakfast also, dining, sports bar area, happy hour & 10% discount for IHVC guests,casualP.F.CHANG'S-Chinese, ok food, reasonable pricing, good selection, casual to dressyCHEESECAKE FACTORY-Reasonable pricing, Great selection, big portions, Love the CF, breakfast also, GREAT CHEESECAKES, about .8 miles South on Kalakaua, dining & bar, casual to dressyPOOL SIDE RESTAURANT AT THE MOANA SURF-RIDER/SPA WESTIN HOTEL-Pricey, decent food, paying for the atmosphere, beachside and good entertainment, dining & bar, beachwear, casualKONA BREWING CO-reasonable, great food, best pork sandwich ever, good selection, dining & bar, casual, off Kalaniana'ole Hwy (10 miles SE)MOANA SURFRIDER HOTEL LANAI RESTAURANT-Buffet breakfast $32pp, cereals, breads & pastries, fruits, eggs, sausage, bacon, Miso soup & fixings, rice, potatoes, cooked to order: waffles, pancakes, omelets, french toast, juices, coffee, tea. Great selection, good food, beautiful ocean view.Rented a Scoot Car (2 seater) 2 cycle engine for 24 hours -$150 (price can vary to $250 based on availability), cannot use on Freeway, big hills are a little challenge but better than a scooter you might want to opt for the 4 cycle but it was out when we decided to rent, a little squirrely but tons of fun. Rental is located on Kuhio just South of the backside of the International Marketplace I believe just after Ka'iulani St. We drove the scoot car SE as far as possible for our time frame and then headed NE past Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay ending up at the beach across from Sea Life Park, nice drive, beautiful scenery. We ran across the Farmers Market at the Kapiolani Community College, GREAT place to stop, free to get in. Wonderful foods from all over, fresh veggies & fruits, bakery goods, beautiful fresh flowers, highly recommend, runs on Sat not sure of any other day. We had lunch at Kona Brewing Company on the way back and had a great meal. Slab on some heavy duty sunscreen, bring a hat, cover up, etc. you don't realize how much sun you are getting with the breeze keeping you cool.There is also a pineapple store just a few doors up from the scooter guy, GREAT fresh pineapple, pineapple juice and smoothies, absolutely worth stopping in for, average cost is $5 for each of the above.Moana Lani Spa @ the Moana Surf-Rider Hotel-Great spa, great therapists, on Kalakaua, just south of Cheesecake Factory (See review T.A.)Pearl Harbor & historic Honolulu Tour-We purchased through the activities desk at IHVC because tickets were already sold out online. If you want to visit on your own time, I would recommend purchasing tickets a few weeks in advance, otherwise Discover Hawaii Tours was absolutely wonderful and you can relax while they fight the traffic. Our tour guide ???(Misty Heaven in english) was so funny, informative and just an absolute kick. I would highly recommend. Cost about $40 pp including transportation & entrance fees.Shopping-It is a shoppers paradise here. If you are looking for great deals though I would recommend going to the swap meet on the weekend. Otherwise pick up the little books you see around town, i.e. Collections, Best of Oahu, etc, there are discount coupons that could have saved us at least $100 had we picked them up early on. Aloha Landing-This is located just to the side of IHVC in the Sheraton semi-underground area (less than 5 min walk). It is where all the tour buses and shuttles pick up for tours. This is also where you can catch a FREE shuttle through Hilo Hattie's (local Hawaiian store). This shuttle takes you all around the Waikiki area and over to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. A very nice outdoor mall with a few unique stores but most stores are typical mall stores of the Mainland. Still a nice afternoon or evening place to walk around. I believe the shuttle runs every 30 mins and it's FREE!Transportation-We did not rent a car. We periodically used a taxi service, Hubby tore his calf muscle right before coming so on crutches. From IHVC to the South end of Kalakaua Ave a taxi cost us approx. $10 including tip. Going North the cost was around $12-$15 because of the one way streets. You can also buy a weekly pass through the trolley service for about $50 with unlimited usage for 7 days. If we had known sooner we might have rented the little ride along mobility scooters from Honolulu Hawaii Wheelchair & Scooter Rentals 808-772-9723. For anyone with a disability this would come in handy for this area. About $250-$300 for a week.I think that about covers it, hope it helps your vacation to be an easier one!

This hotel is great for those travellers looking for a value priced room one block from the beach and in the heart of all the action. If you want to go out for late dinners or go to a nightclub this is definitely your hotel because it is located across the street from "The Yardhouse Pub" which is very popular with the party set. We are beyond the age of "clubbing" and travel with our young daughter so the noise was audible every night (moderate). We were on the 7th floor facing the pub so the location of our room was likely a factor. I got up at 4 am (due to time change) and went to the 24 hr Denny's on the main floor of the hotel to grab a coffee. The restaurant was busy with inebriated patrons that had come over from the pub after closing. In the following days I noticed that when we went for breakfast at 6am the entire restaurant was filled with family type patrons so we were never concerned about having our daughter be in a "morning after the night before" type of environment.The rooftop pool was small but very warm (unlike the Hawaii Hilton Village where we spent the day to use the pools-you can rent a day room there when available, but the pools were unheated so it was a waste of time/money because my daughter and I barely got wet...just too cold). The Imperial pool had some fantastic views and was surrounded by chaise lounge chairs. There is also a third floor sauna and whirlpool which we often got to use alone because it seemed to be rarely used.There were numerous restaurants which we enjoyed within close walking distance from the hotel and the high end stores too numerous to count. You don't need a car, but our best day was when we rented a car and went to the North shore for some peace and quiet. We much prefer the non crowded beaches filled with locals surfing. We also saw turtles at Turtle Beach (1.5 hr drive from the hotel) and ate at a fantastic beach grill that served my favourite coconut shrimp.So in summary, perfect hotel for city type travellers that don't mind some noise (deliveries to stores/restaurants happens in the middle of the night also...so all night long you hear "beep, beep, beep" when the trucks are backing up....can be annoying for people like us that prefer silent tranquility on a trip). We were perfectly located for the conference I was attending but if you like quiet, the North shore would be preferable.

The Imperial Resort which is basically a hotel, not a resort, has many attributes, but none surpasses its location on Lewers Street where it's happening. And it is just a block from the shoreline (three minute walk at most. Kalakaua Street is just a block away where many fabulous restaurants and shows are open until very late in the evening. It is actually a better location than on the shore if you are interested in things other than sun bathing and swimming. It's location is great for those as well.We stayed in a time share suite with one bedroom plus a Murphy Bed, a complete apartment sized kitchen, living/dining room, two full baths and a small balcony with a view to the ocean.It was more than we could usually afford, but got a deal by using a friend's time share. The one complaint would be the small bugs (sort of like fruit flies) that were present on the kitchen counter and in one of the baths. They did us no harm, but would bother some people.

This hotel is right in the heart of downtown and one block from the beach. If you are driving a car you will have to pay a fee each day for parking. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping. Its a very busy location. Dennys is located right next to the lobby and so is an ABC market along with a couple of gift shops. The rooms are nice and spacious. We had a 1 bedroom with a convection microwave, sink & refrig & dishes. This worked great for us as we were only in the room for breakfast. The pool is rather small but then again you are right across the street from the beach. Also has two hottubs. The owners lounge has a great view, pool table, computers and tv. Staff was always helpful and polite. Great a giving directions and recommendations. Conceirgne is awesome, and recommends great day trips. Highly recommend the helicopter tour and Wild Bunch for fishing charter

Depending on the number of guests in your party, 2-3 people can share a room directly across from the beach. The view is one of the best along the beach. Rooms are constantly being upgraded/refurbished. The beach is just a few minutes walk, bus lines are close, seconds to get a cab, fairly central location to activities and restaurants. Staff is friendly and courteous. Pool located on the roof...nice. Self service laundry available. While it's not posh, it has all of the necessary amenities to make your stay comfortable and memorable. I've stayed there multiple times and will stay again at every opportunity!

Excellent central location, with many shops close by. Well-stocked store downstairs for groceries. Good kitchenette including a microwave, fridge and toaster.Murphy bed was a good use for the small space but at times wasn't very practical. Bathroom was small but functional.

It was really a great experience staying in this Place. It is really just near the beach and near to any shooping centers. Its just also 10-15 minutes walk to the International Market Place. And i got to experience going to the Owners Lounge and the view of the beach is just so beautiful and relaxing..

I've been here two times and am going back for a third time this year. This resort doesn't have much to offer. There's no activities at this resort like tennis or minigolf like other resorts that i've been at. What I do love about this resort is the location. It's one block away from the beach and about 2 short blocks away from the shopping strip. I usually don't spend much time in the room anyways because theres so much to do and walk around to see. This resort is a bit outdated inside but they do have plans to renovate the last time i've been there so hopefully it'll be a little bit different when i go this year. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. You do have to pay to park in the garage daily. I believe most places you do. Overall, i've had a good experience with this resort. Its not a 5 star resort for sure but its convenient and doable for my purposes.
user_name:
KristinL432
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I booked this studio through the owner on vrbo and stayed for 6 nights after spending a week in KoOlina. Waikiki was extremely busy this time round for spring break. This studio has been renovated and has 2 large screen TV's and a huge fridge. If faces Lewer's and on the the deck you can see a corner of the ocean. It has 2 induction burners for making small meals but we ate out as we were with friends who were staying at hotel nearby. It is a small space but for us we were mostly there at night to sleep and away all day so was fine. We usually are in 1 BR suites.  My only con for this unit was poor water pressure and hot water temperature. For some reason the hot water was inconsistent and at the end of a day I like a hot bath which was not so hot. The large murphy bed was comfortable. We have stayed at the Imperial a few times in different units each time and we like the location as it is close by to everything. Unfortunately WiFi is not free and also not available on the pool.If you stay there you need to ask for the lounge chair towel covers as they are not provided in the room and seem to be on the down low unless you have been before or see them at the pool. We would return to this unit as it had everything needed in a small space. The laundry facilities are also handy if needed.Cant beat Hawaii for a great vaca!!

We go to Hawaii approximately every two years and stay at the Imperial for two weeks. It is in close proximity to the beach. We can buy food at the ABC store downstairs and fix some our meals (which is important to us). We stay in a two bedroom, two bath unit and usually have friends or family with us. It is a short walk to the beach and just a block from the main shopping street. It's a short walk to Kapiolani park. We just love our times there. The furnishings, etc are dated - but we find it totally functional and very well located. There is often entertainment across the street in a little park area and we can always catch it from our balcony.

Together with my wife, we spent a very happy time in Waikiki staying at the Imperial Hotel in Lewers Street. Its handy to most things that you will want. And our room was so quiet with a lovely view of all the happenings in Lewers Street. Shops are adjacent and go on and on. Beach is so easy and close to get to. Buses easy to access and taxis coming to the hotel very frequently. ABC store by the hotel foyer and its takeaway meals rather nice. Tour bookings in the Lobby.Our room was just fine, though it did not have full cooking facilities - but we knew that in advance. Staff were friendly and welcoming and room comfortable and clean. We slept on the murphy bed and it was fine, in spite of my sore neck. Yes, we would go back.

We exchanged our time share for a week on Waikiki. This is a nice resort/hotel. Pool on the roof for timeshare members with an amazing view of the beach. While we are not directly on the beach access is just outside the resort and across the street. We are on a busy corner but have a reasonably priced Denny's in the resort and an ABC store just out our door. All the libations you might want and a decent grocery/souvenir shop, the best part is a great deli. This is an advantage because the imperial has kitchen area that includes frig microwave and sink. So buy some cereal, milk, rum and come and some coffee. You are good for the week! We have an efficiency. I was a bit worried but the the Murphy bed is good and plenty of space, including a balcony for the two of us. Or for a couple with little children the couch is a fold out. Aloha!!

We were a bit apprehensive about this place because of some reviews I had read on another site. We got into Honolulu 2 days earlier and stayed in a hotel, so we drove by to take a look at the location. We called ahead about the parking so they told us to drive up in front of the ABC store and we would be met there by valet parking and we could just go in and register. That went by so smoothly with a happy welcome and helpful guys. Registration went the same way, no sales talk or invitation to any. What a surprise! Before our room assignment, we asked where were we going to be, hopeful it wasn't where we would have to look at the trash cans. It took a few minutes, and was placed on the 23rd floor. We had a 1 bedroom unit, comfortable for 3 adults. Bedroom and bathroom are small but functional with lots of bathroom towels. Murphy bed in the living room was comfortable and already made up. We had 2 balconies (1 off the bedroom and the other off the living room) with resin chairs and little tables. We ate breakfast out there and enjoyed views of the Sheraton Waikiki, Royal Hawaiian, the beach and the surfers. We also enjoyed night time views of the lights, and the trade winds was wonderful. We even slept with our doors open. The kitchen is small but adequately equipped with a small fridge, toaster and microwave/convection oven. Everything worked. Concierge also helped us with some tours and shows. Everybody was helpful.. We didn't use the laundry, swimming pool, spa or any of the other facilities. It's a great location with ABC store, Denny's, lots of restaurants, shopping, beach and the bus.

Had a studio unit here Jan 20 to January 27 and it was really enjoyable so booked it again for next year. The units have a fridge and microwave , no stove and a Murphy be that was very comfortable. The pool itself was on floor 26 with a great view and it was heated so was very nice. There were two outdoor hot tubs on floor 3.The owners lounge on the 25 floor was really something special with tv's , leather couches , cooking facility and a great view of the ocean. Many would go up there to watch the sunset every night and to see if the green flash would happen when the sun went down. Right next door there was an ABC store with a great deli and a few dow from it was an Italian restaurant called Giovanni's which had excellant pizza. They had a happy hour from 3-5 with free cheeze pizza but did not make it for happy hour. Go to the Shorebird for their buffet breakfast which is excellant but their sunset supper steak wasn't good at all. Get 50% off the second meal with a coupon at the Shorebird and and save your receipt for future meals with a 50% discount off your second meal.Make sure you go to the Cheese cake Factory if its open due to a fire at the end of January. Great food , great prices and great service. If you go at six expect a 40 minute wait , at seven an hour or more. Not much of a wait at 530 , maybe 10 minutes.

My husband and I did an exchange through II. Really wasn't sure which way to go because we had the option of the Marriott Ko Olina or this for the same price. Gorgeous hotel or Location? Which do you choose?? Location. All the reviews are correct when they say this place is dated. That is probably an understatement. I will say it only refers to the rooms. The common areas are not that bad. The owners lounge was so dead, we could go up to the huge balcony and watch the waves all by ourselves. A few times we grabbed a bottle of wine and snacks and cards and went up there. The lounge has glasses and utensils etc so you don't have to bring that from your room. Having a kitchen was great for breakfast and drinks. A whole week in Waikiki was enough though. Ideally you do one week here and one week at Ko Olina or somewhere quieter on the island.

We stayed at the Imperial around the Christmas holidays as a result of a timeshare purchase. I was a little concerned by some of the negative reviews so I called the hotel a number of times to ensure that we were not stuck in a room on a low floor. Well, when we arrived (3 adults/2 kids), we were told that we had been assigned a room on the 5th Floor. At that point, I basically begged the front desk for a room on a higher floor. i was then sent to the timeshare rental/reservation office on the 2nd Floor, where I pretty much begged again...It seemed to work because we ended up with a room on the 23rd Floor. From the balcony, we had a sliver of a view of the ocean. As many have said, the rooms are tiny and dated - a flash back to the 70s! The ceilings were super low, and it was a very tight fit for the five of us in a 1 bedroom/2 bath. My Mom and daughter slept on the double bed in the bedroom; my husband and I were on the murphy bed in the living room and my 7 year old slept on the sofa bed. The bed in the bedroom takes up most of the room and the bathroom in that room is tiny. You can't open the bathroom door if someone is standing at the closet. I felt like we were constantly bumping into each other! There was small microwave and refrigerator in the room and the electric burners worked. However, the oven in our room did not work. We had to purchase all the cleaning supplies ourselves. There is tiny pool on the 27th floor, and there is a nice party room/kitchen for owners on the 26th floor with lovely views. We only went up there once but heard that it is first come/first serve to use the kitchen up there. We did our laundry a few times and laundry area (off the parking garage) was pretty busy. The staff at the front desk and the valets who parked our car were very friendly and helpful. The facility needs a huge upgrade but that's not their fault. Time share management should really refuse to all this hotel to be a part of the network of time share hotels! On the positive side, as many have said, it is very conveniently located. We rented a car at the airport (parking on a weekly basis is slightly less), and were able to quickly get around town. It was convenient to have in/out privileges. On the days we did not want to drive, we could quickly get to several restaurants around the Imperial. ABC is more expensive than a regular grocery store but the location under the Imperial had great supplies - I was able to make a great eggs & bacon & toast breakfast the first morning with awesome kona coffee - all purchased at ABC! We loved being next door to the Halekulani. While dinner at the hotel's formal restaurant is expensive, we discovered the House Without a Key - the more casual, outdoor/indoor eating area at the Halekulani. We had delicious food at very reasonable prices there with fantastic service and live music/hula overlooking the ocean. The only snag is that they don't take reservations but if you go early it is not difficult to get a table. There are some chairs and cocktails tables right in the front, some larger tables under umbrellas a bit further back, or you can sit under a open air house. We preferred the middle option both nights we had dinner there. Thursday nights, they put on a bbq, which was really nice. Whether you are a guest at the exclusive Halekulani or just there for dinner/drinks, the food and service are fabulous! Although we did not go ourselves, we heard that the brunch and daily high tea are lovely. The tea at around $35 per person seemed quite reasonable to us. Again, no reservations and first come/first serve for the high tea. We had Christmas dinner at PF Chang's right down Lewers. Although, I am not a fan of chains, the food and service were really great there. I do recommend reservations because it was very crowded. We spent three days at the beach in Kilua. It was an amazing beach and rarely crowded. At my daughter's request, we went to Wailea Shaved Ice every day! We had a wonderful dinner at Little Village Noodle House in Chinatown one night. They serve delicious authentic Chinese food - I especially liked the hunan/schzewan food and the friendly service. Everything was very fresh and delicious. I also loved the fact that it has a 25/30 Zagat rating and free parking! We also had a great Thai meal at Siam Square although service was a bit disorganized. On our last day in town we had brunch at Lulu's Waikiki. The food was average but the service and views of Waikiki Beach were great.

After reading some reviews we were a little worried about our stay. Should not have worried as we received a great value for money stay in a friendly environment at the best location at waikiki. Room was compact but you pay for what you get, clean and tidy and the fellow guests were happy with their stays. Only gripe was the extremely poor service from Sheryl at the front desk who at two separate occasions just blew off our enquirys and even answered the phone while we were talking to her! Every other staff member were sensational!

Stayed as a timeshare trade. we had been to Hawaii before as our son was miltiary so we were a little familiar with the island. If you are new to the island be sure to have a GPS, it's very helpful. We were very happy with the resort the staff was excellent. We weren't ready for the parking fees, but everyone has to make a living. If you don't want to rent a car the shuttles for the various attractions is only a block away. Ocean & shopping are right there. The beds were comfortable the owners lounge was very nice especially when our flight wasn't til midnite. only problem we had is when the elevator got stuck and it took a little time to get us out. They were very apologetic and even gave us credit for our parking for the week. I would definitely try to stay there when we return. P>S> It can get a little noisiy when the bars close, but I were going where those boys were going I would make noise too! Be sure to appeciate all the military there. They are the reason you can visit there.

Our family stayed here for one week during the last week of July 2012. We have stayed here a few years before in the Banyan suite with a Murphy bed. This time we stayed in the slightly larger Palm suite. Palm suites are corner units with a wall of windows. But we had to leave the curtains closed most of the times due to strong sun. Plus, the view was meh, just the other hotels with a sliver of "ocean view". Although in my previous review I vowed not to stay here again, the location and price drew me back.It's convenient to everywhere, whether one travels by bus, shuttle, taxi, or walking. The hotel is in a central location just down the street from the ultra exclusive, read "expensive", Trump International. On a side note, we stayed at that location fifteen years ago when it was an Outrigger hotel. It was later torn down to build the Trump hotel. So, I guess I can tell people that we've stayed at the Trump :-P We paid $600 for a whole week during the height of summer vacation season. So, for us, it was definitely worth it to stay here. If we paid anywhere close to the quoted price of $225 per night, this would have been a whole different review. All in all, the Imperial of Waikiki offers a great value for the location. It is surrounded by some famous hotels of Waikiki, such as Hale Kulani, Hilton Hawaiian Village, the aforementioned Trump, and many others that are ultra expensive. Although their accommodations I'm sure are much nicer, I feel the Imperial of Waikiki is a great value. Sure, it has the sagging sofa bed and dated kitchen appliances that belong in a museum, but the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Besides, who stays in the room besides to sleep when you're in HAWAII?!

Just a half block from the beach, this hotel is ideally located. It's in a newly renovated area with great restaurants and shops. The hotel has made some improvements and the rooms are nicely maintained. Some of the rooms situated on lower floors are noisy in the early morning when the garbage trucks and recycle trucks are at work. Not a problem on the upper floors. My one complaint is having to pay for computer hook up, even as an owner.

The accommodations were adequate but extremely tight. Even the 2 bedroom/2 bath wasvery small. Not much in the way of amenities. A tiny pool and exercise area are located on the rooftop where wind can play a major role in making use of the facilities. The location is very convienent for access to restuarants, shopping, and transportation. In all, not a bad place but I would not stay there again.

We've stayed at the Imperial for most of our visits to Waikiki. While the rooms are outdated, the location is excellent! The Imperial is 1/2 block from the beach, and 1 block from Kalakaua Avenue, home to most of the shops. About three blocks away is the International Market Place.

My wife and I stayed at the Imperial from Jan 3-10, 2013. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we had moderate expectations for the hotel based on the reviews we've read. That said, we were able to get a pretty good deal using RCI points, and don't usually spend a lot of time in our room so it worked out ok for us. The PRO's:Location, location, location.... The hotel is in a PRIME location. It's 1 block off the beach, and right at the end of the beachwalk, which has plenty of fine restaurants and shopping at your door step. Waikiki beach is just a 2min across the street. It is also near Fort DeRussy military park and museum.There is a great owners lounge on the 27th floor where you can get a great view of the beach, and have access to showers, kitchen and computers - all which come in handy after you've checked out but before you fly out. The price was right and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our first room was located on the 5th floor with an awesome view of the ABC roof top, and some plumbing. We were able to move up to a room on the 15th, facing east (where we could see some water) with no problems.The CON's:The room we stayed in needs updating. The mini kitchen has what appears to be a circa '70's oven, which fits right in with the general look & feel of the place. The bathrooms and bedroom are tiny, in fact the whole room we stayed in (1bdr) was pretty small. Not that big of a deal as long as you don't want to spend a lot of time there. If there were 4 people in there (using the wall bed as well) I think it would be pretty tight.The pool is located on the roof and isn't very appealing. It's a small area, but we really only went up there to see... since, well.. the beach is across the street.Parking isn't cheap.
